LIfCr8Oq_WXKtNBRkgm6Og.text: Newly modeled driving range with good music, alcohol and food. There aren't a lot of places like this in North America, absolutely a highlight of our trip to Arizona (about a 10 min cab ride from Scottsdale). From what I have seen this place can get bumpin' on the weekends and is a really great pre-game option before heading to a club.

CQFHxUjWxAtD5ofUy82-MA.text: Was on the second level and the ground level and enjoyed hitting shots with several friends. The food and drinks were ok but atmosphere was good and fun. Frendly staffers. Prefer the higher floors.

V9npZMfHkNnSTKDoedx-Zg.text: Best #Beer #Fun #TopGolf Great place for parties, family outings or hanging with friends!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Top Golf

gb2AQAJDE6Rs19N_P9Emlw.text: Maybe I should come here at night, get a tee up on a top floor and be on a date but this just wasn't a great time for me. I don't like the fact you can't make a time reservation without money commitment. The hour plus wait to start playing just wasn't worth it. I did like their beer selection and their appetizers were decent (but nothing I would order again). We had the fried pickles, queso with guacamole chips, flatbreads (steak and buffalo) and ice cream cookie. The best app was the buffalo flatbread, the rest were anticlimactic. The service was good but I just felt bored with the golf concept. At the end of the day you are still golfing so if you don't love golfing (I actually do like it) this might not be a fun time for you. It reminded me of bowling where it's continual waiting and confusion on who's turn it is. Next time I think I will just sneak a 6 pack into the driving range and save myself the time and wait!

jta0sFOGYnLQpWKGx2qbng.text: Visited this place last Saturday night for a friend's birthday party. Parking is a problem. At the entrance the staff was informative and helpful to get us on the path to golfing. After paying for the $5 membership we were put in a three hour wait list. (Get your membership online ahead of time or you'll kill 30 mins waiting in line.  To kill some of the time we sat on the third level at the outdoor restaurant /bar area.  Service here was abysmal; but the food was impressive and unexpectedly delicious.  Our waiter admittedly told us tonight was his last shift when we called the manager on duty over.  My girlfriend ordered brisket nachos an hour and a half ago and they never showed up. The manager on duty was careless and asked me "You know this is a popular time, right?".  He did comp us the nachos but was very unprofessional and cold. We saw him visiting other unhappy tables around us, so this wasn't an isolated incident.   The outdoor fans did have misters attached to them and were blowing when we initially sat down which made it bearable. Just before we ordered the misters were turned off and when asked why, the staff told us it was for "safety reasons".  Pro tip: Wear appropriate clothes for the warm atmosphere.  Three hours later our bay was ready. As soon as we got there the touchscreen control panel was broken.  We spend 30 minutes idle while the maintenance crew fixed it. It continued to be buggy throughout the night.   When we finally got to swing the clubs it turned out to be a fun night especially after they comped us an hour. Overall, I'd return but it would be during off-peak hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The golfbag drink. $25. Big enough to share with 2-3 people.

3p9qPuUxVhNSemBI4N57qg.text: This place is awesome. Too bad the service wasn't the same. I am a Platinum member at the Roseville, CA location. The staff there is way better than here in Scottsdale. Most of the Staff did not know what they were doing they were not conscientious I had to continually ask for everything the bay hosts were too busy in little groups talking and laughing rather than helping their customers. Every time I needed something I had to hunt down my bay house because she was never around and never checked on anybody. Too bad you guys can't run a Topgolf like they do and Roseville.

71hER_MrnnM6_JHOOiCFcQ.text: We had an absolute blast here!! A very casual but fun way to golf with drinks and food. All employees were very helpful and we can't wait to come back!

Ciox5SWyBJfwQ_UqCoMAeg.text: Usually this Top Golf is a great experience, however, today we waited 3 hours to get a bay; after being told it was an hour and a half to 2 hour wait. We were not offered any coupons or apologies for the inconvenience, and management was extremely rude and inconsiderate. I will not be returning here and will be telling others to take their business elsewhere.

kbJKW41ucLXkKntLADhsQw.text: Topgolf is a GREAT place to hang out at any given time... I'm not a golfer (at all) but I always have a great time at topgolf. The drinks are a bit expensive but what do you expect? The best part about topgolf is how amazing the food is!! Try the chicken and waffles, nachos, bring a crowd, enjoy a drink, and have lots of fun with your family and friends!! This place is much better than going out on a very busy Friday... But the wait here is just as long - it took 1 1/2 hours on a Friday and pretty much takes at least 30 minutes every time I come (no matter what time or day it is)!

BWulr3ogImRWwKuHPdaQXw.text: Amazing atmosphere and servers are awesome! Love it here! The view is divine! The top balcony with the bar is so neatly designed. Plenty of seating if  go on a busy Sunday brunch. You can sit and wait and have a drink At the bar. The drink menu is a variety of wines, beers, mixed drinks I was not disappointed. Being that top golf is outside maybe bring a light jacket or sweater depending on the Arizona weather. The food was pretty delicious and comes out pretty quickly. It mainly consist of the typical bar foods, sandwiches, burgers, salads. If you get to go At night the course lights up with a variety of colors. We went during the day and it was just as fun!

qoCkcxxMCVmD3S2rkuzoFw.text: We waited 3 hours for a bay. I understand that it's busy on the weekends but that's insane. We also had to park a few blocks away.   The facility and golf is nice but from an overall experience standpoint there's no way I am going back on a weekend night.

03BBSoww4aA7_zt8MCuoXw.text: We had a blast as always! But our bay host/ server CHANDLER was by far the highlight of our night! He was super attentive and felt like one of the crew as soon as he welcomed us! He also made sure we were being safe and had sober rides home! We love you Chandler!! And Adrian was a top notch 2nd in command!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chandler!!!

Dd7-wHZ8j47lGIN0euE37g.text: Came for brunch. Sunrise burger was on point and the Bloody Mary was also good. Great concept as well as good food.

SNviV92RyU5HtNZ2TTKnbA.text: I came here for the first time last week. My friend works here and recommended we spend the evening there with a group of friends. We had a blast. From start to finish the customer service was great. The menu had a wide variety of options. The food was really good and was appropriate for the venue. I also like that there are different game options to chose from. I will be coming back to this location again. Plus the view is absolutely beautiful.

fTxTiV63wfFwD_9cZwh90g.text: This place is cool.  I came here recently for the first time with a buddy of mine to check the place out.  He had been there before and I hadn't swung a club in years.  Needless to say, I dusted off my clubs and we were off.  (Quick tip: you are not allowed to bring in your drivers but you can check them at the desk if you forget to leave them at home.  They have clubs you can use there)  After checking in, we headed over to our bay and checked out the digs.  The bays are pretty cool in that they have places to secure your clubs and comfy sofas to relax on.  We looked at the available games and started working through them.  There are several styles of games you can play based on the different targets that are out on the range.  It can definitely test you and force you to work on your accuracy.  We had a couple of beers and played for a couple of hours.  I have not had the food yet but I have heard that it is pretty good.  For now, I am satisfied, I had fun, and I am excited to come again in the future.

qxtK_roi4_tiIi6n0ZAixw.text: When visiting my friends in Phoenix, we decided to come by to Top Golf. We've been here before multiple times prior to this visit and we've always had a pleasant experience. Recently (June 27th), we decided to stop by. It was around 6:50-7pm when we got to the location. When checking in downstairs to get our bay, we were told we would have to leave at 9 pm since we were under 21, which we were totally fine with considering 2 hours of golf is more than enough. We went upstairs to the third level and were given our bay with no wait time, which was great. We got there and started to play our game. About 10 minutes later our server, Luke, came by. He asked us our ages, and of course, since we were under the age of 21 we had to leave at a certain time. After discovering that we're 17, he said that he'll have to check if we're allowed to stay. We told him what we were told downstairs, but he was a bit uneasy. He left, and as he left, one of our members in our party picked up the menu and wanted to order some sodas and food. When Luke saw him reading the menu, he came by and snatched the menu from my friends' hand and said we aren't allowed to order food. He said you guys can't stay too long. These were his exact words, "You're a liability, not a priority." What is that supposed to mean? We aren't like the other paying customers because we're 17? Keep in mind, it's not even 7:30 pm yet. However, he said that he'll take our drink orders. So, we kindly asked if we can have a couple sodas. It took him almost 20 minutes to bring us soda. After dropping off the soda at our table, it took him no longer than 3 minutes before he came back again shutting down our golf game and kicking us out. He came, covered the screen and said we had to leave. He told my other friend, "I'm giving you one more chance to hit because I'm nice, otherwise you all need to leave." It wasn't even 8 pm. Not only was this handled unprofessionally, it was handled very rudely. Anyways, Luke ends up covering the screen, swipes his employee card, stops the game, and charges us for 30 minutes of gameplay. The way Luke was handling the situation looked like we had done something terrible and it was urgent for us to leave. He told us, "The sodas are on the house." trying to be nice, I guess. At this point, it was very embarrassing because people were staring at us getting yelled at and kicked out for no reason. After leaving the bay, we went downstairs and demanded to speak to a manager. We explained everything to the manager and supposedly he went upstairs and had a "long talk with Luke" as we waited for him to come back. He did confirm with us that we had until 9 pm to play and offered for us to go back. After this terrible experience, we decided to leave and go to Dave and Buster's instead. The manager was very understanding and helped us, but the experience was beyond belief and totally unexpected. Next time I'm in Arizona, I don't think I'm going to be coming here again.

SrEzgbrAUVa2R0MJPhlpNw.text: Amazing place for playing fun golf. It was my first time playing golf and i loved it because it is fun golf. You just stand on a platform and hit the golf ball and try to make it land in different circles. Music is amazing as well so it is a very fun way of playing golf!!!

QfYBnxi3rwtGsCFb9sIaNQ.text: our son/daughter and grandkids suggested us coming here to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday.  It was a lot of fun!  Food was quite good and had a lot of choices from the artery cloggers to the health conscious and the service was pretty good.  We had our 3 yr. old grandson with us and our 1 yr.  old grand-daughter.  The 3 yr.  old really enjoyed swinging the golf club and cheered us all on.  There are 3 levels-they put us on the 3rd-which was a bit of a scary move since there was that huge open area for the little ones to think of as "fun"-that was the only snag, we wish they would have put us on the first floor.  But it was so much fun to celebrate w/ just more than dinner or a movie!

FEJ08HDADdDzNAVEl1tGBg.text: Always a great time. This place is for anyone that wants to chill with friends and hit (or try and hit) some golf balls and have some fun. Can get pretty loud, they always have music blaring. Causal/energetic ambiance. TVs for sports at every bay.

ZGDtmeXg0PdSVxBBkRF44A.text: Never been to a topgolf before and was so impressed by our server Ellie. She was so fun and helpful and always attentive to all of our needs. Will always ask for her to work our future outings!

kZBZRbu29fjwumpJ-Zi4UQ.text: Damn, that was fun. Ordering drinks and food can be a bit of a hassle and needs work but the server was freakin' cool/chill. I guess with a group as big as we had, on a very busy night, things can get hectic, but every thing came out great. Thanks!

reXZSxp-esb170egGcKVAA.text: I went to TopGolf yesterday as part of a Team Building event where I work.  It was okay.  I do not normally golf.  Despite that, it was fun enough to shoot a few balls.  I am not a good golfer though.

yIeolnH4GrdZmwy-TxW39w.text: Coming from San Diego for the weekend came in on a Saturday. The wait was 45 minutes to an hour which was all good figured we would just grab some drinks while we wait. Upon ordering a drink at the bar was told vertical (VALID) driver licenses of legal drinking age are not accepted by top golf policy. When we asked the bartender the specifics she was  extremely not polite and couldn't explain the reasoning although she confirmed the drivers license was valid and the member of our party was infact 22. Following when ordering a pitcher of beer we were "helped" by another extremely not polite bartender. We were excited to take our friends here but really disappointed by the service and the employees. Probably won't be back.

p6_diXOPvsQvPoEaTuZisQ.text: So much fun! It's complicated to check in for some reason, but once you get situated, it's a good time. Food is good too.

ok3K76CRRQvwR5fYjNqn3Q.text: Visited this location with my husband on February 7 Saturday night. He is a great golfer and figured it be a good place to check out. Everyone was so upbeat and friendly. If you don't golf no problem. It's still a blast. The staff was extremely informative and welcoming. We were on the first floor bottom level because that's what was available but I didn't feel like it was a bad thing at all. I know I heard from people the top is the best but it was still a great experience. We were in lane 20 something pretty centered and I wish I could remember my servers name because I'd request him again (red haired guy I believe) because I'm so picky especially with my tequila and he was extremely accommodating and also helped us navigate the games and letting us know of events coming up. So we are sure to be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fun times!

U4lRv8GYX6goQL6WO9dtOQ.text: Beautiful facility alot of fun. Nice ambient place to hit your balls and get them washed....

X7Myo_YXCSuCjy6l-rhc5w.text: Absolutely awesome!  Went here after our conference was done and we had an enjoyable evening unwinding and relaxing.  Course is smaller than the other TG we've been to (but we're told that's bc some other courses are converted ranges).  Doubt "pros" come to play here but everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.  Smoking is not allowed on any floor (different from the one we went to).  Elevators available.  Drivers not allowed.  Bathrooms were super clean.  Food was great.  Drinks were full!  Service was friendly from beginning to end.

7um9XoYRYsBRBwJKJDKT0Q.text: Such a fun night! Good times beating the boys at their own game. What do you get when you mix a dance club, a driving range, and darts??? TopGolf!!! I was against the concept before coming, but it really is a great time! Awesome service, and food was decent. Trey & Megan were fun :)

tQQPzxLb2K8ruGTD3Timow.text: Seems like a nice place if you are looking for a drink and a lite meal. The morning burger that I had was very good.  Took a few minutes to be served but once served, the service was good.  Bottom line is I would go back.

ssvl5SJ68iJSO_1u-eqjjA.text: Atmosphere is cool but I would rather spend 40 bucks on a twilight round that would last me 2 hours for 9 holes vs 40 bucks for 1 hour. To me prices are super inflated! Its a golf range you can drink at lets be honest.

itughggTJDhcFF7EcD_w5g.text: Ingenious idea! Never played golf before.. at all, this was so fun. My boys loves it, fun for all ages.  You can make the game very competitive or very relaxed,  its up to you. Great food, service was ok. Still 5 stars, because we went for the game.. and the game was great!

G-6RqURjCBWJEYN8CV9jXQ.text: Such a great alternative to a bar! Being active or just hanging out people watching. Love this place, we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Second floor
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View from the second floor

jdInGkfMQAy2F223xnnEkw.text: Imagine bowling and darts combined with golf. They serve food in here and it's golf driving range combined.  The food was delicious and I have a lot of fun with my mates. Recommended for hanging out / shooting the crap

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Topgolf

eXkB1MDazGYXa87atRT_9w.text: So last week I came in with a rowdy group of eleven, we opted for two bays side by side because we all wanted to play, we ordered over half of the appetizers and kept our beverages coming and we played for two hours, not only was this immensely fun, we experienced amazing service from the get go. We walked in and were immediately greeted and asked about our group and our day and if we've ever been there before, most of our group hadn't ever been before, so we got our lifetime players card(s) and again AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE, or maybe just conversational skills, but everyone was smiling. We were brought up to our bays and our group divided up into two groups.  Our waiters name was Philip I believe and he was darling, and after some begging swung a club for us, the guy who brought us to our table, checked on is regularly too! if I remember correctly there were two guys that also stood out to our group that just completely exemplified amazing customer service and their names were Nico and Mitch- thank you for a wonderful night- you guys rock!

IhhYt2KAQUkhJ8TKOZ3rng.text: Michelle from Boston AND Drew were our favorite!!! We left our phone at top golf and went to the casino and they brought it back to us plus they were super nice and accommodating! We will def be coming back just because of them!! We love them, we work in old town in the industry and they're customer service was beyond 5 star but that's the highest we can rate so 5 star plus plus plus!!!

Rs8XpIHZ4Le2oEsIC4_Qqw.text: Awesome staff, had my wife's Birthday party they're Kay might and had great experience.  Ask for the manager Chris or Tyson

p4L8FwOvYd8d8Thgug5J5Q.text: Becoming a Platinum Member at Topgolf Scottsdale is one of the best decisions I have made for my business.  I have the opportunity to have a bay as part of my Platinum Membership at no additional cost.  I have 3-8 meetings a week here which all my clients thinks is great.  The staff here is the best.  Super responsive and willing to help in any way possible.  I would recommend it to anyone who is looking to not only have an amazing "office" but who would like to increase your business in a very fun way.

PDCrjNbIyFvhMXbzyc4QlQ.text: Amazing service. Ask any of the 500 staff a question and undoubtedly it will be "yes". There's something for everyone. Even the long waits for golf bay on the weekend don't matter since there's so much to do.  I only give it 4 stars instead of 5 b/c the parking lot is too small on busy nights forcing you to park on the street and walk a long distance.

J7J8sHrZT9ymxMPNkUTiRg.text: I don't know why this location lacks compared to Gilbert. We were there this past weekend and the service at the bar was AWFUL on he entry floor. We literally had to flag down the distracted guy and girl bartending by waving or calling out, which we would normally never do. But after waiting 15...20...30 minutes it was ridiculous. They were too busy chatting with their coworkers waiting for drinks to be made. Not to mention the both of them were so rude. Never a smile never a thank you...horrible attitudes. It wasn't busy it was past 11pm and they still sucked. The guy even forgot my drink and when I reminded him he rudely slammed the bottle down I'm shocked it didn't foam up. The games are always fun, location is well maintained, but the service is garbage.

r4sV6olZalCUKPL9Wd48Og.text: Our bay was very glitchy and despite a neat atmosphere, good food/drinks, and friendly staff, it was not a good first experience at TopGolf. The system randomly froze and reset mid-play during our very first game, losing all stats/scores. Then the ball dispenser repeatedly quit working and required 7-8 resets by the wait staff and finally a long visit by maintenance with no resolution after. All in all, we lost at least an hour of gameplay. We were offered extended playtime but had dinner reservations to make. We were never offered a bay transfer. Overall, TopGolf was fun when things ran smoothly but that was rarely the case.

6-uD_PiMTUM_w2PEaV3KeA.text: Good experience with friends!! Service was excellent and is kid friendly. The menu options had something for everyone from fruit to hamburgers! The margarita and alcohol options are good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

alWZi4iq7aRMin4HRWvkeA.text: Fun place but be prepared to spend a grip of money here. We had a group of 4 playing on a Sunday afternoon and not only did the bill come out to $150 but they also charged us a reservation fee. Watch out as this is a True FEE and doesn't even go towards your game play. You just pay it, period. That was a bit disappointing.   Other than being way too expensive we actually had fun and would like to go again but will be very careful about what we spend there. Definitely a family friendly place but I can't imagine most families could afford it.

EUUFl2ftj94vsI_ZHS3y7w.text: Not a fan.  Contrived, with terrible rental clubs (of course with top golf brand) and low flight balls.  Had to buy a glove because of course they couldn't provide one.  They charge to become a member, charge for gloves, charge for the bay, charge for the food, charge for the drinks, charge for the air to breathe.    Scoring system is a joke.  The targets are like drains so everything tunnels to them, especially the ugliest struck shots.  Only thing that was good was the service.  Won't be back.

2rY0ST7i9NpQAPJH-S4dAw.text: This place is a blast!  Good times with friends and family.   It does get really busy so be ready to deal with that. I have only gone at night time around 7-11 PM and its a good time. Waiters and waitresses were really nice but seemed a bit overworked.   Be careful because it is too easy to spend a lot of $$ here.

E79IudKzUQOOK_OX_bXlkQ.text: We went here not to long ago for my sons birthday.  It was our first time at top golf and we had a blast.  This is definitely better than going to a driving range and a lot more fun.  They had some good food to order, mostly bar type food but when you're hitting balls that's really all you need.  Just note that it can get pricey (food and booth rental by hour) but if you got the money, you will have a great time here.

9vAvFSYdagjMXdSAhTec3Q.text: A nice idea for combining sports with food and beverages!  This is a nice place to come and spend an hour or two having a cool drink and getting a bit of exercise, although you are very unlikely to burn off more than you consume.  As a very inexperienced, occasional golfer this place was just about right for me. They provide a set of clubs at each spot along with table and chairs, as well as a server to bring food and drinks.  I did find the setup a bit difficult to get used to, though, because normally at a driving range you are on flat ground, but here you are as many as three stories high so it's a bit hard to judge your hitting the ball because you are trying to hit targets that are below you.   Anyway, it was a fun hour or so, but I'm not sure if I would get used to the difference between there and a traditional driving range, but l do plan on trying it again sometime.

D8TPy9SLaktFCyc_NZn84g.text: Came here for a bday! Lexi, Josh(in the bar) and Anthony have been soo amazing! The food was great we miss the crab cakes, however the 26$ bottle of prosecco is amazing!!

cQdntgV0pzC7e-CYMoPf9w.text: They charge $56 to reserve a bay and that money DOES NOT count towards any of the game fees, drinks, or food you order. Can you imagine paying $56 just to make a reservation at a restaurant??? It is absolutely outrageous, misleading, and basically extortion. I will never go back and I will tell everyone I know how they completely rip people off with this bullsh&#t reservation fee nonsense.

iBszuu4v6L-WSGcHAQzPYw.text: Came to Top Golf for my birthday last night w friends and had a blast!   We did not have a reservation and was told the wait was 2 hrs. We decided to grab some drinks and apps. Moscow mules were tasty and tater tots were crispy:) We only waited an hour and got called to our bay.   Our group had experienced golfers and first timers and everyone was able to have fun. Such a cool concept!   It took 5 of us about 1.5 hrs to complete our game.   Can't wait to come back!

ahPTof-gaJL49pOGHxJefw.text: Ladies, if you want a man to completely fall in love with you, learn to hit a golf ball! The first time I ever hit a ball of the tee my husband literally turned to me and said "honey, that's the sexiest thing you've ever done." It's that simple...  Came to TopGolf for a company offsite and was totally blown away by its sheer size and awesomeness! Three humongous stories of driving range stations that would make any avid golfer drool with anticipation. I'm from Honolulu where we don't have anything remotely this cool in a PGA fanboy meets Vegas bottle service kind of way. I learned to golf a few years back so that I could play in a tournament and I've always been grateful that I at least know the basics. It was so much fun to hit the ball off the tee and watch the points rack up on the screen. Out of all the team building activities we've had, this is definitely my favorite because of the physical activity and fantastic food + drink. Even if you're not big into golf, it's cool to hang out and lounge on the couches while watching your teammates play.

hvZ64jRk6OlKwsx61A4xSA.text: I talked with Lissette there and SHE WAS AWESOME!!! As a business owner myself I can't tell you how invaluable having great staff is. I had some family in town he's never been to topgolf before, they were able to really make some accommodations so we felt welcome and they've gained a lifelong fan. Thank you guys

eiJiU9pFJwH0txksK4WdUw.text: I went to this venue as a team building event with some coworkers.  I had never been but enjoyed myself immensely. Great fun for beginners and pros with a fun, welcoming atmosphere. Very simple format and I must give kudos to the servers for their superb service. The pricing is super reasonable fir a bay. The menu items are very tasty and modern, also reasonably priced. I will definitely be back with friends and family.

EVBjezCait4La4Y-0idwCQ.text: Have been here a handful of times and always enjoy the environment, food and drinks. Tonight I ordered a grilled cheese at the bar. Shortly after ordering I asked for no pepper jack cheese and was told by the bartender (Brian or Ryan) that he needed manager approval to change it and that he would get to it in a little. After watching him for the half hour, I knew he hadn't contacted a manager to change the order. Before transferring to our bay, I asked if he changed the order and he let me know he didn't. I said that was fine that I would just send it back when it came. Although the bartender was not helpful at all and basically ignored my request, the manager Andrew P came immediately to help and was very accommodating. Very great service on his part.

ksCo73vkUBZXtscAk3b-BQ.text: We had a great time. It was pretty busy on a Sunday afternoon. We waited an hour and a half for a spot. Luckily they text you and a casino is nearby.

5eZBd7spJ9D1oJM4PUEgbg.text: We called to see if we needed reservations for a group of 8 and the person on the phone said we needed to get in touch with an event coordinator. They were not helpful over the phone at all.   On a Thursday, we did expect to have to wait or even not get in line at all.  We went to get register for two bays, the person asked if we had a reservation. We said no, we called and they said we cannot get a reservations for a group less than 12.   They said that's a unique situation. Not having a reservation for a group of 8. They even called their manager out to clarify that we didn't have reservations for a group of 8. They politely told us the wait was too long and we wouldn't be able to get on the waiting list or play tonight.  They gave us $10 off for next time we come it.  Poor customer service, not professional and just straight up rude.

Cv3lYouEwyt4tgVZ0g8Sbw.text: Kim Chacho and dez took amazing care of us on our recent business trip. Such a great time and we hit some dingers....this place is great.

tTORp0JqtmnMbWFMMl7AWA.text: I had heard of this place and checked it out while at Spring Training.  We first went there on Sunday night around 7PM. The wait for a bay was 1:45. So we went to the casino next door. However we got to see what the place looked like and checked it out with the intention of coming back Monday morning, assuming it would be less crowded.  We were right. Place opened at 9AM, we got there at 10:30AM and walked right in.  The four of us played for an hour and ordered some chicken and biscuit sliders and orange juice from the server. We had a lot of fun taking swings with the clubs they provided. It was like going bowling.  Because we went before noon we got the cheapest rate and paid about $60 total for the hour we played including the breakfast food and drinks we ordered. Then we left and went to a 1:00 baseball game in Mesa.   TopGolf was fun and I think we will be going back every time we are in Arizona for Spring Training. Good value!

ONS60l9cgfL0_x-R-ynzww.text: Super disappointed. Came here with friends and was turned away by the manager for being over intoxicated. The server was very incompetent and did not understand what an establishment was like with beer and food. First responders were not appreciated. Manager was maybe 25, and had no idea what intoxicating was. Apparently you cannot drink beer and have a good time here.

80fVDWn18J64Y4JYgf1dQg.text: The second most fun you can have with a pole in your hand....  But really, SO FUN! It's the perfect mix of leisure and adventure. The multi-level driving range is a good time for avid golfers as well as first timers (like myself). Plus there's food and alcohol, which is always a bonus.   HOW IT WORKS: Each player pays a one-time $5 membership fee and then just pay by the hour for your games (anywhere from $25-$45 per hour depending on the time of day--earlier=cheaper). You can have up to 10 people per golf bay (the hourly rate just applies once--not to each person). Golf clubs are provided (but you can always bring your own!). Once you get to your bay, just swing away and rack up points by landing your balls in the targets. Each ball has a tracker so the screen tells you exactly where it landed and keeps score.   BOTTOM LINE: Go. Drink. Play. Be merry.

KUpIFGvHer_m0XeSYAB3uA.text: This is the perfect place to go for any occasion if you're looking for food, drinks, and games (well of course, golf, but also shuffleboard, foosball, and a few TV games).   We arrived on a busy Saturday afternoon and waited about an hour or so for our reservation. We grabbed drinks and food at the bar and also played a few games of shuffleboard and foosball! Definitely helped pass the time. I would highly recommend making a reservation.  Once at the driving range, anyone can join in on the fun - I have never done any sort of golfing besides mini golf and had a fantastic time. You can play a continuous game with your friends until the time runs out. Each hour cost is based on when you are there (cheaper for earlier, more expensive later). Seats were comfy wherever we were, lots of things to do, and heaters at every station in case it was cold like the time we came. The whole place is three stories! Hopefully you get a station more in the center because shooting into the targets would be much easier.  All of the servers were great from the bar to our table at our station. Fried pickles, fries, and s'mores were perfect to go with our drinks. The only thing I did not like was the jalapeno strawberry margarita - such a weird mix of flavors and had the consistency of syrup (ew..). All the other drinks were delicious though.  WOULD RECOMMEND! I just wish there was a Top Golf in Southern California.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Strawberry jalapeño (wouldn&#39;t recommend) fries, fried pickles (would recommend!!)
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

qfT6lANQHzYzND98cPlmfQ.text: OMG! I wish we had a TopGolf here in San Diego. Please....come to San Diego!  We stopped in here while we were visiting family in Phoenix as a fun little day outing. I'm a big golfer so was a little hesitant on what this "Top Golf" was all about but it turned out to be SO MUCH FUN!  If you're not familiar with Top Golf, it's like a driving range on steroids. No, on crack! First off, the facilities were gorgeous and very well organized. You are greeted right when you walk in, there is an area to the right to check in and get your clubs if you don't have any--and then you're escorted to your private section. Each station has a terminal/computer where you enter the player names and the games you wish to play.    What I loved most was how each area was under a large covered patio to protect you from the elements and each had a very comfortable seating area with tables where you can sit, relax, order appetizers, drinks and even have a full blown lunch/dinner if you wanted. While everyone was ordering cocktails, I was so grateful they had an all natural Ginger Ale. I was going to town with those babies.   We had 4 people in our party and we all had different skill levels so the pre programmed games were perfect. I can't recall the names of the games we selected but random targets were given and each of us had a certain amount of balls to hit each one. The closer you got to the target, the more points you got. It was an absolute blast. I also had limitations because I'm preggo but it could not have been a more perfect outing for us. We were having so much fun, we played for hours.   The table service was fantastic and they're on it. As soon as our drinks or appetizers were getting low, they replenished quickly. We thought their prices on the food were pretty reasonable too. We thought we would only be there for an hour to play one game...we ended up spending hours there.   I'm sure we'll be back again during one of our annual trips out to Phoenix.

iXLA16QhqwucqeQ3Sltg1g.text: Party of 8, and an awesome time. Our host, Luke Lourie, was fantastic! He gave us tips for our golf swing, recommended food, and took photos with 4 different cameras. He even tuned in the Bronco game for us!! We really had such a great time, and Luke was instrumental in that. You have a great employee!! Can't wait come back again. All the food was good too, and bloody Mary's were awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

2jJ3_lMaElIsafQWqwhL0w.text: Topgolf is fun for everyone. Went here for a bachelor party last weekend and several of the guys were not really golfers and this was an event they could still be involved in outside of actually hitting the links. Heading back next Thursday for a work offsite and super excited! Also, being right beside Talking Stick is always a plus.

2uE9EdjCUsRcI1B3ElHNtA.text: I freakin loved TOPGOLF in Scottsdale. It was a blast! Think of a huge golf driving range that is high on testosterone. It's got the golf aspect, mixed with the team and competition aspects of bowling, with the scoring aspect of darts.  You get a bay with a computer that tracks where you hit your ball. And there are targets on the range worth various points. Hit your targets and score.   Besides the golf, they've got crap loads of bars and have all kinds of booze in bottles and on draught. Plus, their food is great too!  Topgolf is a place to have competitive fun, eat fresh food, get plastered and chase tail. It's super popular, and there's 2-3 hour waits on weekends to get a driving bay. Crazy stuff!  Can't wait til one comes to the Bay Area!  5 stars!!!

Kq8wAzyHnHcIr5Nh68rnSg.text: I was staying at the Hampton Inn right across the field from top golf. I was in a skirt and flip-flops and it was very easy to walk across the field to get to the spot.  This place was lit up and three stories of amazing condo golf!!! I was only here on a business trip but this is a Great spot! Easy to get started, everyone was welcome... Server comes to you with cocktails and food. Clean, organized and professional! Fun fun fun! I would come here again and again! I wish we had one in RENO!

BgtDQwm4vhBjGqu-bZYyzQ.text: Have been here over 50 times since opening a couple years ago. Spent a lot of money on VIP passes to jump the line and even more on food and drinks. The past three times I have been there I noticed many changes for the worse. First, even though I have been there 50+ times they act like it is my first and make me wait for somebody to show me how the bay works.  Annoying as heck.  Had to wait, even though I paid $50 for a VIP pass, an extra 20 mins for somebody to show me to the bay. Second, the service is horrible. They need to train the staff.  Rude, no empathy, no please and thank you, no nothing.  Third, the bartenders are the worst.  They have no idea how to make a great drink except pouring a beer. Do not have a margarita, they are horrible.  Fourth, the bay we were in you cannot change the channel on TV because it was broken.  They are not keeping up on maintenance.  Fifth, the balls kept getting stuck and not coming out.  Had to have them reset it 5 times in 2 hours.  My opinion is they have leadership and management issues. Focused on profit now and not long term.  They could care less about a long term loyal customer and think they can keep attracting first time visitors. They will not make it 5 years from now if they do not change the service

TXgWjSMZPZeV8Z421wNv2A.text: Gameplay is fun but horribly disorganized facility.  Bartenders are slow. We could have had 2 drinks before they even took our order.  No reservations taken unless you pay 50 dollars to skip queue, which we only found out late.   Half the bays were open yet we were made to wait 2 and a half hours, after which we left.  Drinks were good, once we got them, food was decent except for the chips, which were disgusting. Like Doritos without flavoring.  Music was awful.  Typical Scottsdale douche baggery, except with no sense of business and lame customer service.  Prices are also on the high end making the experience even worse.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Open bay galore, long wait.
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Almost all bays were open yet they made us wait close to 3 hours.

xzAlIGDS8zQHhjrFqgJ1lQ.text: This was our first time to this Top Golf. It was SO much fun! The atmosphere was fantastic & the customer service was superb! Highly recommend!

oh-ZgZCXEAR5D81InMUDoA.text: So fun! They have someone there to teach you how to swing! The food is awesome (and so are the beverages!) new to town with friends? Do this.

m14s7Ws4OYWi-A51-GIH-g.text: I've been golfing for decades. This means I've hit balls at driving ranges varying from the run-down municipal necessities all the way up to fancy, all-grass, manicured country club ranges. But Topgolf? This takes things to the next level. I've never done it like this.   Chipped balls? Computerized leaderboards? Multiple game styles? Up to 5 players per tee? Couches, drink service, and decent food? Yeah. This place is dope.   Topgolf is not the kind of place I'd go just to practice golf. Too impractical and too expensive. Also too crazy packed. But it's definitely a place I'd go with friends for a couple of hours of fun. Or, as on a recent visit, for something like a team-building offsite. It's so much fun that even non-golfers can enjoy it.   There's not a lot more that I can say. Make a reservation and go today. I hear one is coming to Portland, Oregon. I'm stoked about that!

uVttWAP1zOVl7zmo8026qQ.text: Loved this place!  The food was delicious and the service was top notch.  A special shout out to Jim the Manager there.  He's an A+, class act.  Made us feel special and like VIPs.  When I got home, I realized that I had lost my receipt for our corporate event with the best service.  Thanks, Jim!  We'll be back for sure and we'll be going to the one in Chicagoland area as well.

ekZ_g9tkLHPhrshge6ItFw.text: This place is INCREDIBLE!!  Disclaimer: I've never done this before... holy smokes people from getting signed up to getting to our bay, the bay host service... everything has been EXCELLENTLY SUPERB!!! It's a mission from where we live, but I promise I'll use any excuse to come back. Also the food and drinks are ON POINT!!! Thank you Topgolf for a fantastic experience

jcwhDMxsErsmUAjZ8Ib-uQ.text: Loved the concept of Topgolf. Great place to bring non-golfers. Pretty much anyone can do it. The member registration is $5 per person on top of what you pay for a spot, which is kind of a funny charge. If you can remember to save your plastic membership card, then you won't have to pay to get a reprint on a return visit. Overall, everyone had fun. The server was very chill and I appreciate that she wasn't pushy about trying to sell food and drinks. The food reminds me of Chili's or Applebee's type fare and I like that they sell local, Arizona beer.  The staff did such a great job with our large group. We wanted to get the top floor and two adjacent spots and they were very accommodating. There was a little bit of a wait, but it was worth it to have our group together.

6f7DvSPjfCEwjlzR6AfB4g.text: Any time my husband wants to celebrate anything, his first suggestion is Top Golf. We always have a great experience and have a fun filled time. Last night was no different. We chose to go to Top Golf as part of our anniversary, and we had an amazing time (as usual). This time, however, we were pleasantly surprised with the amazing service and friendliness displayed by many of the Top Golf employees. Our server at the bar kept the drinks flowing and provided outstanding service. Additionally, Michelle (I think she was a shift lead of some sort) made us feel at home and really made our night special. Overall, a fun place with delicious food and drinks and even better customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

yossLxmyxa90qAKt23cFMg.text: This place is truly amazing. It is a golf driving range with multiple games to play with friends. The whole place is a big party, yet awesome for families too. I had a flatbread pizza which was spectacular and my buddy had the steak sandwich and he loved it.  If you are a serious golfer, this is for you. If you aren't, it's definitely for you. I stink and had a blast!!  I will be going back for sure!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Driving range

w6QA9UxA4jaq2DeYOjbNnQ.text: Love everything about this place good food, great service, definitely one of my favorite Sunday Funday spot and only a parking lot away from the casino! THANK YOU DANIELLE FOR THE AWESOME EXPERIENCE!   Avoid any guy in a neon green shirt with douchebag features, most likely gonna be rude and not know what they're doing :)

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lovely day

xHDUGyzNlVF-5EVDFQPL8w.text: Topgolf is like a playground for adults! So much fun, grab a pitcher of beer, and swing some clubs. I suck at the whole golf part, but who cares? It's more like bowling - nobody is good, and nobody cares. The food isn't great (stick to the basics) but the drinks are great.  I even saw a bloody mary bar that had all the fixins - I will be back to attack that bad boy on my next trip!  The $1.00 card replacement thing is stupid, especially in this age of computers. Why not make an electric wallet item? We will overlook that for now.

ys5nfz5wgXNuVDsHKRG14g.text: How much fun is this place?  My husband's company management has been talking about doing a corporate function here so we thought we'd stop in and get the membership cards out of the way.  I love that there was a woman up front to greet us and guide us where we need to go.  Byron took excellent care of us at the membership counter and he's a fellow Iowan and Hawkeye fan so he's got my vote for Employee of the Month.    Then we walked around and checked out everything.  We really liked how roomy each section is with plenty of seating and a couple of TVs.  The range looks like a lot of fun with a variety of targets, and I also noticed how clean everything was.    We cruised through the bar and noticed there are some large booths with their own TV so you can sit with your group and watch your game of choice.  They also have a gaming area for those not swinging a club.  There were a lot of staff around and they were smiling and making sure people had what they needed, or answering any questions.    While on the way to the restrooms I noticed they have some meeting rooms and one group had booked one for their fantasy league draft.  We got a look at their catered food of wings and some other munchies and it all looked and smelled delicious.  I didn't snag any as I walked by, I swear!    Even though my golf clubs are only in the house as potential weapons now and I call myself a reformed golfer, I would definitely look forward to a corporate event or night out with out-of-town guests at Topgolf.  GREAT place!

wFdADFwkUMM8G2uCAgbFFg.text: So I got here and I ordered 6 shots. First 3 were liquor and the next 3 where ordered chilled.... chilled means with ice. Do not order chilled shots. It means watered down....

nj1AAFRqY2_QMwxfXGg8oA.text: I'll start this off by saying I'm not an English major but I'm a business owner. With over ten people in our group one person acts out of line they punish everyone. Not happy with how the manager handlers the situation.

r6hiBaTYqc5cgp26xXm6eg.text: It's a great experience for friends and family, only concern I have is how the food prices are way to high. But still LIT!!!!

7wTt0Qf2gcz9daOb172Bqw.text: We went there for a family outing and to have a celebration for my son.  We booked the venue  through Kali, she is great.  I had mentioned it to her that we have religious restrictions as far as food is concerned. Since our outing was booked as an event, we had our own ambassador and food buffet. The food was not prepared according to our restrictions and even though they fixed it, no one really touched the brisket and I paid a lot of money so that wasn't okay. They also need to provide booked events with more than one ambassador, since one person really can't handle a large group.  Overall wasn't bad but could have been better.

PmMO4nAND3GpFwNyaavN6A.text: WATCH YOUR BELONGINGS! BAD EXPERIENCE WITH STAFF WALKING OFF WITH OUR STUFF! We had a bday party for a friend. Staff was great helping us get set up.  We gave our friend a golf putter as a gift that he had set by the table.  This was a limited edition piece that definitely stood out from what Topgolf has.  It suddenly went missing, after looking everywhere we asked to see a manager.  When he came over we told him since we were in a corner it wasn't as if someone had walked by and taken it; there had only been staff where it had been placed.  The manager became very defensive saying we shouldn't be blaming his staff and he would look at the security camera.  A few minutes later a staff member came over with the putter saying it was in Lost and Found.  Really? So they took it from us and put it in Lost and Found and didn't make sure it wasn't someone's? Very unlikely story.  Also the manager never came back to apologize or anything.  On top of it while we were looking for the putter the wait staff cleared our drinks that we weren't finished with so we had to purchase more.

Jp06Mi31tosW66Ci0HpXww.text: Such an amazing place to go and have a great time with family and friends! The past two times my family and I have come here we have ran into Michelle and she is always such a great help when we are getting to our bay! She always insures that we are all set up and ready to have a good time!

P7dMlHiQ7tVSvEKb7MZyWg.text: Cool facility.  Impossible to get in.  We were told 3 hour wait.  We are going on hour 4.   We haven't touched a ball.  They keep saying that there is two people in front of us and now there are 4 people in front of us.  How is that possible? Super disappointed so far.

J_0wMNJIq54pe9RViyc6Fg.text: This place is an experience, and there's a definite buzz there every time I've come.  When ever someone from out of town visits, I always make it a point to take them here to play some games, and have a brew or 2.  I'm also a fan of the food.  While it's not fine dining, it's actually really good for drinking beer, and their presentations are pretty on point.  The Mushi is a good one to try, and their flatbreads are pretty tasty as well.  They also make a great bloody mary.  For the True golfers out there, feel free to bring your clubs, but if your driving by and are thinking about needing to go home to grab them, forget it.  The clubs they have there are decent enough.  Besides, you're not really at Top Golf to golf, its really more of an experience where golf is just part of the equation.

3EwqJm3EOPTyUlMQcW-foQ.text: I was there this last Saturday. We showed up from out of town and wanted to take some clients. There was a two and a half hour wait! We purchased the VIP pass and Georgi got us right to the front of the line-- she was very kind and accommodating. Food was good, service was great, and golf was addicting! Will be back!

V3qjDBWBEPsuybLd83Uhxg.text: Really great idea and super fun place to play/party day or night! The reason I am not giving 5 stars is that the employees appeared to have very little oversight. Groups of employees blocking the front desk and hallways laughing and flirting with each other while there were dirty tables and no toilet paper in the bathrooms.

-2n8_0wXUJVy0NJ0MehH3g.text: Very chill environment, great place to be with a group of friends! There is a nice bar area on the bottom floor and top floor as well. Great food menu as well! Will definitely be back! Shout out to Briel for her excellent customer service!!

QjOcjIYzWHhLacL9QxgJ-A.text: One of my favorite places in the whole city. And absolutely amazing place with great drinks and great food. And im not even a golfer!

BH8-9eGNraOkpYQ5GSqmdw.text: I'm not really into golf at all, but its a nice looking place . now if you put the address in google it will take you to the Hilton parking lot. But take the parking lot exit and you will find yourself in their parking lot of top golf. Now the drinks are cheap here real cheap if you come with groups. Shots , beer all good but I did not their food. The driving range is pretty cool, it has a nice view of talking stick so at night you get a light show. It's not to loud, they place nice pop music and over all the place looks pretty

biGheCRZYebSvDRPHHPj9Q.text: One of my all time favorite places. I am a terrible golfer and now even a huge golf fan, you don't have to be to have a good time here. Great fun, great snacks and yummy drinks! The 3rd floor has a private bar and dancing! Highly recommend!

4H2XnFVNYhIKdEZOz3BAAQ.text: Awesome fun on a Saturday night. Our first time. The wait was long, but expected (3 hrs +) But there was so much to do while we waited. Good food and drinks, pool table, shuffle board. Definitely going to go back. Bring this to San Diego.

mB63M-1G_gRLkvfkwZWEzw.text: Dakota Storm was the man!!!  Very friendly and personable.  Seemed to really care about his job which is exceedingly rare in the service industry!

KDPk8nqFetfa1zz1xWfZKA.text: Great place to come and have a good time!!!! Heard about this place a fewl the ago. Highly recommend it to anyone that loves to play golf and be competitive!! Great service and the food was amazing!! Nice vibe to Scottsdale Arizona! It was my brothers birthday and it was awesome. Our server Ian was perfect and provided great service!!! Please visit this place, I promise you'll have a great time at Top Golf!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View from the third floor at top golf!!

pHw5mUW1Gtvu-amYQIDdFg.text: I had never been to Top Golf before today. When I arrived they were on a decently long wait (about an hour) and Drew said there were spots available at their outside Terrace bar where I could enjoy the nice weather. Taryn and Ian were super helpful by recommending cocktails and making sure we were taken care of until we could be sat at a table. I would recommend this place to any of my friends friends based off of the bar service alone! I hope to come back soon and I hope to be served by Taryn and Ian again in the future.

D9HOAJEMHJEQdH-ox0xi0g.text: Savvy is the greatest. Love the games, love the golf, but the best part of our time at Top Golf is the wait staff. They are great, and make sure to ask for Savvy because she rocks.

ZDH7hEQPB6D_NIsVPAtauA.text: I like this place, and would like it more if I could go there more often. I know it's popular, but it's always PACKED, often with 20 somethings. It's a great idea for a fun night out, but go early if you don't want to wait hours!

HfL8u4gPReC6l4XavYe3tQ.text: Wevreally have fun here.  Its a long wait, but its worth it.  Thry have grest food.  If you haven't been you missoling out!

IBpkk3b_8xsb_fszATBSng.text: This place is a ton of fun, even if you don't know how to golf!  Check it out, I doubt you'll be disappointed!  Go on weekend nights for a party atmosphere or during the daytime for a chill vibe.

KycVtFTgGtm9BBk-eLDpbw.text: Customer service is awful - Received text that our bay was ready arrived and customers services had given away our bay. Manger was not friendly and I was told just sit and wait. Too bad I have had 2 corporates events here at this location in past but will take business else where. Would not recommend. Horrible experience getting checked.

-fefzbfLZvDr_CpiLIDHSw.text: This was so much fun! Much more than I anticipated. I am not a golfer by any stretch of the imagination and I was a bit wary going in. Fortunately, my bf gave me some pointers and I managed to do well enough to not feel humiliated!   There are people of all skill levels here just having fun. You rent the bays by the hour and can have up to six people in your group. They supply the clubs, the balls, everything! You can order food and drinks in there as well. If you really don't want to golf there are lots of other things to do. They have billiards, shuffleboard tables, and a giant bar if you just want to sit and have a drink and watch everyone play. This is definitely a spot where anyone can hang out and enjoy themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WCYCphJ8nosah2Sr64v2fQ.text: Well we returned to Top Golf for Father's Day, but we had no Dad's, only someone celebrating their birthday. For the entire weekend, Top Golf added a $50 charge to every two hour reservation, which is a bit sheisty. The first floor is clearly not as fun as the third floor, so avoid the basement, but nothing else was available. Will return on a weekday, non-holiday when prices are normal, non ripoff.      Ok, so I really enjoyed the Brisket Grilled Cheese which was a hearty sandwich with some quality brisket inside the bread and two kinds of cheeses. Skip the flatbread and pass on the nachos because they are just eight chips total. The $8 Bloody Mary was pretty good and the chicken sandwich was just your basic bird, but the queso dip was above average. Nothing special about the burger either. I thought Top Golf had a gourmet menu (article I read), but not quite.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken time
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tots good
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best choice brisket

_wJnWEFBMfPEH6gObogZlg.text: We came to this location with a 50% off coupon, and wouldn't have came if we knew they weren't going to take it. They added extra time for us because they knew we had a 50% off coupon. Then the manager came to us and said the coupon was "fake" The manager seemed very rude to us, like he was angry at us for having a coupon.NOT HAPPY, can't say a coupon works then make us buy more time so they can make more money

npv6F7_nJ_kHxbiVcKiI4Q.text: This was my first time at the Scottsdale location, and It definitely won't be my last! Brianna was our group's server and she was awesome! We did not have to flag her down once, and she delivered our drinks very promptly with a smile each time. Hunter and Chacho the managers were awesome as well checking in on us and made this visit very memorable! Love this location!

wISYJiZLxFtClgHZ9WG3Fw.text: Came here with coworkers to celebrate Galentines Day, surprisingly on a Wednesday morning this place can get pretty busy! Drinks were good, food was good. It was technically breakfast/brunch time but the entire menu is available to order from. Everyone was fun to be around and accommodating to our group. We'll be back! Thanks!

Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wJPLKQmZ-m1euHZXtTZOJw.text: Jake was amazing. He went above and beyond to make sure we had an amazing time away from our kids . I have never been treated so amazing at an establishment. Jake made our entire vacation!!!!!!!!!!!!

iwOqntpk1uMb6_UxIoEuUw.text: Fun way to get out of the sun for a few hours.  Great spot to bring the family or hang with friends.  Drinks, food and golf. Lots of TV's.  All around a fun time!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MhOYVhojRyc4Zhg4Q0dhew.text: My wife took me for the afternoon in July for my birthday. It was warm but we stayed about two hours. The service from Luke was amazing. He had knowledge on everything. Food, drinks, games to play. The food was amazing. The mai tai was refreshing. The staff signed a birthday card for me and stopped by to say hello. This is how you run an operation. I had been once before but was with too large of a group to truly enjoy it. My wife enjoyed the "first" time hitting golf balls. We will be back soon.

41cot4uNzIOpeY0izs1njA.text: I had been wanting to check it out for years and finally made it this past weekend. Had a lot of fun with friends and music is just loud enough to have a good time but not too high where you can't hear the person next to you. My friends even took their 3 month old baby and he slept through the entire night. Drinks are ok but food is great! I had the chopped salad and good quality ingredients, also the flatbread is made fresh and very tasty. Excellent service, she was checking on us regularly and even brought the new server to introduce her before she ended her shift. We will definitely come back.

Je1pd07UVjDQmIroeEhe7Q.text: The atmosphere in the game itself is very fun and relatively priced well.   If you look at their menu there clearly pushing the alcohol agenda since there's about 25 pages of alcohol drinks and three things to order to eat.   Not so much a place to take kids more of a place to get drunk with your friends and eat really crappy food that's expensive.  Oh yeah I might add that the food is really really awful it is like What one might expect to get at a movie theater, Quality and price.  I'm actually very disappointed.  One might expect a higher quality of food coming from a casino but I guess this is not the dot type of casino. I would not consider to try any other food until the menu is changed

D8cFJzKd3IbozQDEeUWZgA.text: The only positive part of our experience was our server- she was very friendly and attentive. However, the operations at Topgolf were a huge miss.   My brother booked a 3 hour bay for his birthday online and they seated us in a bay per usual. After about 10 minutes they notified us that after an hour of use they would need to move us to accommodate another party. We asked if we could just be moved right then, they agreed and had us stop play. Sitting there waiting for direction for another 15 minutes or so, we were encouraged to grab our drinks ourselves and headed to the booth we were told. Upon arrival they wouldn't start us and asked us not to set our drinks down as it wasn't our bay (but it actually was). Finally, after another 10 minutes, they sat us down and we were able to begin.   All was well until we were leaving, then another "hearing of the cattle" scenario began. We first noticed we were charged time from the original bay (4 balls were hit due to operational disorganization) and no less than 5 minutes after our hour ended we were told by 3 different people within that 5 minute period that we had to leave. We were well on our way out, when another assistant told my sister-in-law she needed to leave the bay as she was buckling her 6 month old into the stroller.   Needless to say, the overall attitude presented to us by the team was enough that we won't be returning.

Uma6cF4_rGIZO3M0DgSEsg.text: I've been to the location Vegas, and this one was not a great deal different. It's a pretty fun experience and a good way to spend a few hours with a group of friends - as long as you don't mind spending osme coin.  We checked in and were told there'd be a 40 minute wait, so grabbed a drink in the meantime. The bar staff were efficient, though some beers were under-poured. There's a nice seating area upstairs by the bar and they had heaters running. We were called up really quickly then had to wait 10 minutes for a bay, which was odd, but fine. Then we were assigned one that was already in use, so quite a bit of carry-on and confusion before we got to our bay and were settled.  Since we'd been before we were able to remember and re-use the memberships we'd set up last time. There's a charge of $5 to sign up and an expectation for every member of the party to have their own membership - which I have to say cheapens the experience for me. I resent knowing I'll have to unsubscribe from their marketing every time I go here. It's also a pain to have to try to remember some username and password you set up months before (and likely while tipsy) - so that's pretty irritating.  Once in the booth, the servers were adept at handling large drunk groups, which I applaud. The game itself is fun enough, though we couldn't figure out an easy way to make it accessible to our various skill levels.

Q5SW_Os7nNU5U562ofXggg.text: Great service, good food. Amazing staff who does not give you a hard time and just want you to have fun. This is the place to be from the young kids to the older crowd who want to enjoy a nice drink and have some fun. I come here every year when I'm on vacation and always leave with a smile

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

K7uKgPu1Cel8a4jKlOJBTw.text: Pretty cool place located next to Talking Stock Resort and Casino. Fun and interactive experience going out with friends, having drinks and hitting some golf balls. The only thing keeping me from a 5 star review is that prices here are pretty high. Still this is definitely an experience you will want to at least try once. Go at night when all the lights are lit up it is very cool to hang there in the evenings!

r3KLtTERiuHgyJWbQpmPSA.text: Disappointed with top golf's trajectory since first experiencing it on the east coast. Went with a group of friends on a Monday morning, enjoying some drinks and golf when our range time eventually expired. As we were finishing our drinks, a customer service representative came up with other people to inform us that the bay we were in was now booked for someone else. Surprising was the fact that there were at least 50 other bays available on our level alone. Lack of tact and hospitality sent a clear message that if you aren't spending money, they want you out. Understandable to a degree if there were no open bays and it was a busy night, but to boot us immediately after our time expired and we were finishing drinks left a sour taste in my mouth.

gSIvh4GQOQStwmK9_Q0mxA.text: Don't get me wrong we LOVE topgolf but our NYE celebration was an awful uneventful experience this year. We have went two other times and it has been amazing, but the FOOD AND ENTERTAINMENT (fireworks didn't go off) were just plain disappointing! We were greeted warmly and seated quickly. THE staff is WONDERFUL so that was the best part.  Who serves fancy food at a golf course? Overrated and cold just was a poor choice. The pork was dry the other mystery meat inedible and Kale salad? The potatoes bland and cold as were the brussel sprouts. (We were the first in line so we were surprised everything was cold). Then to end it with cold donut holes! We ended up having to order off the menu and of course pay extra. I think this will be our last NYE party at Topgolf. It's too bad it could be such a fabulous event. Way overpriced for what we received!

3eU93U07-ptTQZ0Ce_4LxQ.text: Can't believe I haven't written a review for this Topgolf yet!   Its becoming one of my favorite goto places in the valley when looking for something fun to do.  If you are thinking eeewww golf, you shouldn't, really, Topgolf is fun! It's like a hybrid of mini golf & skeet ball    One think I like about this place, there is no hidden cost, a bay is a flat rate, from open to 12 pm its $25 per hour, from 12pm to 5pm $35 per hour and 5pm to close $45 an hour, and for a bay of 6 you can easily get through a game within that hour.  Topgolf also serves food and drinks, has some gaming systems and pool tables if not ready to leave yet.  Seriously, this is some fun times, take your family, go with friends, make it a date night, but go and have fun!

CFa17peNp5lQCvhDOEUpJw.text: We had such a fun time and service was excellent!  I believe it was Pete who set us up to play and Hannah was our server.  If all your servers are like Hannah, you will have a lot of repeat customers.  She was top notch.  Her personality was great, she kept our drinks filled without ever being intrusive, and always made us feel welcome.  And we had so much fun, even though we probably looked pretty goofy.  We will definitely be back!!!

0lMUrj-Rdk2z1Ee41C_p5g.text: it took 45 minutes to get my burger. I asked for cheese and they slapped a piece of "rubber" on the plate and called it good. Good thing it was 90 degrees outside so it could melt to the patty. I wish the service was better because I enjoy swinging the ole wrenches and beating some balls in the desert.

JiDzsw-nw88ord8ih00KyA.text: It began as a disappointing experience but Andrew H. (the Marketing Team Lead) totally fixed the situation and went above and beyond to ensure we had a great time.  We showed up in the early evening on a Friday night and were told it would be a two hour wait. We were cool with that and had dinner at the sports bar inside. It ended up that the two hour way was totally off. We waiting another hour and were told it'd be at least another 30 minutes. By this time, we were ready to leave... and we did. However, Andrew saw us on the way out and asked if we enjoyed our experience. We told how how disappointed we were with our first ever Top Golf visit.  He apologized and invited us back the next night. We arrived and they were READY FOR US. A host took us to our spot, introduced us to our waitress, set up our game, and we were loving it all in no time. It was a fantastic experience. Any level of golfer (even someone who's never touched a club before) will love Top Golf. It's a genius concept and, with customer service like Andrew's, we can't wait to go back.  If only Los Angeles had a Top Golf!

1KhlUfxMg6k6GEWlB5IBuA.text: I have been here several times.My children have a blast here. But I always have problems with their food ! This Saturday was my sons birthday. He ordered a hamburger med it came out well done and the tots were luke warm at best. You could tell the plate was sitting for a whole the gentleman who brought us the order could not even touch the plate so you can just imagine. The bad thing this has happened more than once . The server was apologizing and the manager came over which was nice but a simple burger .

loVxYcIsxBg6vGuxM9tRWw.text: Traveled to Arizona for this. We really enjoyed it. The place was clean and really nice. They had a screen with my name on it when we arrived at our bay which I thought was really neat. The customer service was great. Everyone was very attentive and kind. I ordered mango habanero wings and they were AMAZING! I love buffalo wild wings but these wings were on a whole new level!!! Overall an awesome experience & we can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

a9YqfBeXRmLKkdSNHmI8LQ.text: Been to Top Golf so many times at several different locations and this was the best time we've had! Our bay host, Chandler was the reason. He was amazing! He overheard us talking about our birthdays and brought us a dessert to share right off the bat. He was the kindest server ever and we loved talking to him. He got us everything we needed and then some I just can't explain how happy and lucky we were to have Chandler! Amazing amazing experience and service. Will recommend him next time and so should you!!

vNY3tMaD-nrYdV6CJnxung.text: The service was great and prompt! A great environment in a family setting or just out having drinks. Definitely will be returning.

ACRyY_iBKI5m0uvZcFGUdg.text: So I specifically made a yelp account to leave this review, because I saw it when I was exiting your building and I wanted to share my experience!  But anyway, I've been to Topgolf Scottsdale roughly a handful of times. Always a great experience, everyone is typically very friendly and polite, food is good, golf is fun. However, I wanted to write about my specific experience the last time I was here. I came in a couple Fridays ago and I brought my family. I had a very large family, with several little kids under the age of 12. Everyone was very well accommodating and they helped us with everything, even so much as helping to carry our clubs.   We got sent down to the first floor, which was totally ok, with younger kids it helped put my mind at ease slightly, knowing I wouldn't have to stress about them getting close to the yellow line.   We were sent all the way down, I believe bay 101 or 102, so a little ways down there, but we remained in good spirits!  My husband arrived first and had already had the bay reserved for us, he goes to Topgolf quite frequently.   Almost immediately we were greeted by our server, which is why I am writing this review. She was spectacular, funny, friendly and went above and beyond anything we could have ever hoped. We all felt the need to give her a hug when we left because she treated us as if we were her own family.   Her name was Torie and we loved her, she was from somewhere around Pittsburgh, in case you have more than one Torie working there! She taught us so much about Topgolf and where the company was going, which was so cool to learn about! She delivered excellent service, giving us recommendations and tips on fun games to play, but she didn't just stop there! She completely surpassed any service we had received before.  Like I mentioned before we had several kids, very young, with us. She was wonderful with them! She made them chocolate milks, brought them cups with lids, and cleaned up every spill we made, and there were plenty of them! All through this, she remained with a smile on her face. She even went so far as giving my youngest golf lessons and tips because he was getting frustrated every time he got up to golf. She worked with him until he was hitting golf balls better than me! Where most people would get frustrated with a group like ours, she didn't show it at all.   She made our experience unforgettable. We kept her running back and forth because we were eating, drinking and hanging out with friends from out of town. It wasn't until we got up to leave, before we noticed how much walking back and forth she must have done for us, and she never let it show. Once we got up and realized she must have walked so much taking care of us, my husband tried to hand her additional cash for our gratitude, which she refused, insisting we had already left plenty. We hid it under the ketchup bottle anyway! She was amazing and cared so much about our experience, which warmed my heart. The bay next to us also couldn't stop raving about how great she was!  It is clear she loves the company, and what she does. You have a real gem there, Topgolf. Hold onto her as long as you can because she made our experience unforgettable.   Please pass this along to her!   Sorry for the novel, but I wanted to share and let everyone know that Topgolf is a wonderful place! It is so much fun no matter your age, please give it a visit!

ElJOw1xHv2oO1Z3nZWM03g.text: Who knew places like this were even a popular thing to do on a Saturday, let along during the week. My brother brought us here and it was a blast. You pay by the hour and all it takes is a small membership fee. The food was good and for being a driving range/open air venue, they do a good job of keeping the Arizona heat off of you! Definitely want to go back and have some more fun.

sSd8r81i0hrCv3L8HlQVUw.text: Front desk staff went above and beyond to answer questions and meet our needs. After a minor issue with payment, our attendant was very understanding, helped us and was courteous with timing. We had 2 bays, due to card issue 1 was taking longer to reserve, so it was almost taken. When we informed the attendant who was trying to give it away, she was rude to the our attendant and was being condescending which none of us thought was ok to do in front of customers. There were 18 of us who witnessed this. Which is why I am giving a good rating, we had great/excellent at service until we witnessed this. Food was GREAT, we had queso, chips were a little stale tasting, but not bad. I heard from friend the quesadillas were amazing, pretzels were good minus the cheese. I also heard the burger was amazing too.  Music could have been better, at random moments it would come blaring through, so more consistent or variety of music would be great!

ZRp0M0U8zMOJ8YihCW6gVQ.text: Usually this place is great, fun times with family and friends, enjoyable golf and food. This time not so much. We made a reservation several hours in advance for a golf bay with a couch and when we got there they had set us up in the only bay completely cast in the sun. We kindly asked to be moved to one of the many adjacent open bays with couches only to be talked back to and given terrible attitude by our waitress Elizabeth. Eventually we were moved to a bay with a high top table in the shade but were continually given sass and attitude by Elizabeth. I recommend Topgolf hire people who are kind and nice.

z7G_By7K1jD4u-sQd895DA.text: I booked this spot for my 11 of us and got to work with Alishia and Bo.  Alishia set us up and booked us for the event.  She was very helpful and the booking process couldn't have been easier.    When we arrived, we were greeted by Bo who took care of us for the day.  He was amazing.  Friendly, informative, funny, and provided us with perfect service.  This can be very difficult with 11 inebriated guys on a bachelor party so I have to give him a hell of a lot of credit.  We were all very grateful for his help and wish him the best.  It was a fantastic experience, one which I will recommend highly.

kpK48js1VuoWgVbAaG_V7A.text: The play was great, always fun, but I asked two different times, to a total of 3 employees to have the bathroom restocked.... never happened.

cqEBBv42bauxPJsoGjf38Q.text: Fun time but be ready for a long wait if it's busy.  The food is good but don't expect great service.  The golf was awesome and the food was better than I expected.  Great place to hang out with friends.

HCs2u-wQVsCsukNsjA-1Bw.text: This was my first visit to Topgolf, for a friend's 21st birthday. We didn't make a reservation, but as it was a Tuesday night they weren't very busy and got us a spot right away. There were eight of us and we all went in one space. Only six can golf at once but there was plenty of room for all of us and we all took turns golfing anyway.   I'm not a good golfer but I had an awesome time anyway! The automatic ball dispenser is just so easy, and there are so many holes to hit that even I, with my lack of hand-eye coordination, was able to score enough points to feel accomplished.   The staff was wonderful and helpful. They really made my friend feel special for her birthday and were incredibly accommodating and friendly.   We also got a lot of food and drinks. I was less impressed with the food than I thought I'd be. The prosciutto-artichoke flatbread was amazing though! The nachos were alright, and pretty small for sharing. The drinks were a little inconsistent but still good.   Overall, I had an awesome first time here. The staff really elevated the experience and the view is incredible! When it gets dark the holes light up and the Talking Stick Resort glows in the background. I would absolutely come back, great for any occasion!

41ucQeklyBGxvIHVbvLBIw.text: Great place for team building! Had a good time networking with colleagues! Food was decent. Tried their pickled fried chicken, beef brisket, salad and mac and cheese. Only gripe was the sangria was too light. The coach who trained us did a great job teaching the ropes and you could tell he was passionate about the sport. Overall, highly recommend trying this place out.
