ChMcQ2Dni04czFEP0r5V0w.text: Finally!! Some fun entertainment that we can rave about in AZ!!   Prepare yourselves with a golf glove instead of coming here on a whim (aka me) to avoid the possible blister on your thumb from gripping the golf club too tight. Came here before the 5pm rush for $35/hour. This place is great for groups. With your lifetime membership for $5 plus tax you can save every score that you ever made and check up on your scores. Waitresses/waiters will be at your bay to take your food/beverage orders. There are tv monitors if you really don't want to play golf too. Plushy couches to sit comfortably on for a party of 6. And there are misters to somewhat cool you off in the summer heat.   Immediately got a bay in less than 5 minutes. Took the top view and awfully attempted to score points based on accuracy but failed miserably. Let's just say I would not want to share my score. I just have to come back and practice more. Also played pool downstairs and virtual darts. This entire place is busy on the weekends. You don't have to be in golf attire. Comfy clothes like flip flops, tank and shorts are good enough.    Can't wait for the San Tan location to open up!!

PZuYogJXWQuPIuNUiwN7mQ.text: This place is great and you don't have to be a golf pro to have fun. Ask for a bay on the second or third floor if you're not an experienced golfer. You pay by the hour regardless of how many people in your party, and even though it's more expensive to go at night, it's a lot more fun because they light up the holes as soon as Talking Stick turns their lights on at sunset. However, I really would not recommend getting any food here. Both times I've ordered food (chicken tenders and chicken sandwich) I've gotten food poisoning...

e9JB33cjlp8422V8NYrWNA.text: If you want to test the athleticism of your family members, this is the place. Shooting golf balls at targets to get points with 20 balls a game. We got an hour for $40 with our veteran discount. Very cool environment, I have attached videos of my family golfing. Cool vibes and if you don't get competitive in this, you're not doing it right.   Unfortunately, they have rules that you can't do any happy Gilmore swings (a running start) and you aren't allowed to aim for the cart picking up the golf balls. So my personal goals weren't achieved. But I went to top golf yesterday and I'm going back today! So so fun!

gUfBO3ZZikzQGxC9ECh7mw.text: Been here 20+ times over the last 4 years and rarely is food or drink service prompt, to say the least.  With the amount of employees they have walking around you would think the opposite would be the case.  It's as simple as full hands in and full hands out.   More drinks served and less employees serving those drinks is 100% doable, and will also improve bottom line me thinks.

b4momxpKWO36qIH1jKXimg.text: What a fantastic place.  Celebrated my son's 13th birthday here.  Food was out of this world!

ERz2AN39cNoA9w4tIRn1wA.text: Visiting Scottsdale and I must say that this was the most fun that I had this weekend at top golf ,customer service was fabulous everybody so nice and friendly I would definitely come back

w74yassnsgF3HYrLMzrIAA.text: Can't use your own hybrids, woods or Driver, which is weird since you can hit the woods and driver they provide. Not really a driving range to work on your golf game. ts more so a bar where you can hit golf balls.

ffj31nR6G8YYO5Y-NYigCA.text: Great golfing and atmosphere but terrible service.  Management here is embarrassing to say the least.  The employees are friendly but their upper management is extremely unprofessional and careless.  I have given this place multiple chances and have only been let down.  Even came here for a graduation party and was yet again disappointed.    Horrible upper management needs to be weeded out.

Qm7UuWQ9vdgblizEXtMYMA.text: I had 0 expectations for this place and I had a great time!  I'm not a golfer but how they have everything set up with their computer system is really amazing.The thing I really wasn't expecting was how good the food was; everything from the nachos to the prime rib was delicious.  I would go back there in a second!

lylSWmYY_cFP3cSZC-h31g.text: I absolutely loved it here! Visiting from San Diego and Amanda Morgenstern was the best waitress ever!!!! Had a blast and would love to come back, she was totally on top of it and dealing with our craziness, so much fun.

3Gh-BxQK-jZnWG6alGoiUA.text: This was my first visit to Top Golf, and I brought two family members visiting for the holidays.  The overall concept is quite fun - as an activity alone, we would rate this 5 stars - it is REALLY fun and something you can imagine yourself doing over and over as a social event.  Why two stars, you ask?  There are major issues with this place that test your patience.  First off, when you walk in, its total pandemonium (we came here at 3pm on Friday).  There are two line queue's but no signage or help as to what the lines are for, or where to even stand in line.  As it turns out, the first line is the "membership line" - everyone needs a $5 membership.    The second line, is to "check in" - by which they scan your new membership card and ask whether you want a bay on a specific floor.    Both of those tasks sound SO easy - and they should be - yet we still waited in line for about 40 minutes to accomplish these two tasks.  The entire time, we and everyone else in line are talking about how inefficient this place is and you would think the managers would see this once, and rearrange things to make it easier.  After all, we really wanted a beer - we could have been through two rounds at the bar in the same amount of  time we spent waiting around to check in.    After all that, we still went to the bar and had two rounds while we waited.  Good selection of beer, bartenders were fast to see that we wanted booze and wasted no time in getting it.    Then, we get our text message - our bay is ready, requiring us to go muscle into the line and tell the check in staff we are ready (which then irritates everyone in line because you are obviously butting in), but thats the way they like it here I guess.    We head to our bay with a "bay concierge" that gives us the down low on the mechanics of play.  Its not the most intuitive thing in the world, but it works.    We start hitting balls and our waiter shows up.  He literally walks us through the entire menu, page by page, explaining burgers, and appetizers, and frozen margaritas like we had never been to a pub before and didn't know what a "slider" was.  (Mind you, you pay by the hour at this place, so someone taking your time is quite annoying).  We order a bucket of beer and chips and guac, and shoo him off and get back to our golf.  Beers arrive, chips arrive - and our waiter arrives..... and stays.... and gets all chatty about football and where my family is from, and his Grandma in Colorado, and what it was like working after Christmas, and all sorts of topics that none of us care to talk about.  ugh, leave us alone - we are here for golf and beer, not a new pal.  When the chips came out, one in my party leaned over to the server and said, "do you know one thing thats missing in this place?"  The server leaned in all interested.... "napkins - there are no napkins on the table".  Our server launched into a story about why there are no napkins - another server spilled a huge tray of soda into a bussing cart and that knocked over someones golf bag, and on and on and on..... and no napkins.  He stopped talking and stared at us - and we asked him, "could we have napkins?" - and there was this 'oh yeah' moment - he was oblivious at times.  So, we shoo waiter off to get another bucket of beer and a refill of chips, and he comes back with the beer, and no chips (and again, all chatty - does this guy have other tables?).  The refill of chips took about 20 minutes.  We came at an odd time, and we were expected home for dinner, but the burgers and sandwiches on other tables looked very good.  The kicker though, was that near the end of our session, our new buddy server out of the blue told us that the day after Christmas, there was a five hour wait, and they ran out of food, and booze, and kegs, etc.  He told us that they were going to get a lot of negative reviews for that on an email service card that is sent to you the next day after playing.  He asked us if we wouldn't mind marking everything 5 stars because they really needed the good marks, and he would buy us desert if we said yes.    OK, this is the business guy in me coming out now, but the whole reason for getting feedback from your customers is to IMPROVE and figure out where you are failing.  The fact that you have a 40 minute check in process, or that you ran out of beer one night, or that there are no napkins on the table, or that there seems to be tons of staff walking around but not helping the bottlenecks - these are ALL issues that management needs to be aware of - but instead, they try to bribe you so that you will rate them the way they want to be rated.  If I owned this place, I would be PISSED off.     Again, its a really fun concept, but it will try on your nerves big time.

6HHpfFkDxDRvwgonmbVVjA.text: Really fun place. Food is good and the service is always on point. Anyone can go here. You don't need to be a golfer at all to attend. It mixes golf, bowling, and darts all in one. If you want you can also just hang out and watch some TV while people swing. I only wish they had some better happy hour pricing.

hNPoYhApl9cy_eCTMh3_jg.text: What the hell is going on with Topgolf? First you cut the rubber tees off, then no woods or hybrids, now you can't hit your own irons on two levels? I can't believe that they didn't figure this out before. Huge disappointment! I used to love going to this place, but now it's more like putt putt entertainment. A good thing gone bad by just a few golfers. Use your microchip technology and eliminate the golfers who are launching over the net!

lWqtKgkMp616A686lGdHbg.text: Top Golf is meant for drinking only.  It is not meant to practice golf.  This place is a total joke.  YOU CANNOT HIT YOUR DRIVER, FAIRWAY WOODS OR HYBRIDS.  You can only use your irons.  I bought a Groupon and no where does it say irons only.  Call the driving range and they tell you NOTHING ABOUT IRONS ONLY.  I guess some genius didn't figure out that if you are on the top floor some balls will fly over the net at the end.  You can tell this place is poorly run, step inside and you would be hard pressed to find anyone to answer your questions.  I STRONGLY RECOMMEND THAT YOU STAY AWAY FROM THIS JOKE OF A GOLF OUTLET.  If you want to drink and wait for your drink, go right ahead.

50DOy5GpyK8JWXdOnUBvmQ.text: Love this place!!! Always a great time. Bummer when there is a long wait. Summertime is also super hot and I don't recommend the top deck. The Bloody Mary bar is always fun!

NPBjRl1wHLiHorh28sHJxQ.text: This place is a pretty awesome place. I've only been here once on a Friday night. The music is loud, the drinks keep coming, and you get to practice your swing.  I think I love this place.

SlRGzZw3SRJn1XKGy06IBQ.text: Not a place I would go for dinner, but they have food to eat if you work up an appetite golfing. Great place to practice your swings during the day, and at night it turns into a night life mini golf place with Cosmo lights on the course. They also have bags, jinga, and other great games to play. Their sangria is also amazing!!

3iu01A5RBUu4fy05vOeQ0Q.text: This is a really fun and different way to kill a few hours with friends ... Maybe you don't want to be stuck inside a movie theatre or bowling alley, but you still want to be active...  What better way than to hit up a driving range?  And if that driving range had fans/misters blowing on you (heaters in the winter), music playing and has servers bringing you good food and drinks at fair prices, how could you pass that up?!  You can put up to 6 players on one lane and split the hourly rate amongst you to make it really affordable, even at peak prices.  Be warned they get very busy on weekend evenings and its not uncommon to wait 2-3 hours for a lane.  So be prepared to spend time at one of their bars or have some food while you wait. You can also play pool, shuffleboard or Nintendo Wii games on the second floor while you wait for your lane to open.  They weren't letting people bring their own clubs for a while, but that may have changed.  Call to be sure.

35a5P74mwAbEx0DDGV0q7w.text: ONLY WORTH GOING ONCE! Management take note!    I went to school for Hotel and Restaurant Management. There is a ton of things that need to be fixed. I was very disappointed.   I would rate this two different categories.  First, the service was awful! This company needs to have more employees in the restaurant area. We waited 30 to find an area "tables" where they serve you. If you are not in this area forget about getting a drink or food. Then we waited about 20 more minutes to place our orders. OUR FOOD CAME BEFORE OUR DRIKS, huge fail! We sent my friends order back two times. They need to have more than two computers to place orders. Have you though about servers having iPads to place the orders from? All employees who serve and or run food orders need to know the menu. Our food runner did not know what ingredients were in what my friend ordered.  They need to have cocktail takers who walk the whole area of the restaurant. We had several food runners ask us, Did you order...?  How are your orders printed out? No table numbers to what is ordered? They need to go back to training their service staff stat!   Second category, food/atmosphere.   The food and atmosphere is great. The tacos were to die for!! Way to go to the chef! Once you get to your bay the service is good.   I would go once to experience this. Not eager to go again. You would think they have various locations that they would have things down by now!

UjNaoAsvWwYuEwnMIyFYhg.text: I have been here a few times in the past, and now I have had the same server two times in a row (thank god). We really enjoy the atmosphere when we come in, and the food and drinks are always great. We have to give a big thanks to our server Karisa for helping us the last two times! We may have not come back if it weren't for her!

d-xlYNPhntTsB9vavMzJlg.text: We went to the location in Gilbert. Super fun atmosphere- great place to go with friends! Fun, affordable night out. Thought the prices were great. Service was just okay- we ordered a drink that took about 30 minutes. Received our food and everything was eaten by the time it finally came. Think it may have been a result of a busy night, but nonetheless not overly impressed with how the  server handled the situation. But we will go back just because it was a fun activity and we enjoyed ourselves!!

nbZ0UjxRJEcsEhk2bLMzGg.text: Always a fun event. Cool atmosphere & fun place to hang out when friends come to town. Arnold was our bartender the last couple times & I will always look for him from here on out. The place is a packed madhouse & he's a blast & super fast at making awesome drinks.

mG5ev1kgvCx7wZcYnPm_Pw.text: Went back to TopGolf and had a great experience. The staff and management team must have made some adjustments since my last review and I will definitely be back!

Kv1yxOGKuXU5IcPe_ym82g.text: This was our first experience at Topgolf and we LOVED it. It's so much fun and the staff are very helpful and nice. Go check it out!

z8VX94SROcgir6jHH7PAlA.text: We went to top golf over the weekend and I was ever surprised enjoy. It's was bit pricey for 3 of the people never swung a club but we really enjoyed our time. The food was good and reasonable price. 6 pack for 19 bucks isn't horrible for beer.

w8XCOmKqg9_ymBbjycjFSA.text: Chandler (like the city) was excellent. Great waiter!!  Much better than his brother, according to him.  Had a great time

wChG2tD5N9aw_YwHdYF_Cw.text: Wanted to check out Scottsdale's Top Golf and see how it compared to the ones back home in Illinois. We were very impressed with the technology and set up at this location. The only downfall was the pricing was more expensive than back home but the atmosphere and friendly staff made it worth while.

98ZSSwkvRQnz_AWYiJIodw.text: Went here for brunch when my parents came into town and it was the perfect place! Friendly staff there to welcome us and explain how it all worked. The food was delicious and the driving range was super fun with all the games. I had never golfed before so this was a great introduction. Hey had an awesome Bloody Mary bar and wide selection of other drinks. We had the breakfast sliders and eggs Benedict, along with the sweet potato tater tots and hash. It was all delicious and the perfect fun atmosphere for us all to have a great time and catch up.

kJD-FCgart-XnzYuaFbrUA.text: Great Place! Ton's of mini games to play! I would definitely go again!

A6lUlsSzVHLnMJrVVIcVVQ.text: Everything is awesome but my time definitely kept expiring before 1 hour mark that we would pay for. People next to us said the same thing. Food is awesome though

DfZemeNoxDyddTWTAseueQ.text: This is a fun and casual place, but certainly not a place to go work on your game.  The balls will not fly correctly (lacks yardage) and the AstroTurf will have you practicing ill advised shots.  However, it is a casual atmosphere with food and beverages and an opportunity to shoot the sh!t with your buds.  The wait time on the weekend (Spring Training?) were over an hour so be sure plan ahead.

x5KHRjeauOIrNr-ySamJQw.text: Had such an amazing time last night. Friendly and attentive staff made sure our every need was met last night, amazing food and vibes at this place.

qrCi2whDjnIX1rrlLmn_Ag.text: Always a great time coming here when I'm in town.  Great food and great service!!  Perfect place to hang out with friends and have some fun know matter what skill level you are as a golfer! Thanks Michelle for the great service!

LGiHmcQRFpGI6FWWHKuB-Q.text: Come here often and always have a blast.  Staff is great, and Michelle dropping by to make us laugh is an added bonus.

V0mLFIGt8HJKrL6vzL14zg.text: So much fun - Highly recommend going here! Here's our breakdown: We had a group of 6 that went today for the first time, (2 people are avid golfers, the other 4 have never touched clubs). We arrived on a Saturday around 3:00PM...We had created accounts ahead of time, which sped up the "check-in" process...We requested a third tier bay (we had read those have the best views) and were escorted to our area within 5 minutes. It was $52 for an hour and a half of play time (so worth it!). Then we all had a round of drinks and split 3 flatbreads, which cost about $65 + tip. Our server was great (thanks Haley!) and the food was delicious. We got through an entire game of 20 balls per person (I recommend each person hitting at least 4 balls/turn, it flows a little better). We will definitely be going again! (Also, apparently after 6:00PM is when the hour wait starts, so that's when they recommend using the $50 priority pass thingy.)

gtqevDzxsaPe3OJsngAdgQ.text: The actual golf was fun, that part I enjoyed.  The problem I had was with the service in the bar.  Two friends and myself decided to eat lunch inside before heading to the bay to golf.  We promptly placed our order at that's where everything went downhill....  -after 30 min I had to flag someone down to bring us our waters and drinks -after 60 min our food showed up w no silverware or napkins.  We asked for some, and received 1 set....yes, we had to then ask for two more sets. -we then asked to speak w a manager, who asked what we wanted, let us explain what happened, asked ZERO follow-up questions, said "thank you for the feedback", and walked away.  ARE YOU KIDDING ME!!!!!!!!  Nothing, no empathy, no apology, no interest in digging in to what happened.  "Thank you for the feedback".    Like I said, I enjoyed the golf experience, but would never step in that bar again.. Great Customer service is a culture you foster,  and if the mgrs. don't understand it,  why would the servers?

bIGjlO8TSpcO1Ao3rjhogg.text: First time and had a blast here a few nights ago. Very unique and interesting way of making golf a bit more fun. The building is beautiful inside and out. Staff was very friendly and helpful, considering they've only been open a few weeks... Golfed for 2 hours, ordered food and drinks with our server, delivered right to our private bay! Fun and practical business concept, I'd love to go back and I'm sure this place will continue to grow in other parts of the valley.

1x82b2mG7XeCIKDpwxPeSQ.text: Still haven't played there, but tried.  The line is out the door and I'm there with my two kids for a little food and fun.  20 minutes of waiting outside -hot as heck at noon - we finally make it to the A/C.  At this point I get approached by a guy who informs me that "We are an irons-only facility".  I look at the golf bag I'm carrying - which belongs to my 8 year old son who, can hit it about 75 yards if he catches it all... but say, "OK, cool we won't use it.  No biggie."  Then I'm informed I need to return it to my car. " Really?"  "Yes" I also had a plastic Snoopy driver in there, should I leave that behind as well?  And you couldn't have told me that 20 minutes ago - oh wait the staff didn't want to be out in the hotness any more than I did.  I took it out to the car, kids with me, and left.    Maybe I'll give it a shot again, but based on the goat-rodeo that was my first visit yesterday.  I really wanted to LOVE the place as the place in only 5 minutes from my office - wish I had enjoyed it more, or at least had a chance.

BCMZscdtpABVLENZp1rxkA.text: It's like a bowling alley for golf!  Beautiful outdoor patio, family friendly, reasonable priced food and broad menu choice  The service was fantastic and the self injectible donuts are simply delicious (sounds crazy, I know)

XTuV_0fs0TqATSGg0UqsFw.text: Confession- My brother and roommate said "See ya, Liz. We're going to TopGolf!" To which I replied. "I love that place! That's the restaurant with golf right?" To which they laughed and said "Um more like golf with a restaurant."   Anyway- this place is pretty cool. I don't think there's really anything else like it in AZ but I feel like this place is so ridiculously popular now (any place that can convince my brother to leave the couch says it all) that a second location has got to be in the works, right?   Also, the food is pretty damn good! I was expecting it to be subpar just because you know how cool places like this don't really need good food. Just like a super model doesn't need to be smart, it doesn't matter. They've already got things going for them. But their food was super good! I had the nachos and they were tasty! Good for you, Topgolf, you're a smart super model or...eh whatever, you get what I mean.   My only complaint is that the service in the restaurant/bar isn't that great. It's a lot of young servers, which I don't mind, but they need some more training. For example, when I inquired about my drink after everyone had already been served there's don't say "Oh yeah, I forgot. It's been sitting on the bar this whole time, let me get it." Um...cool thanks, I'm sure it's nice and watered down, just how I like it. Haha. Or when we said we wanted to order some starters don't say "Did you want to order them now?" when we're staring at you. No, actually next week please. Thanks for clarifying. Come on! Ha but that's me being nit-picky and I'm coming from a place of love in that this place is too cool to be dragged down but silly servers. Then again, I am the dipshit that remarked "Topgolf! I love that restaurant!" lol so I guess the silly servers are in good company with a silly customer! Haha

bVGGQG911s_Yt1eMOaLPUg.text: We tried to book a corporate event and the event booking team was not flexible with providing a flexible booking window. It is unfortunate when we were bringing 12-14 people that would have spent a significant amount of money. We had to come up with an alternative location last minute.  Topgolf did not offer any other solutions or any flexible options.  Don't bring your large groups here

hVmoxy8mUP3UwoFhaUlmtA.text: Incredibly Disappointing On All Levels: We went to Top Golf for a celebration and were accompanied by my mother-in-law who uses a walker. After waiting over 30 minutes to get a bay, we were finally given a bay on the first level. We had to walk all the way to the end of the first floor corridor to get a table that allows disability access and seating. Once we got to the bay, we were asked to swipe our credit card immediately and told our time was running immediately. I asked if we could have five minutes to look over the menu before the time started tolling, the answer was no. Best of all, when we tried to begin golfing our bay was broken and would not dispense any balls. A technician was called and arrived after 15 minutes, we were told any time lost would be credited. After working for 20 minutes,the technician told us he could not fix it and would try to find us a replacement bay. Of course, none were available and we were told to wait to see if he could fix the bay. At this point, we had been there for an hour and half and not even hit a ball. Ultimately, we were told we could get another bay, but there would be no seating for the disabled and that we would have to walk to the opposite end of the corridor again. After waiting and walking back and forth through the complex we gave up and asked for a refund. We were told they had to get the manager, which took another 20 minutes. The manager eventually came, but was annoyed we wanted a refund and tried to get us to stay in the bay, which the technician said might not work since he did not know what was wrong with it. After an hour and half, walking my mother in law all over the place and no golf we left incredible disappointed and frustrated. Frankly, I could not believe that in this day and age top golf would be so unfriendly and lack compassion for parties who have people with disabilities. Even when attempting to use the elevator, the host had my mother-in-law squeeze herself with her walker next to a large rolling dumpster, forcing the rest of our party to use the stairs and meet her at the bottom. I'm also amazed that my recommendation that top golf put bays with lower seating that is accessible for those with disabilities closer to the entry and not at the end of the corridor seemed to be a profound revelation to the manager. Again, an incredibly disappointing experience that should give people with a conscience great pause before spending money at this place! This epitomizes what happens when corporate greed and thinking like an automaton replaces customer service, thoughtfulness and compassion.

33BHzzLRGX7u0JH-BhWvYQ.text: As an avid golfer, I SO looked forward to the grand opening of the Scottsdale location. However, after two visits with the same issues, I felt I needed to leave a review to hopefully save others some trouble. (Always plan on at least a 1-hour wait.)  First problem: They seems to be grossly understaffed with their phone lines. I was trying to get a rough estimate on wait times the day-of, but could not get through to anyone on the phone. No sure how I'm supposed to plan my outing with friends if no one is available to answer the phones?  I then got fed up with waiting on the phones for more than 15-minutes, so decided to stop in because I was passing them anyways. They told me about an hour-long wait for a bay. I then put my name down, and texted my friends to come on over. An hour goes by, and my bay still hasn't opened. We ended up waiting another HOUR for our bay...absolutely ridiculous.   The staff at the concierge service seemed to be high schoolers without ANY training in basic customer service. Even went as far to say "yeah, you're not the only one to complain." I asked for a manager, and no one could be found. The food, drinks and games were great, as usual. However, the obvious lack of customer services training, under staffing of phone lines, and grossly inaccurate wait times left me with a bad taste in my mouth.   To the managers at Top Golf, PLEASE train your staff on customer service etiquette, and figure out a way to accurately give out wait times. Answering your phones wouldn't hurt, either.

Q-D6PNHMpvQItVcs-9mhyQ.text: Awesome spot. Had Amber as my bartender and she couldn't of done a better job. Drinks were always full, we all ate lunch, and seemed to keep us laughing the whole time. $35 for an hr of golf and sweet membership program. I'm coming back with my staff!

oAEzcV2WDPzlcdRLvBtIyg.text: kAT was so engaging as our server. She kept us playing and talking! Great top golf experience. Thanks KAT!!

296vX1QZt8XmQt4ZPy9n3A.text: Great night out until our server tried to ring us out.  Took 30 minutes to fix the mistake he made by charging one golf the cards rather than splitting the total between the three credit cards.  What a major buzz kill!

2nc9pgQhldy9lUuoSiNiNg.text: Overall, I agree with my fellow Yelpers. I am a fan of TopGolf because who refuses entertainment and fun at the brainchild of a sports bar and 3-story driving range with a lounge?   It can be a bit confusing when you first arrive. The parking has never been an issue for me though I've noticed some complaints. You do have to get a card for $5 but once you have that, you are golden, like lifetime membership status. You can upgrade for VIP service if you need that distinction. There is a second line to get your bay but it goes pretty fast. I will say my last experience there, the POS was down and we got overcharged for our bay and wasn't too happy with that oversight. The terminals are pretty easy to set up your games but if you need instruction, there's always a friendly group next to you such as mine or the staff.  Now, if you are a True golfer, yes your snobbery is duly noted that it is nothing like the real driving range. But come on? Not too many of those are open late night with a fantastic light show to feed your Masters' dream. If you get bored with the games, you can always strut down to the bar and check out the multiple TV screens and colorful patrons. Where else other than the WM Phoenix Open are you going to find women scantily clad when golf is involved?  Staff is spotty when it comes to bay service but overall attentive to your needs. Food is pretty good and the drinks are extensive enough for your various taste buds. Overall, it's fun for big group outings and company events. I prefer night time because you can catch the sunset and the balmy breeze almost makes you feel like you got transported outside the desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nothing beats sunshine and beer with this kind of view.
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not traditional Vietnamese Banh Mi. Flavorful and yummy. Ordinary becomes extraordinary with the coconut infused shredded pork

Vy99pH4ddhYO7LfiAtSuwQ.text: I love this place. Never heard of it before and we wanted to do something everyone could do and found this place. We had a group that aged between 25-70 and everyone enjoyed it. It's set up like a bowling alley and everyone has their own little area. While playing, you can order drinks and food from your area. It's outside but covered and in shade so not too hot. I may like it a little more because I beat all of the golfers but it's still perfect for all skill levels

X0Zg932wkQ06Kbar-cW7sw.text: Really disappointed in top golf. We made a reservation a week in advance. They couldn't find our reservation. We proved we had it had it, and luckily had it on our phone. Then, while they take a reservation for 8 for a bay...when you get to a bay they tell you only six can play. WTF! When we asked why the disconnect, they look at you like a deer in headlights. I have sent tons of business to them over the years because of being in tourism myself. No more! Shame on TopGolf! 0 stars!

4BtFzZ6HhS5VKMykvq9Dog.text: This is the 6th or 7th time we have been to the venue. We love the concept but after waiting 2 hours and finally getting to our bay the service always seems questionable.  I had to search around for my server tonight to find out who they even were. Once they were found she told she me " I was serving drinks" no intro no apology just "what do you want?"  The beer they brought me was flat and she didn't check back till the end of our round when my friend had already went upstairs to get me a new one. We were never offered waters and paid $50 in an uber to get there. Never again!

id0d9YBBQZp0aRy-uDBJAA.text: Today was my first time at Topgolf! We waited for about an hour and a half, but it was worth it! I had never been to a place like this, it seemed like bowling to me but golf style - very creative!   Staff was awesome and so friendly. You are greeted as soon as you finish walking up the steps to the entrance. Our waitress was great, she was serving us as well as a huge party and did an excellent job attending to us both.   The food was just okay... We got chips and guac, which the guac was just average to me and the salsa didn't really have much of a flavor. I did get the veggie burger and that was awesome! I ordered a side salad and was super sad to find that it came with cheese, eggs, and bacon. Most side salads don't come with those add-ins so I didn't think to ask! I just picked around them and it was no problem.   Overall, I had a blast. It was so worth the wait and I can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Topgolf

ApPE9BBAGG5fYAHBlYbUpw.text: Food, Friends and Fun!  Great place if you can get a reservation for your party. Hard to walk into.    Scratch kitchen makes the food very enjoyable.

K9swCNCQS1y1dwOXFnNfKQ.text: Golf, Darts and Bowling all in one!  We went to Top Golf with some friends while we were attending Spring Training. We had a free day and decided to make a reservation and try it since last year, with no reservation, we could not get in because it was such a busy popular place. Our wives have never touched a golf club in their lives and were content to just have some Bloody Mary's and watch us play but we convinced them, with the assistance of our waitress, to just have fun and enjoy the day. They were both beaming with smiles and laughs a plenty with in the first ten minutes of playing. It's like golf for obvious reasons, it's like darts because the targets have bulls eyes with an inner ring and outer rings and it's like bowling because you all take turns and compete individually or as teams. Our waitress was amazing, after checking in, they text you which bay to report to and your waitress meets you there to get you checked in and give you a tutorial. She then takes your drink and food orders and then it becomes really fun. You rent the bay by the hour and you are prompted when your time is running out and you then have the option to play out your time or add more time. The girls who did not want to play at all then wanted to extend our time and before we knew it, we were there three hours. For the three hours, adult beverages and food for four, we were into it for about $200 for the entire group. There were people all around us of varying ages and abilities and they were all having a really good time. My wife was talking about how much fun she had all day and said she could not wait until Spring Training next year to do it again. They are building another facility over in Glendale, right on the other side of the freeway from the football stadium. We saw it under construction while driving back and forth to Spring Training games. So, I hope that relieves some of the popularity and will make it more receptive to walking in. This is a great activity to do with your entire family!

mgMCKnMvARhguuwlXwH0_g.text: I am totally impressed with a quick response from one of their managers and will definitely give their location another chance. The ambiance was very intriguing, loved the cleanliness of bar and reception area.

o_oQpycdk5hFl7Sj9KNbEQ.text: I always have a great time here, but when we come to play  and see MANY open bays (12 just on main level ), but told it's 1hr 45 min wait, it was very disappointing. I don't get it, not worth waiting for especially after driving 35 min to get here. I understand if it was busy but it clearly had a lot of spaces. Not sure I will make the drive for future. Bummed

6VvMNJmetzfurRKojhO-pQ.text: Went there with a group total of 3 people on a Saturday night, we were told there was a two hour wait we decided to wait in one of the bars. We were surprised we got called after only one hour. Once you're playing time flies. It was fun, $50/hour.

wqE9-gZE2FIweOLCgOk3DA.text: My daughter is one of a few Black female golfers on collegiate level. I thought we would experience racism and disrespect from this place. Thank God I was wrong. We REALLY had a fantastic time. My daughter was very happy with the customer service and the top quality personalities working at Topgolf. I was impressed. Topgolf made my daughter's birthday weekend THAT MUCH BETTER. Can't wait to go back.

HU0vVoFa8d0ah16Q_INZcQ.text: Great and friendly staff! Bar and food while you wait for your bay to be ready and just an all around cool thing to do. You don't have to be good at golf (I'm not) to have fun! Great thing to do with families, friends, dates, anyone!!

IO0G5wLa0ykIMa35ecq2Cg.text: If I could give TopGolf 10 stars, I would do it! I took my boyfriend here while visiting the Phoenix area, and as an avid golfer, he absolutely loved it. We stayed for three hours and got to see the sunset, a beautiful moon rise, and had the background of a nice hotel that coordinated its lights with the facility. We enjoyed the pretzel bites as an appetizer, pepperoni pizza and chicken sandwich for dinner, and a Moscow Mule and Orange Dream for our drinks. Our server, Alex, was on top of it and made sure everything worked out. This is a great place to hang out with friends, take the family, or host a birthday party. I wish there was a TopGolf in the Los Angeles area because I would be a regular member!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

VwtL9YIohaz7SUj6e7Lm4w.text: Why isn't there a Topgolf near where I live? This place is incredible! We arrived at 11:30 on Sunday morning and there was already a 45 minute wait. We sipped drinks at the bar while waiting for a bay to over up.  We were set up at one of the lower level bays. We paid $35 for one hour of "golf" and ordered additional food and drinks with our server. We played a simple game where we could earn points by hitting any of the targets. I like the automated ball dispenser. Wave a club and like magic, a ball comes out!  Since we had a tight timeline, we had to leave after just one hour. I would've loved to stay longer or to come at night.

LzP6A9q-L5YVzv4tcNgkjQ.text: Topgolf is awesome! More so their Event Sales Manager, Lauren Cope, is amazing! Her customer service and follow up in helping us plan our event was incredible. Having a young son there were many times I had to get off the phone unexpectedly and her patience and flexibility was much appreciated! She deserves much praise!

Q4uptw-r0NOL-TeazOX5rw.text: Is this a new thing?? This place is super cool! Tons of stuff going on and activities to do. There's a bar downstairs and another upstairs (much less crowded). There's also restaurant seating for food as well as seats at the bar. Upstairs there's a foosball table, corn hole boards, and couches all over the place for lounging. Okay onto TopGolf... the membership card is $5 and good for a lifetime. The game is a driving range and the point is to hit the ball into colored areas on the field. The balls are microchipped so the computer tracks where the balls land and tallies the score appropriately. Like I said, super cool! Also, you don't even have to fetch balls in a basket; just wave the stick over the sensor and the device automatically dispenses a ball. Happy golfing!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0zzWfNHffLRsPkS5W6eHtA.text: So. Much. Fun. Doesn't matter if you're old young or in between, I believe this is safe, affordable fun for all ages.   Went here for my dad's birthday, went with mom dad husband and myself. We arrived on a non holiday weekend, noon Saturday, and it was kinda busy, our wait was about half an hour, so we decided to eat first. After we ordered, don't remember how long that was, we got our text saying that our bay was ready and that we could also eat at the bay. Yay!  Went to the bay, our appetizers were there: macaroni egg rolls and wings. Eggrolls of Mac n cheese was such a neat idea and the green chili in it made it really good and not too heavy as you'd think fried mac n cheese would be! Wings were fine, nothing stellar. We also got burgers. Those were fine, got Mac daddy and sunrise. Mac daddy seemed a bit much as far as being heavy, or maybe I had had my fill of Mac n cheese..anyway, we concluded that when we come back we'd just order snacks / appetizers and not burgers. Might try other stuff? Tots were good!  Golfing! So fun. It's kinda like bowling where you take your turn and watch others take theirs, but unless one of your is a real golf guru, it's pretty funny to watch your group. Not as easy as it looks and I definitely have more respect for golfers now =p Anyway, 4 people, 2 hours, 60$, not bad! Plus there's a lounge (I didn't go to) and food if you wanted to kill more time there.   At least try it once! It's fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac daddy with tots

kJsHGu4doS5CMcyLZUcs_A.text: I came here to celebrate a friends birthday. I have never been, but I hear a lot of people talk about this place so I was pretty excited to finally experience it!   We came on a Saturday and it was extremely busy, which is I guess the norm for this place. Top golf is basically a bowling alley for the golfer in you. They have what they call "bays" or "lanes" compared to bowling lingo. It's 3 stories and each story has a bar and a row of bays along the edge. Each golf ball has a little chip in it, which is how they can keep score within your group. They serve all kinds of bar food and drinks and yes kids are allowed to come here, I was under the impression that it was adults only but no I noticed a lot of children and babies, I wouldn't bring my children here on a weekend night why?  so many drunks!  We had a 3 hour wait for a bay, so we decided to chill at the bar/lounge on the 3rd floor. We ordered cheese fries, bacon cheeseburger, calamari, and guacamole and chips. I wasn't very impressed with the food at all! The guacamole was definitely the instant packet guacamole either that or they over did a certain spice on our order. Cheese fries lacked a lot of flavor, and don't even get me started on the bacon cheeseburger that came with no cheese. The food takes FOREVER to arrive that honestly you're so hungry you can't complain on how much flavor it lacks. I ordered a Moscow mule and it was quite delicious so thumbs up for that!   By the time we got into our bay I was exhausted! I was ready to go home! Our server for our bay was pretty nice, but extremely slow. It took 20min for an order of water to arrive.   All in all its a pretty cool concept, but in my opinion it is little too over hyped. I would definitely only visit during weekdays not a weekend NEVER AGAIN.  Unless I make reservations ahead of time. Service was ok, extremely slow. I mean if you know your business is extremely busy on certain nights I would think they would at least be fully staffed and prepared to accommodate all of their guests. The food  was not good at all for the price I was expecting something better.

G6_u5Urag5eGox2-XscM2g.text: Fun thing to do outdoors with a group of friends, or even just to relax alone.  You need to sign up for a membership (Tip:  Healthcare workers can get a discount with registration).  After that you pay by the hour to use their clubs and unlimited balls.  They have waiters to bring beverages and food to your seating area as well.  Would def. return when I'm in the area.  Only downside:  it can get pretty pricey compared to typical driving ranges.  However, this place has more options and fun extras to do as well!

aJNQckuOxniRd8a1BATEFw.text: Took my husband there for Father's Day.  We had more fun!  We had five people in a bay and ordered appetizers to eat while we played.  The food was very good - we had the wings (three favors), nachos, queso dip and a donut holes.  The wings were excellent, the nachos were different - they weren't traditional but they were good.  The queso was very good - had a beer flavor which I liked.  Service was very good.  I would go again and my husband loved it

jMIyM93k1yQ5Gduf7NSICg.text: When I started my new job, the company took us here as a welcome aboard/ice breaking night and it was so fun! We had our own 2 tee slots up top in the building, and we had drinks and snacks. The food was awesome-hummus platters, chips and guacamole, sandwiches and pasta.  The drinks were awesome, and the wait staff were super friendly.  There was a gold pro helping us with our swing and aim.  It was very high tech and we were able to keep score and see what we were doin wrong and right.  It was extremely fun, and since work paid I am not sure what the price range was.  But all in all it was very fun and friendly atmosphere!

Rn4jC1gI7C9EKOmEm3ZsqQ.text: I've been to Topgolf once before at the Gilbert location. This was my first time here at the Scottsdale one. I came here on a Saturday night. It was expected to be busy and they told us it would be a 30-35 minute wait. We were a group of 5 and we sat at the bar to wait. Surprisingly we didn't wait long. They took us to our bay 10 minutes after we waited. We ordered some drinks and food. The golfing experience was fun but the services was not good. I ordered French fries from the bar area and they said they would deliver it to the golf area because it was our time to go and then my friends ordered a chicken grilled sandwich and buffalo wings but they took over an hour to our food come to the table. The lady who served us was very rude too. My friend wanted to order the top golf drink bag and the waitress looked over at his girlfriend and gave a rude remark how she already has a drink in front of her so she can't order another one. But really my friend was ordering the drink to share with another guy in our group. She also was rarely present at out table. She only checked on us probably twice the entire 2-3 hours we were there. Maybe she was having a bad night or she was busy with the other tables which I understand but she could have been nicer and more attentive. My friend pointed out that she didn't even look at us in the eyes either. But I'm an understanding person so I would come back again and give it a second chance. But for now I will give this place 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Topgolf Marg Golfbag - $18
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Asian Sesame chicken wings - $11 and smoked house cheese burger with tater tots - $12

5Htu7TaOtlOpDxuKEfk-Pg.text: Want to have some real fun! Check this place out!!! Service is great, food is wonderful, and you if you play golf you will really enjoy the experience!  Went there a few weeks ago, in the late afternoon, and had loads of fun with the bunch of guys I was with. We all had a great time, service was excellent, parking was easy, cost was inexpensive, and was a fun time out.  It a gotta! If you want to spend a few hours out on a date, or with the guys, with some clients, family....

0Y78ob4JrH1fs_6CJkqtwQ.text: Wow went here for the first time. This is the BEST way to go driving haha. They brought the fun friend/family experience you get at the bowling alley to the driving range. This is great for all levels including newbs. The bar was great, the facility was tip top shape, the staff were very helpful and friendly, and the food was great! Definitely a must if you find yourself in Scottsdale.

Q6pZbuJGGhDsdTlgHm8p2w.text: Machine screw ups made it frustrating. They gave us 15 minutes free, but for price during prime time it wasn't ideal. Staff very friendly.

SQ3dyGMDj-S2EoRcxvSRSQ.text: My family surprised me with a trip to Top Golf for father's day.    Great!  I get my clubs cleaned up (I had been before and used their clubs that sound like dead softball bats) so I could use them.   Check in, clubs in hand, ready to get a nice bloody mary, even got on Tier 3...cool!     "Sir," the pro or head staff member or whatever his title is "Sir, you can't use your driver and woods on tier 3."      "Excuse me?"  I reply, the words hitting me in the face with their condescension and the reality that this dude has no customer service skills.  "We would be glad to check them or you can move to tier 1...the reservation doesn't allow outside drivers or woods on tier 2 or tier 3"  "Did someone mention this to my wife when she booked the reservation?"  Blank faces.   Dull stares.  "I will just put my clubs in my car."  I turn to leave  "But sir, we can che...."   "I said I will put them in my car."  That was my first experience, on father's day, at TopGolf Scottsdale.   Our service was poor at best.  It wasn't full in the slightest and the dude had a hard time keeping water (the sun beats right in your face in the morning in this location probably another "THE RESERVATION MADE US!! WAAAH!!" excuse) and ice in our drinks.   We got food, we got a few drinks (stick to beer these guys couldn't make a decent bloody mary if their life depended on it) did out time and got out of there.  I say go to Gilbert, go to Avondale, go to Tucson.   I am not sure if they have the same driver and woods rule at those locations and I wish Scottsdale had that somewhere on their landing page.   Fake customer service from the second walking in.   If I had it to do over again I would have probably got the money back and done something else.    Way to ruin father's day TopGolf Scottsdale!

FdUqlOWvAmdYobrJc4gf4Q.text: The game is fun but the reservation fee is a deceptive practice and finding out about this ripoff ruined the whole experience. They charge you $50 + tax to reserve a bay. That gets you nothing other than "skipping" the line whether or not a line exists. It does not count towards game play, it does not count towards food. Nothing. So, on say a Saturday to play for an hour with a reservation you would pay $54 for the reservation, another $54 for an hour of play, and whatever food and drink you order. Enjoy!

nxgxv9nRRLX-2jjobFwfzg.text: I came into this location around 2pm today (Sunday) with my son and we had a blast. It was our first time at this location and we couldn't have been treated better. Sylvia was helping us out while we were there and she was great all around! We were lucky enough to have Sylvia and the staff surprise my son with "GOLFER OF THE DAY"! We had 4-5 staff members come over to our area to meet my son and hook him up with a goodie bag full of rad stuff! Thank you all so much!   I highly recommend this location!   ...ps, thank you for making everything so handicapped friendly...from the ramps and layout of the building but more importantly, STAFF that goes above and beyond to properly treat children with special needs.   We were stoked on our visit and we'll definitely be back!

blbAIp2C0fzzZdGSMd53Yw.text: Top Golf Scottsdale Arizona rocks!! Drinks delivered by Dez are awesome!! From the friendly service by Kim Chacho her guidance from her staff is truly amazing. They go the extra mile to make sure your Corporate party is a hole in one!!   Thank you again as we look forward to hosting our next company event with you.   Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZdSOeDvL-2NDFgI1T0JsOw.text: I would give them 10 Stars if I could. Georgie at Topgolf went so far above and beyond the line of customer service, it's hard to put into words my appreciation. She helped out with a very delicate situation for Father's Day, with little notice, and made an amazing day happen for my friend and his children, who recently lost their mother, his wife.  Georgie provided top level customer service with compassion, concern, and attention to detail, of the likes I have not seen before.  I'm blown away, truly touched.   Thank you, Georgie!!   Top Golf, you have a True, rare, bright & shiny gem working for you!!!

_xmjsCODao9AAAvVe21xag.text: This is fun stuff.  You don't have to be a golfer to like this - I'm not. I'm a total non-golfer and I had fun.  Not cheap during prime time, so not something you can do all the time, but if you go during off hours - it quite reasonable. But who can go then?  Food and drink is average, but you're not coming here for that.

FlX5lwIS2oQFO6aNFq-zyg.text: We stopped into the bar area before hitting some balls... we were lucky enough to get Lexie as our server.. . She is not only good at her job, she is funny and in a good mood which puts us in a good mood.  She watches over her tables and caters to you like you are her most important customer.  She will go far in life - you can just tell from her vibe.  I wouldn't say it if I didn't mean it.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We own the bar!  Very few here because of monsoon threat... I just call that an extra hazard!

mO0SOg0DZcL4cahdvPevNg.text: I can't say enough good things about Top Golf. Make sure to come hungry when you arrive because their food and drinks are great and the concept is ingenious. I love going with small and big groups of friends. I recommend to show up early on weekends because they don't take reservations and the bays are a 1-3 hr wait on Fridays Saturdays and Sundays. Plan accordingly because it's certainly worth it. The staff is always friendly too. My friends who have worked there always have nothing but positive things to say. That's already impressive in my book! :)

MNn_RC2lyDHLEjp4xWbTTA.text: What a NIGHT - Such a great experience, I preplanned a group event for my wife Laura's 50th Birthday. I first got contacted by Lauren Wagehoft from sales and she did a fantastic job. From helping me plan our event, selecting the menu, and extremely diligent on follow up. When we arrived we were greeted by Gunnar. He was unbelievable, staying with us throughout the entire evening and make sure we were taken care of supplying drinks and over the top service. I highly recommend planning your next Event at Topgolf...they go over the TOP!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Unbelievable great tasting FOOD!
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Thank you Gunnar, you made our event a success!
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We need to work in Laura&#39;s swing, lol. It doesn&#39;t matter if you are a Golfer or not, you will have fun!

0Rdt7kML0nSc4dOc1TCV5w.text: This place is a good time.  My favorite things about this place are... *you don't have to be a golfer--there are a variety of people there, from the hot shot show-off guys/girls with perfect form to the people who have the baseball swing and connect the club to the ball only some of the time. *you don't need to own clubs or bring yours because they have every kind, for both women and men. *you have your own little area so not to feel violated by others invading your space.  It's fun even with two people (a PERFECT first date spot) and especially rad with a group.  Plenty of sitting and standing space, with tables and cushioned chairs and servers who frequently check on you and bring you drinks/food. *menu is basic bar food but it's fantastic FOR being bar food.  My favorite thing are the fillable donut holes.  Jesus Christ and Satan himself, these are off the charts, kick you in the face type of wonderful.  A bunch of warm, sugary donut holes with huge syringes full of either Bavarian (the BEST) creme, chocolate (way too thin and runny) or raspberry that you fill the donut holes with yourself.  I love that you can put whatever amount you personally like into each instead of it just being what it is and how they decide to make it.  Usually it's never enough.  My mouth just filled up with spit.   *best Moscow Mules...I tried it for the first time here, and now order that every time I visit *your score is emailed to you if you choose, so you always have a memento or record of the games you come to play with friends.   *the variety of games you can choose, from super easy to the more challenging/semi-pro-ish.  All are so much fun; if you're the competitive type, this is the place for you.   On the flip side, some things I personally dislike are: *time flies when you're having fun, but so does the money out of your account if you want to play for multiple hours.  Pretty pricey.  My cousin and I went once and our bill with food and drinks came to about $200.  If you check, your screen will tell you how long you have left, but always be aware of the time and play accordingly.  Unless you can accurately flex, in which case go nuts.   *if they are too full and you're on the list, there's only one pool table to play on while you're waiting.  Seriously guys it's better to have zero.  That place gets packed, so if you're going to have pool tables, have pool tableS. I know it's not called "TopBilliards" but still....Anyway, to avoid any super sucky wait time, always get a reservation.    The pros outweigh the cons, by a lot...and I know I'm forgetting some other good stuff.  TLDR: you don't need to be a pro or even have a set of clubs--there's a grip of people who don't know squat about golf but everyone can play and have a great time.  You'll love it!

4YIOoeHOR2OazMyJp5OuRQ.text: I love this place. They have great food and great atmosphere. When I go their I usually get their right when it opens so. It is less busy. The staff is always nice a great their. I always get the chicken and waffles sliders. They are amazing I usually mix and match the sauces because both are good. The golfing experience there is always fun. It's like bowling but put into golf. It's always a fun time there.

E3y32s2jfQbaztV8mCwRaQ.text: Great place to go and hang out. I wasn't really into golf when I first started coming here but after coming almost every month I have improved my golf game. This is a great place to hang out with friends. The food is great, the game is great, the drinks are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

R8ZXMevYBOi20GY3M-yvmw.text: Top Golf is a blast. We had fun. Our kids had a great time. What else can you ask for? Well, not much really. One little thing though that's offputting is how they include the price of the game with any items your server brings out such as food and drinks as one bill, that percentage-wise, makes it seem that you need to tip more at the end. I mean, if it costs $35 to hit balls for an hour, and you order one $5 beer, you now owe more for the tip on that beer than the beer itself.  It seems like trickery to get the servers bigger tips. Not a fan of that method. Is that a little thing? I don't know, but I think I'll continue tipping on the service instead of the price to play regardless of how the bill is compiled.

O1kwwQJ-Kb58RRes-h4aLA.text: Came here again with family this time and we had the best time.  We had little bit confusion about the booking online, but the manager took care of it with no problem!  We originally had our bay on regular high table since we brought my 91 years young mother in law, we requested to move to the sofa instead and our bay attendant helped us with no problems at all, that was great.  We ordered couple light food here since it was a bit early for lunch and we loved it. Nacho was delicious and my son had chicken tender with fruit was yummy.  The service is great as always here, thank you again Topgolf!

4S_v6P3PtwNOUBN-awVnYQ.text: I went here for a team outing and had much more fun then I expected.   The service was great and the golf pro was very patient and helpful. While I won't be playing in the Masters anytime soon I improved with each game.   Even though the bays are in the shade, wear sunscreen because depending on the time of day you may have sun exposure and end up with some rosy cheeks   Wear comfortable clothes that you can move in as you will be golfing!

ZGBCLeiiM4jeFCFGtM92YQ.text: Beware of this place the workers are rude and if you even question why 4 "bays" have been open for 30 minutes and you are quoted a 3 hour wait time, you are told "trust me I work here every day, some one is coming" I hope you never get this type of service. Poor customer service. Don't believe the hype, most of the people on here are probably paid to say good things...

_FSGRBxekb9zHy5WYwjD2w.text: This place has the absolute worst service upstairs. The guy with the blue shirt with the name tag "rockstar" and the guy in the green shirt "Austin"  will absolutely ignore you when the bar isn't even full. Their customer service is terrible. You end up waiting so long for a person that acts like they hate their job. Don't waist your time dealing with them.

pZjSXZHB__W3KXGye-JHqg.text: Not impressed with the staff. Could have been a bad day for them but it was difficult to have a pleasent time because of them.

avdxVUMv6PqzvCuSUD41YA.text: I have a love hate relationship with this place. Somehow they built it wrong and you can't bring or use woods or hybrids for balls will go over the fence. They would not let my 5 yr old bring hers- if she can hit it that hard I should check her on the pro tour. Then they have this crazy checkin system with 2 lines and you have to remember to bring your card from last time. Very antiquated. Second line for a bay. Strange But once you are playing it is really cool - bar and wait service, decent prices and good food. Just not the place to actually practice your game. Only for social hour. The price is the same regardless how many players so good for a group. Expensive solo. Very loud

8GVNn6qH3ojujW8XxxDtjA.text: Love this place!  It's like playing Tiger Woods live!!

j916wehFJ5XM2u6W6dt7qg.text: Had a blast. Came on a Saturday night, host said 2 hour wait. We only waited an hour. Management very attentive and friendly. Will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Got r done.

0WmjoruE9ILtRz2kmnHxhg.text: Loved this place, you know right away that it is a hit when the parking lot is full and you have to park on the street. Don't let that deter you, it just means it is worth it. Great facility, everything is state of the art. Staff was friendly and fun.   Some tips: If you are gonna play I recommend to eat before you play, the bay cost is $45/hour prices differ depending when you go, with food it will slow you down and you will have a lot of waisted time. Appetizers and drinks while playing are a go however!  Cons: Registering as a member took a long time, but you only have to register once. Parking. Service can be slow, but it is a huge establishment, a lot of ground to cover and extremely busy, was to be expected.   Lastly, no Woods. Not a big deal, Top Golf really is not a driving range in the traditional sense. It's a target game, trying to earn points by hitting targets. It is a lot of fun and really great practice for the people who are going there just for that.

Jmjd1tmXSIZ5PEZ1guWZ1g.text: Fun thing to do with friends or family.   Your first time walking in is VERY confusing. You have to stand in a line to purchase the $5 lifetime membership which requires getting a players card set up. After that, you have to go to another line to reserve the bay. The signage isn't helpful at all in explaining what you need to do. If your lucky, someone walking around with an iPad will approach you and you can get signed up for the players card that way. If going with a group, I would suggest that everyone is already signed up for the membership card prior to going. Also I wouldn't recommend going on a Friday or Saturday night unless you want to spend 2-3hrs waiting for a bay to open up.   It's easy to see why this place is happening on the weekends because it is addicting and fun. You could easily spend 4-5hrs here. Bay rentals are $45/hr but if you split it between everyone playing it really isn't that bad. They don't take reservations, but once you arrive you can check in and get your name on the list.

1CIoxMK8-s2l4bTvKfNCZA.text: Awesome concept. Really fun way to hang with friends. Server Dakota - the man!! Kept the drinks coming!!! #dakota

rwm0k98XUuWz7qGdOjQ4Dg.text: Came here for the first time with my husband and another couple. The process of getting our $5 golf cards was easy and fairly quick for a Friday late afternoon. We requested a bay on a higher level and only had to wait about 10 min. Love that they give military/veteran discounts. The beer could have been colder . We ordered the chicken and waffles , it looks small bit was pretty filling.

cXk83wOE_F6rQr1ZCuaNIA.text: Great family fun!  Food is amazing and not overpriced.  Great place for kids and/or date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac daddy burger. Seriously amazing.

K3QqNMNRGxz-YQLINAj9bA.text: Good times, good food, and good service. Be sure to go at off-peak times so you're not dealing with long waiting lines.

4mNA3FyJk4J1jISI5YWjKg.text: We had never been here before, but myself and my group love golf and drive by this place all the time! We decided to stop by and a lovely young lady named Janet (from Pittsburgh) helped us and made us feel welcome and like family. She was very knowledgeable and provided us with the best customer service we've had all week. Next, our sever August showed the best customer service. He checked on us multiple times and even provided some awesome golfing advice! More places should have employees like Janet and August. I wish we could do more than just write you an amazing yelp review. You're awesome. We will be coming back a lot because of her.

7uYk02lj-itfZHWayqIPIw.text: I took my two sons here and we all had the best time.  They loved it but they were upset because I beat them in golf....lol.  They were trying to hit the ball to hard.  My game was to hit the ball closer to the holes... I then got more points.  BIG HINT....

Sosm0fLjHOF44Qmy8aqOMw.text: This is one of my favorite places in Arizona Finally we have a place to have fun and enjoy golfing I highly recommend visiting when get a chance it worth a try

rW_ruDOKGwScv4NQDt23dA.text: This place was so fun for our family of 6. Everyone had a fabulous time playing the golf games and corn hole. We decided to eat and play. The steak nachos...excellent...and the wings...so good. No wonder this is a destination!  We loved this and the kids are asking to go back before we leave town.  Only two negatives, long wait with no reservations allowed  and, oh, steer clear of the signature drinks, yuck!

CdWxq0p5G8rRmchepKEFsw.text: Very fun. Food average to bad. Drinks and food reasonably priced. Great for smacking some balls around if you're only a casual golfer. I got the grilled chicken sandwich most recently, after te server responded to my query re:  what the best sandwich was. It was below average. Maybe terrible, in fact. When he came back he seemed to have forgotten that o had asked him what his favorite sandwich was and said he loved the brisket grilled cheese; it was his favorite. Just tell it to me straight, g.   Stay away from the food. It's crappy bar fare. Just order cheap beers and have a few laughs over how bad you and your friends are at golf, and you'll have a great time.

8KpXXFBro8NmTY0g9IPxtg.text: Love it! Definitely worth the money, such a fun concept and I've never even golfed before! Service was great in the Bay Area but really really slow in the restaurant/bar area. The host said that today was the first day in months where they weren't on a 3 hour wait so would probably make reservations if they accept them. Definitely returning with friends next time!

iNsIUdSAVcz3C6GFQNFRog.text: This place is awesome! Great place to have fun and grab a drink. Our server Brock was great! Very hospitable and provided great service! Go whack some balls!

TsXx7_11nk6Vd39_gP_cjA.text: Fun place to go for a corporate event or with a group of friends. Definitely pricey (food, drinks and the golf). Food is okay but not why you go...you go for the fun atmosphere and ability to hang out with friends. Wait can be long, depending on timing. Staff is often around to order drinks or food from or help with the scoring machine. Bring your own clubs if your a serious golfer.

c6j4VXq1tXWDcXDr7PMMng.text: Ever feel mistreated because you're not part of the ELITE crowd?  Welcome to TopGolf Scottsdale.  As a supposedly 5-Star establishment, the poor reservation planning and staff treatment fully earns a 1-Star.  Our reservation was kicked back 2.5 hours...the reason for it appeared shady, but it looked like someone else had more money than I, because everything changed when he came in the door.  To make up for the wait, they offered to let us play in the basement level....No, No, and No.  From other unhappy reviews of Top Golf Scottsdale, this appears to be common practice with buying your way to play.   What is $50 to make a reservation?  Does anyone else do this? And it doesn't count for a damn thing.  Especially if they can't keep a reservation.  Then to "top golf" the night, they have young kids running the operation.  When you screw up someone's night, I don't need a high school kid telling me he can't fix it.   Get someone with authority to do your dirty work.

235ZVuyl0xiC2fhkqh9smQ.text: Came here for the first time over the weekend and had a BLAST. I wish they had these in CA. First of all, I am horrible. But it's such a relaxed atmosphere. Our server was so nice and attentive. We ordered drinks and chips and queso. The queso was amazing, salsa and quac not so much.  I had the mac and cheese burger which was huge and amazing. My boyfriend had wings and our friend got sliders which were great. I would definitely come back all the time if they were in CA.

xOJymIQVBjIzg0_3TYWktw.text: Great rates and easy to get a bay in the morning.  Staff is efficient and friendly.  I really enjoy this place with my family.

Da1ziXHHI8gIkevdWw0bKg.text: The operations manager Brian saved our night. Our group sat at the bar to order food while we waited for our bay... Everyone's good came but mine... To say the least, I was Hangry! They brought my food right away and also got me a free drink! Love love love the customer service. Wish getting a bay was easier.

B7SfSC6H3ItG_crH_BUEPQ.text: Only giving three stars to this place for the food and golfing. Coming from out of state I had heard many positive things about topgolf, unfortunately our service did not meet these standards. Our server, Adam D. Introduced himself, took our food order and was not seen again. After playing our one hour golf season for over 45 minutes our food finally arrived and we were rushed to finish eating. Understandable it was a busy night not once did Adam apologize for the wait or explain why our appetizers took over 30 minutes to come out. The golfing experience was fun and the food tasted great when we finally got it. Work on customer service and this place would be awesome.

dnNV4a_2NPl90HuKxD0jbA.text: This place is so cool! We went on a double date here and it was awesome! Michelle (from Boston) was the best! She took care of us and made sure we had everything we needed! Food was excellent and drinks we great! Can't wait to come back!

NKf2n-OntZxnc1fLvqpW4A.text: This was my first time at a Topgolf & I will definitely be back! I loved the atmosphere! It was fun to play (even though Im not good at golf) and the food wasn't bad either.

gNL7QyokdloBs8a4bztDdQ.text: This was our first visit to a Topgolf facility. We were greeted before entering, and given clear instructions. Every staff person from the membership counter, concierge, and host were extremely friendly and accommodating. We played for 2 1/2 hours and ate fantastic food and drank ice cold beverages. Our waitress was attentive and efficient.  I highly recommend this laid back, fun, relaxing place to all golfers from beginner to pro.

EmENER9TWX0V_wS6qRulIQ.text: What an amazing place this is. Everyone was super friendly, drinks were reasonably priced, they have games besides golf you can play. They had 2 pool tables and video games along with a lounge. The bar itself was big with lots of tv's. The place was busy but not crowded which was cool. The bartenders were friendly and were on top of making sure you had a drink. You can play different types of golf games and the rate depends on when you go (FYI - the rate almost doubles the later you go so try and get there in the morning)

PWd7J53DB4iwDeq2w-OLYg.text: Always a fun time at Topgolf good affordable night out with a group of friends. Signature drinks are always good. My issue from keeping this a 5 Star review is the food, it's just mediocre. I would personally like to see the menus fresher seems like a lot of fried/ frozen items/

g5-xdErFQIdkTcUDtGbz_w.text: This place is awesome. It takes your traditional driving range to the next level by making a game out of it, using computer-chipped balls to keep score. It's really not unfairly-priced, either, when you factor in the fun! The easiest thing to equate the experience to is going bowling, except the facilities are way better than about 99% of the bowling alleys I've been to (and I've been to a lot of bowling alleys. Ha!).  We stopped in just to see what it was about, and figured we'd play for an hour. Instead, we stayed for THREE hours. The fact that it's also a full service sports bar/restaurant with decent food and TV's at every bay where you can control the games you want to watch, makes it an incredibly easy way to spend a few hours. Especially during the NFL season when NFL Sunday Ticket is nice to have at your disposal.  The golfing aspect is cool. I didn't bring my clubs on our trip, so it's nice that TopGolf offers their own assortment of clubs. They're color-coded for men's and women's and the provide great visual references for people unfamiliar with the ranges of clubs, etc. The touchscreen controls for adding time and increasing your card balance is a bit confusing, but it's still fun and the ease-of-use makes extending your play easy (perhaps TOO easy!). Luckily, the staff is incredibly helpful if you have questions on how to use the system. The only complaint some may have is that TopGolf doesn't allow you to swap the tee height, nor do they allow players to bring in their own drivers or hybrids. Apparently, this is to help keep the balls in play, as pre-rule, people spent more time trying to hit the ball out of the range than playing the actual game, itself, and the ability to get under the ball meant a lot of chasing beyond the nets. Once our waiter explained that, I basically stuck to the irons and their 3-hybrid the rest of the day. You ARE allowed to bring your own irons in, though, which is cool, but the clubs they provide are perfectly fine and don't take away from the enjoyment at all. I did find that I didn't get quite as much distance from their clubs as I'm used to, but after a few swings, I simply adjusted to the lack of distance. Also, once you link up your account on their site, you can see your game history, progress, etc. It's a pretty cool!  The food was good. Better than I expected, honestly. We just got a quesadilla, and I got the turkey avocado wrap. The quesadilla was pretty standard, but the wrap was good. Tons of avocado, which I loved! I also downed 3 Texas Mules, which were also good (sorry, no copper mugs here). I'd equate the food to something like Chili's, which is what it is. Perfectly suitable for a golfing/sports bar/drinking experience.  As alluded to briefly, the staff was excellent. Our server (more like all-in-one TopGolf concierge/waiter/pro) was attentive, quick to answer any questions we had and always made sure our waters were topped off, our drinks were replenished and continually checked in to make sure everything was good with our experience.   If I ever find myself back in the Phoenix area, I'll most definitely return. Besides, it would be nice to use the lifetime membership card that they make you buy for $5 again. The one thing to note is that they have 60 bays to play from, but the lines got really long once 11-12 PM rolled around. We got there closer to opening and had no issue getting in, but I can imagine this place gets packed later in the day. Like a regular course, it's nice to get out there early! Although, we hear their nighttime experience is cool.  Enjoy!

wOBtSFqy2xRnmzudZUWJMg.text: YOU DO NOT HAVE TO BE A GOLFER TO COME HERE!   Just get on over there and have some fun. We were a variety of beginners and (wanna be) pros. It was such a fun time and we can not wait to come back.   Also, their breakfast burger is out of this world....YES!...The food is actually great, and not too overpriced.   Great place for group activities, but expect a wait.

Muf35-2G-kWi-Fufp6tg_Q.text: I tried to go to Topgolf last Saturday, and walked out when I found out my group would have to wait 3+ hours to get a bay. We returned this morning at 11, and got assigned to bay 204. This was my first time at Topgolf, and I was pleasantly surprised at how relaxed and fun it was! The lobby felt claustrophobic (it's small and it seems like there are about 300 people in there at all times), but our bay and the surrounding areas were not crowded at all. We ordered beer and food, and the food was very mediocre. It tasted like bowling alley/bar food. Nothing special. At least the prices weren't egregious.  As a non-golfer, I thought Topgolf was really fun and a great activity to do with a group of friends. The hourly fee seems steep for a single person or a couple, but splitting it between 6 people made it very affordable! I would recommend eating beforehand or after and just getting drinks while playing, since the food was very "bleh." Overall, I had a very fun time and am excited to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Perfect weather!

lKU3UZLvRQXqlTCLt8T3qA.text: We had such an amazing time, the beer was fantastic as well as the food. The service team was very knowledgeable and our server was excellent. We will definitely be back and with a bigger group!

Dp_m-8qUaKEG0oPqvUCiRA.text: Great fun for all types of people. Even if you have never golfed before you can still have a great time and are bound to make some eventually. All kinds of games for those that are talented in the sport and those like me who have very limited skills.   We stayed until after the sunset and they light up the holes.  There is a great view of the mountains from the upper deck and the misters keep the temperature doable even in the summer.   I came for a worth event and they had a nice assortment of foods. The staff are all very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely come back.
