sJ4j1nLhEpMu3q-cxfNaZA.text: Great concept and it was fun but it could have been more fun if any of the games had been explained to us and if the touch screen had worked properly. We will still return, hope the touch screen works properly (bay host said it was finicky) and ask our bay host about the different games.

Q3WX4UooioHufyiwqWmZtw.text: Don't waste you time and money.  Poor service and over priced.  What a disagreement.  It's really sad. Trust my post.

Hup9nBjcMIkTvXFPOfSkRg.text: Food and drinks were great, golfing was a blast, but I knocked off a few stars because the girl that set us up with our lane- Bailey, had an attitude more suited for the DMV, or maybe somewhere with no human interaction at all. We showed up all smiles and excitement for our first Top golf experience and she had us all pretty upset in under 5 minutes with her nasty attitude. I almost called the manager over after some of her completely inappropriate comments to my mom, plus the fact that she started our time without telling us and before our full party had arrived, but didn't want it to ruin our night. Once she was gone our waiter was great and we had tons of fun. Will go back, just not to that one.

PrPKADlteHqMuFCVqstcQA.text: Brady and Raven were the absolute best! They took great care of us. So accommodating, very knowledge and great to talk to. If I lived here I'd request them every time I came in. Thank you both!!!

elwJVuOCnmZpGu6Srlt31w.text: I'm from Ohio and it wasn't until I moved here until I found out what Topgolf even was! So much fun! Even better that I won :) Food was good and our waitress AJ was fantastic. She had us laughing the whole time and recommended some really good things on the menu I hadn't tried before. Also, my pop never even came close to empty! She was always there before I could even ask! The experience was awesome and our customer service was excellent. Please never get rid of the Mushi! It's my fav! Thanks Topgolf and thanks AJ!!!

-bockLCgHYaeTRlNHrGCZQ.text: I think the concept of this business is very interesting. You can order food, drink and hit golf balls. This is why they're not receiving "zero" stars. My wife and I sat at a table, in the lounge/bar area, and were NEVER waited on in the 55+ minutes we have been siting here. People, sitting in the SAME area, that came in after us, were served. To order drinks, I had to go to the bar, and order. Even still, I needed to get the attention of numerous people to order them, and then....receive them. This business seems to have enough staffing. However, they seem ill trained.  I'm not upset.....life's too short. Rather, it's pretty comical.

NJmxcoP80oiWKyRSAFIa6Q.text: I came here last night with my family. Super fun place and not as expensive as I thought. We payed $50 and got to play for an hour. You do pay $5 per person to get a membership card but I consider that not to be that bad. I will say playing golf is harder than it looks. Takes a few minutes to even get comfortable with the swing. This place is definitely a fun little thing to do in the night if you want to hang. Good atmosphere and insanely good food in my opinion.

OI11HCbssQUc9PNjqKsIHA.text: So much fun at such a great price!!   This place is a nice way to relax, be competitive and also have a lot of laughs with friends and family!   We all aren't golfers so it took golfing to a whole other level! Trying to aim for the different colors and get more points made it an exciting way to stay entertained. Service was great and everyone was very nice and helpful.   Food was good and a decent price.   I loved that there was a mix of people from those who are very good and serious about the sport to those who are just spending an evening trying something new.   I live in CA and I vote they bring one of these out here!!

zG4ryW21r_r5ghq0fgApmQ.text: This is just such a fun, fantastic thing to do with family and friends, regardless of if you have never swung a club or are an aspiring Dustin Johnson.  The music, atmosphere, the attentive staff, all top notch at TopGolf.  We were a party of 10 that grew to 14 that ultimately grew to 18 before it was done.  In town for Thanksgiving we had Forbes and Family we all wanted to see and have some entertainment for, half of he party being kids.  Unfortunately I called a day after they had stopped taking party requests but Erica was super helpful on the phone hiding me as to when to call and what to do.  When we arrived, Chris took over and got us what we needed.  The wait was long...remember it was day after Thanksgiving now...so we put our name in, and went to Flo's for Chinese and came back 2 hours later.  Viola...big party leaving...our big party gets the big bays.  Could not have worked any better!  Our server was awesome... can't believe I did not get his name.    Thanks for great family and friend memories this holiday, Top Golf!

wf4eoNmzPvDNGtuP3fCtqQ.text: I came here one Sunday night and I'm hooked! The golf is so much fun. It's 45$ per the hour during their night time. It's much better during the night than during their morning hours. During the night, the lights come on and the shooting range looks so pretty. I have heard that during Saturday nights the lines get pretty long. I was glad I went on a Sunday night. There is no real wait time ok Sunday, you can get a spot pretty quickly.   The food was surprising good too! Please take a look my pictures. You will see the delicious spread of food they offer. However, I would suggest that you not order their chicken and waffle. Besides that one dish, everything else came out delicious.   I look forward to spending more time here!

I've been to driving ranges all over the country and this takes the cake.  The only reason for four stars is the food is mediocre.  But the service is great and the experience is unmatched.

u79LewiYK6xFFsMK_opyKw.text: I'm a platinum member We're at the top golf in Scottsdale and Bobby it was the best part in Bay host I have ever had being a platinum I wish you worked in our location in Scottsdale I'm very pleased with his service and he was more than helpful I'm so glad I'm a part of because of Bobby he was very nice of us to get Antonio location

RuctucSLPSNIWMOTsrbwig.text: I absolutely love this place! It's great to go with family and friends to have a fun time! We usually go here on Sunday funday, to let loose and have a good time. They have good food and drinks, the wings are some of the best I've had, and they also have good chicken fingers. The service is great and the staff is very friendly and helpful.

3910UMkKeIHzMSDs1E_DUw.text: I have gone here many times since opening day. I love the location as it close for all my friends and family to meet there just right off the 101! The service can definitely be a little slow sometimes but they're handling a lot of bays at once so it's pretty good. The drinks are smaller than what they use to be and more expensive now (the golf bags for three or more people) but they're still good. It's definitely a fun experience and something you need to do if you've never tried. I like being on the top floor when actually playing but it usually has a longer wait. As for wait times they can sometimes run a little crazy once it was over an hour and a half. There are other free games downstairs and jenga and pool to enjoy while you're waiting. There isn't many other places like this in the valley where you can really have an enjoyable outdoor experience!

bSbJ3GnF_fxKWIZeVl0GgA.text: It's always a fun place to hangout with friends and have great time. Overall fantastic but took one star because of the amenities that they can maintain little better like the billiards for instance.

ccUz37xwek13HFpjt049dw.text: While I want to give this 3.5 stars, Yelp only allows full stars so dropping to a 3! This was a lot of fun and really cool concept - don't get me wrong, but gets expensive and QUICK. We played an hour with 3 people and then extended it 30 minutes, had a few beers and one app. It was $130 bucks. Also the "supreme nachos" were ten bucks and literally had 8 chips on the plate. This is a sports bar and golfing venue - no need to try and be fancy / pretentious. When I ask for nachos at a sports bar give me NACHOS. Service was ok, nothing special but have had worse.

ssYrR4m7ghpyF7iC5lcbyw.text: Golf was great they have clubs there for you so no need to bring them but they allow you to bring your own. From opening time to noon it's $25/hour from noon to 5:00 it's $35/hour and from 5:00 to closing it's $45/hour. Ideary was our "server"/helper whenever we were stuck on something he saw that and came to help us. When we were going to check out we saw Alex the manager walk by and he was happy to get ideary and have him check us out. All around great service and golf

7TKW10AuG2ImM67EUBsJeQ.text: I have been back multiple times and had better experiences. The managers have been good at responding to issues. They still struggle with a lot of newer staff but with such a huge operation it's to be expected.  Anyway i figured they deserved a upgrade to 4 as i have had good times recently.

LRUKx0BkePIEbOpFtLUyjQ.text: Always a fun time. This time, there was a bird that was stuck in the netting, kept trying to fly out but couldn't. You could tell a number of the patrons noticed and were worried. We brought it to the attention of the staff and they already had someone getting ready to lead the bird out. We watched the staff get the bird out and just thought it was handled perfectly. 11/10 every visit!

RgpCRuGA717XGuEKL8dEow.text: So fun! My family (of 9) came here last weekend and we had the best time. 4 guys who don't golf, 3 girls who don't golf, and a 3 year old- we ALL had fun!! Don't be deterred if you have never golfed... its fun no matter what! The food is actually reasonably priced and they have fun drinks! The only food item we didn't love was the queso. We were here for 2.5 hours of golf and we spent around $400 total. Not a lot considering the dinner, drinks, and entertainment! So worth it! We'll be back!

Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I don&#39;t think any of us had ever touched a golf club before this night

nhaO-7EYx8XW5tbXklPk0A.text: I love Topgolf a lot to enjoy a nice night out with friends! Even though I'm the worst at golf, it's always an enjoyable time to hang out with friends, maybe enjoy a nice night outside, drink some alcohol, and hit some golf balls. The music is good and always lively!   It's today's new "bowling alley" and I'm so glad they have one in Gilbert now! Can't wait to go to that one and see if it's the same thing as this scottsdale location.   They have two bars, one large bar downstairs and one smaller bar upstairs where the booth/range things are! The downstairs bar is pretty cool to chill with friends while waiting for your table! The bar upstairs is not really needed once you actually get your booth cause the waiter/waitress can take care of your drinks from there!  The food is actually not bad here too! There are a lot of snacks and foods that are easily shareable with more than 6 people! It's gets kinda pricey though so be careful not to over-order at first!   Overall I LOVE Topgolf, and I'll always end up here every so often!  Tips: 1) Go at night! It's wayyyy cooler, and you get to see the neon lights and stuff! 2) If you're going on Friday or Saturday at night, MAKE A RESERVATION ONLINE! It's so easy! Or else you'll have to wait for at least an hour 3) Get the cheese fries, it's probably the best snack food to get there 4) If you're celebrating a birthday or something, call in advance! They can help you set up your booth and stuff if you have balloons, cake, etc  5) The bathrooms are clean here, go ahead and go poop! Hahaha this is always a problem for me cause I hate nasty bathrooms

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Group pictures are a MUST at Topgolf
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

SYwjjb2VapHP2ucRAUDrRw.text: 4 stars for the novel Topgolf experience, 5 stars for the awesome service we received for a unique/slightly awkward situation!  If your only experience with golfing is mini-golf.....have no fear! I had NEVER so much as held a proper golf club before and I had an awesome time here acquiring a new skill (the fact that drinks are served here didn't hurt, either!)  I should say...you DO have to get over the inevitable crowd of wandering eyes from neighboring booths as you try to perfect your clearly-my-first-time-golfing swing. Once you get over the stage fright and you actually hit a couple balls, you realize why so many people enjoy golf :)   My group of 5 were having a great time when one of the waitresses came to clear our table of drinks and spilled her entire tray onto the floor, getting shards of glass all over our sandals and flip flops. It was cleaned up very efficiently, but not before we realized my boyfriend had a small cut on his ankle from the glass. Not a huge deal, but it was definitely alarming to see blood, and we were running out of playing time!  Because of this debacle, we had to rush through the last few minutes of our time to complete our second game. Luckily, we were later approached by management; they offered to refund all of our payments made towards playing time and memberships, AND offered us a round of drinks at the bar on the house.   5 thumbs up for going above and beyond to make sure customers are happy. I would definitely return to Topgolf, if I ever happen to be near one in the future!

t2NNGAiZK08CjlXtY5pf6Q.text: $35-45/hr but it's a lot of fun. Good games to play for beginners and advanced. Good service and people are friendly.

HchC6AF69YX1mmCDxKbnXA.text: Excellent service an accommodating when they make a mistake. Will definitely be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Picture perfect

v1wzMABRZtS8jSWur15Q3g.text: So our night started off pretty unfortunate. We got quoted 2 hours to golf so we played corn hole and ordered drinks and food while we waited. Our golf bay was ready before our food so we asked to talk to management to see what the issue was. Gregory showed up and catered to our every need. We felt that he cared about us and did everything in his power to turn around our experience which we appreciated so gratefully. The only reason we stayed was because of him and we ended up having a phenomenal night because of him! Thanks Gregory!

GVqKvnK4vVaWfvSIQWF-XQ.text: The staff is very friendly. I had a fun time here. The drinks are pretty pricey, but they were tasty. Didn't try any food.

Iwoa1EQkoinSoSCTA6Q8kA.text: Definitely worth checking out if you're in the area visiting.  Especially if you like to hit the range.  Ate at the restaurant - service was good and the burgers were quite good.  Don't order the chips/guac.  That was disappointing.

Tl5NMXShVb92VuiGBqFteQ.text: If you have not joined Top Golf.....why not!  We went to the soft opening today and we could not have had a better time.    Having been to the Houston location I was already familiar with the layout.  Imagine a high class, yet comfortably non-snobby, driving range with cabana like personal bays inside an enormous club/restaurant.  The food and cocktails are destination worthy on their own (you have to try the donut holes that come with injectable sauces.)  And everyone from age 5 to 85 can participate.  (I don't even play golf and yet I couldn't help but play a game....and I won!)  There are also pool tables and video games etc for those that prefer to wander around.  And I cannot speak highly enough of the service level; their staff is groomed to perfection.  Whether you want a family day, a night out with friends, or a team building event for work, you cannot help but have a fantastic experience.

Zjs_rKy-4ai1wKux8kXsaA.text: I rate top golf a 4 out of 5 stars. We went there with a group of people and we had a two hour wait so we played the outdoor games by the bar/dj. It was Saturday night and it was packed. When it was time for us to golf and grab our spot the server came right over but could of been a little more attentive. We were charged a 1$ more for a margarita on the rocks, weird.. But it was a good evening and a lot of fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

yOH2BfSJJ5Hpao_QtXgHTw.text: Came out for a friend's birthday defiantly a cool place to hangout, & have some drinks! The drive course is fun if your into it, or like myself to watch. Drinks are real good and the bartenders are nice however the server we got once we were assigned our lane was a little slow (think she was new). All in all it was fun!  PS they have a pool tables, corn hole, wii, among other games if golf isn't your thing.

DYR_yPZT_ZBTIfq7fYxtdA.text: Came here on Sunday for my younger brothers birthday. Waited about an hour for 2 bays but we hung out in the restaurant and drank. None of us golf at all but we had a great time! Can't wait to go back and check it out again.

E9zWOwAqwXTilDRRFcyq-Q.text: I have been there a few times.. always expecting it to be more fun than it really is. Basically a lighted driving range where you can only have one ball at a time.   Overall not really impressed but will probably go back because that seems inevitable.

UOXRHIEwS2tmMXBoBrCdsQ.text: Fun place!  Food and drinks are great and reasonably priced.  I'll be going often once the weather gets a tad cooler

gu7o8Nqyg3DpMsnlmS6x4w.text: My husband and I were on vacation and came here with friends who live in the area. Such a FUN place!!! This was our first time at any top golf. It was a little confusing when we first got there. There was a greeter who told us to go to the desk to sign up for a membership (5$) but told us only one person was allowed up there at a time. I went up there and told them we were going to get some food first and they told us to just come back after we had food. The food was really good!!! 3 of us had the chicken and waffle sliders! YUMMMMM! We had a craft of mimosas too! Great way to start the morning! Once we got to our bay, we had a server there right away asking us if we wanted drinks. The games were so fun! We had a blast!!

TD4lId18a5cVcCHVfuTyMg.text: Great place to go if you are looking for a good time.  Because its so new there is sometimes a very long wait.  (I suggest not trying to go on a Friday or Saturday night).  The drinks are a little pricy so plan ahead.  Food is amazing.  I have nothing bad to say there.  Enjoy yourselves and come and hit a few balls.  You will be happy you did.

QuXaSG8KT-k6wX1CiSrPkA.text: What a fun Girls Night Out! The atmosphere was great, as always, and we love the upstairs bay. Yummy food, great wine, and SO much fun golfing!! Michelle from Boston and Erica are AWESOME and totally took care of us tonight. We will definitely be back!

0UwpihIm1vKfy2kXpHH3KQ.text: I need to tell you about my Topgolf experience. The greatest server of my whole life, Chloe Johnson, was my bay hostess this past Friday night. She took care of my many drink orders, catered to my request of having a "trough" to eat my food out of, and bantered back and forth with me mercilessly with comedic genius. She absolutely made my evening spectacular and I have already found myself back here again the very next day! If there was such a thing as sever of the year award, this girl would be the absolute most deserving of it... Standing ovation! Topgolf, you have a gem on your hands... Give this girl a raise!

Kr-_xjISJEpXeBJlHELPyg.text: Great concept and really fun experience, but what we were super impressed with was the customer service.  The wait time for our bay was relatively quick for a Saturday afternoon and since it was our first time, everyone was very helpful in explaining how it all worked.  Apparently, something went awry in the kitchen after we ordered and there was a delay with our pitcher of beer and some of our food.  Our waitress was very nice and apologetic and even got her manager to comp the missing food as well as give us some extra playing time - even with no complaining on our part.  I know people complain about the food quality but it really wasn't that bad.  You'll have a great time with great service here!

lbS3sVhjGrq_Ww4zgVYHZg.text: We have visited this location several times, and We always ask for Kylee as our server now. She goes above and beyond to make our visit enjoyable. Our drinks are always replaced before they are finished, we are never left looking for her because she checks on us several times and is fast and efficient.  Gregory, a supervisor, is friendly, knowledgeable and makes a point to say hello and makes his rounds touching base and confirming customers are taken care of. The service here by all team members is top notch. They also have a wide selection of food and we have not been disappointed with anything we have tried. It tastes fresh and comes out to our table hot.

QrTPMQ7kjM6hAkWhvcDcog.text: Overall it was very fun, however the "negatives" we experienced during our time here ended up outweighing the "positive". We came on a Saturday night, so expectedly there was a wait. Thankfully we found a little area on the bottom floor away from the bar and DJ (because it was SO LOUD we couldn't even hear each other talk...). Didn't realize we not only had to pay to play, but had to pay JUST TO BE THERE (i.e.- required memberships). Once our entire group got set up, a random name appeared on our list so we deleted it and tried reswiping the membership card of who's name didn't show. The card wasn't set up properly. In order to get things straightened out, it took almost 10 minutes that actually counted AGAINST our paid time... time was never reset. Once we got started, it was very fun. Time went by quick but that happens when it's fun! But then once our time was over, a random guy swooped in within SECONDS of our time expiring to kick us out -- "do you want to add time? Once I close this out, the booth won't be yours anymore" ... so we told him we'll close out, he told us to have a good night and we left. Once we were outside, we realized we never actually paid anyone. We went back in and found a manager who acted grateful, until they told us to wait and ushered us into the loud bar area. We seriously had to wait 15 minutes to close our check out and didn't even get an apology from the manager. Nothing. Overall very disappointed with the customer service on all levels. 9-9-17 @ 10pm

23gBxnTSh-UNdE0DVGAOMw.text: Food is pretty good. Nice bar inside. Make sure you have plenty of people to share your pad. That way you rotate playing games and get your money's worth. We had 3 people and only 2 played. It gets old lol....and tiring.

06fOZEYn2On1cJl_LPHTgw.text: Super fun place to hang out, my husband loves coming here and the service is always really good.  The place is always kept nice and clean and they play good music!   They have a good selection of beer and food. The deep fried pickles are so good and crispy! They also come in a cute little basket.  I know this seems stupid but I don't understand why they don't have toilet seat covers in any of their bathrooms, for the amount of people that come here you would think they would have them. But other than that! We love top golf!!

O7yQ9aGKkRn1oEO9BxTeYw.text: Kimberly and Leslie were so wonderful! My bracelet flew off whilst golfing and they were very helpful in retrieving it! 5 stars for the management team.

34eWMz2f14Ou97A29s1uKA.text: Non-golfer's review of a golfing place, so take it with a grain of salt...  My company held a corporate event here, taking over most if not all of the driving ranges for an evening. The different "lanes" on the driving range all had high-top tables or sofas and coffee tables (a better choice for me to sit and chat with others, as I don't golf much, so thanks for putting comfortable furniture out there!), patio heaters and drink service. The golfers in our group really enjoyed it. Our group also had buffet food service, which they don't have a lot of room to set up near the driving ranges, but it mostly worked. My only gripe is our group drink tickets didn't include the wine I wanted and even if I offered to trade all three drink tickets for one glass of what I wanted, they wouldn't do it though that would've worked out financially to their advantage.

-emdQGn-lNhvpxaQGywQMw.text: We really enjoy spending family time here. They have good food & great service. You don't have to be good at golf to have a fun time.

A9gcDkBB5_VdtzbVcAq3mQ.text: Whether you want to 'play' or are serious about working on your swing and ball control - TopGolf is your solution.  The evening experience is a melting pot of the cosmic bowling atmosphere, games similar to darts, but with golf clubs.  Erin and Shawn have touched on this side of TopGolf entertainment in their reviews.  The daylight hours are a great experience as well.  Remember the old saying about mullets - "business on the top and party in the back"?  Some are there to have fun, but If you're there to seriously work on your game you will have service better than you'd receive from TCP, Troon or others  The staff are outstanding ( I've had six different bay hosts/hostesses and recommend Valerie or Victoria).   I'm there to work on my game, so the games have little value to me; however, they come in handy for when you are working on placement.    Now, here's the rub - the pricing is really reasonable for the group of 4 to 6 looking for a couple hours of entertainment.  It's not for the individual.  But wait!!!  They have memberships that you can sign up for that the monthly fee is roughly equal to playing for four hours on a pay as you go basis.  They're broken down into three types:  1. EARLY DRIVE - $80/month and you enjoy unlimited range time from 9am to noon, Monday through Friday. 2. LATE NIGHT DRIVE - $100/month and from 10pm to close, Sunday through Thursday, you can play unlimited.  Spend 2.5 hours during this timeframe without a membership would cost you $100 bucks; so, its great for good entertainment on evenings other than Friday and Saturday. 3. DAILY DRIVE - $150/month gets you the unlimited play during the middle of the day to early evening, plus a bonus of $200 in credits towards other time slots.  You won't realize just how reasonable these memberships are until you go and experience TopGolf for yourself.  Whether you are young or old you'll have a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Say happy birthday to Devin!
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kQY7hXlT1DFPbP0o6Yfwkw.text: Came here last night for the first time and had a great experience at TopGolf. From the second you walk in the door the staff was really friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable in helping you figure out how to get situated.  The facilities are incredible, and the bar on the main level is large which makes for a nice sports bar environment. They've also got billiards tables, Xbox Kinect, and Fooseball to make sure that even the kids are entertained when not hitting golf balls.  Having three floors of hitting bays is awesome, and I definitely recommend getting on the top floor. Being able to look out over the field and seeing the targets is really cool. This is definitely no "driving range", people that would consider themselves moderate to very good golfers should not need anything close to a driver when hitting balls here (okay, maybe the ladies but definitely not the guys). The experience is more about target shooting and racking up points in their pre-programmed games, not hacking balls as far as you possibly can.  I'll for sure be back at TopGolf, the entertainment value is high for everyone even if you're not into playing the links or taking swings at a regular range.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0III2hbpibPxC1-c9r5z_A.text: I will be the first to tell you, I am the worst at golf! When we came here I was kinda concerned that it wouldnt be any fun because I am so bad!!! But, it was quite the opposite! We ordered drinks that were delivered to our area, and food too! I wasn't really worried at all because it was so much fun! There are fans going, and music playing... the vibe is great! And the staff is really attentive... so now I don't really care that I suck at golf, cause now it's fun!!!

aZ2ZSw3_6kQBdCxL2aPtcQ.text: While waiting for our golf bay to open up, Ryan was our bartender/server and he was so awesome! Great service, fast drinks and lovely eyes! Super personable and he answered all of our questions and was very funny. Golfing here was awesome and super fun. Would recommend coming here to anyone visiting scottsdale. The only bad thing about this place was that it's a long wait but it's worth it for sure!

hTBcJLVSuFl6Q9HG_7-8EA.text: While there is so much about Scottsdale to love, add to this list a Topgolf location! (Soon coming to my hood, Virginia Beach, VA.) This was a nice way for me to finally experience this before having to wait hours and hours of waiting with the soon to open location in my hometown.  This is an experience. For an avid golfer like myself, I sometimes wonder how things like this will fare on a fun scale. Putt putt golf isn't fun. Could this be a glorified driving range? Not so much. It's really just a fun thing to do, golfer or not. Heck, even if you're not a golfer, you can just come out for food and drinks. Think Dave and Buster's with a golf club.  First, it's gorgeous. Lots of green, lots of lighting, lots of bins so you can have endless groups enjoying their time together. You hit into targets and based on how close you get to your target, you're awarded points. For folks that aren't good at golf and simply make contact, the ground is hard enough where your ball can roll into the hole for points (where golf on a golf course requires you to hit the ball in a specific direction and with hazards and natural terrain, a specific distance), thus making it enjoyable for anyone to score and compete in their many games.  The cool thing about playing at this location in the evening is the Talking Stick Resort in the background. Bright and continuously changing and waving lights emit the building and makes for something pretty to look at with the already pretty golf design of the driving range.  Could this be a weekly adventure for me? I think so. :)

8Gbq977a2ry9qsKnmSklNg.text: We came to visit a friend in Arizona and came here. One of the best and coolest experiences I've had. The way everything is ran and the technology is mind blowing. The food was good and the beer prices were cheap. Definitely would come back here and wish they had a location closer to home.

6Csht4RmYVnjeU2KNF1LLw.text: Had a blast at Top Golf last week.  Although a little pricey for the hour it is a great  place for some friendly competition!    We were able to get in right  away on a busy Sunday  afternoon.  We had some issues with our monitor but were  able to get it reset to a little more than an hour which is great because they charge by the hour.  My only concern and my reason for the four stars is that no one knew how to fix  it or where to fix it.  It took the server several trips  to finally get the issue resolved.    All in all Top Golf  was awesome.  Definitely going here  again hopefully with a group of friends  I can show off my skills to.

cwJyYl4QiqxQCUuuiM2r_A.text: Planned a Father/Daughter National Charity League event here for 13 teams = 26 fathers and daughters.  The food recommended by Dulia, Top Golf coordinator, especially the cinnamon sugar donuts with chocolate and raspberry sauces was extremely tasty (no food from a box here!)  Check in was quick, servers were attentive, and everyone had an INCREDIBLE experience which EXCEEDED my expectations which rarely happens!  Laughs and tons of fun for everyone, even if they didn't consider themselves as a "golfer".

hNA5_T5fNvfKKXR7HzteeA.text: Top Golf, is an awesome family sporting facility, offering men and women, adults and children the opportunity to a peaceful exciting atmosphere, friendly and interactive customer service, and a variety filled menu.  My kids had a BALL golfing and playing the WII..! The best place thus far to have a fun family day out!

bvTYhArSMwTmfG7x1ZRUEw.text: Whether you love golf, hate golf, or just suck at golf (I'm pretty much all three), this place is a blast.  I came here with my siblings for my Dad's birthday upon a recommendation from a co-worker.  Even my sister who never plays golf had fun with us here.    Its not a course mind you, but a driving range with various targets located throughout the range.  The targets are situated at various points from as close as 50 yards to as far as 225 yards.  So no matter what clubs you use or even if you habitually duff your shots, there are still plenty of opportunities to get points.  You can bring your own clubs or rent clubs there.  You pay for a bay at the range by the hour (price varies depending on the time of day) and a computer terminal helps you set up whatever game you want to play with your friends.  We just went with the TopGolf game so we could just let it rip wherever we wanted.  The staff there are incredibly friendly and helped us with any questions we had.  Total cost for a two hour session at our bay on a Saturday morning was $50.  You also have to pay a $5 membership card fee if this is your first time here (once you have your membership card you never have to pay for it again).  Altogether we paid $30 in membership fees.  So split between 5 of us (we didn't let my Dad pay obviously) the total cost per person for our time here was $16.  Considering some actual golf courses charge that much for a single bucket of balls on their driving range, a pretty solid deal.  The driving range has three levels so there's plenty of space (though it was getting busy when we left).  Its shaded and has swamp coolers so its still useful during the summer.  There are also bars at each level serving booze and you can order food from your bay or at the sports bar downstairs (we didn't order any food this time).  If you have a big party or corporate function you could seriously spend hours and hours enjoying yourself here.  In the end my family had a great time and actually my sister beat most of us despite having little golfing experience.  Mark my words, I'll get her back next time.

sTnQVJyodvTe5AY26uTZVg.text: I've been to Topgolf before, and have organized events to have people join before as well. I have always had fun and a great experience.  Today I carried in my clubs to join a friend for her birthday party and we all had a very positive experience. We all laughed, ate, had a few drinks, and shared a fun time together. While wrapping up our visit, it was my turn to finish up my round.   I grabbed one of my clubs, placed my ball on the tee, and in my back swing, some guy dressed in a football jersey yelled at me and told me that I couldn't use a hybrid or a wood. To a bunch of amateurs who rarely golf, and most of us had never been, we were all left confused with the interaction.  Without staying around to answer questions or clarify, he angrily told us to not use our own clubs and then left.  I honestly thought he was from the bay next to us, then realized he was an employee. We were all left standing there, kind of shocked.   Nobody had said not to use our own clubs. Nobody had explained woods, hybrids, etc. that may seem elementary, but to those of us who don't golf regularly, it came across extremely rude.   Our waitress was very apologetic, and came over and apologized to me and the group. The manager came and expressed similar sentiments. It was such an odd, out of place interaction.   Overall it was a great experience, but for someone who is representing such a great company and establishment who is out of uniform to come and belittle, criticize, and then not try to professionally address the situation, it was very shocking. I can only hope that they move forward without him.

g8sV0-0R3k55in8QVWHOBQ.text: This was my first time here and it was such a blast. We had to wait for about an hour but sat in the bar and chatted with Michelle and she was awesome. Friendly and attentive. Wish more managers were like her most of them are on a power trip. She made the experience wonderful and we will be back.

d1pK6nlPcteSbW1DtI12Tg.text: Golf and Grow has lessons at TopGolf the 2nd Tuesday of each month and PGA Pro Jesse Hughes is the right man for the job. He is able to help golfers of all skill levels develop the fundamentals associated with hitting consistantly good golf shots.   Can't wait for next month to see what Jesse has in store for our golfers.    Thanks, Jesse!

vKYrnAunxifBJwj-8aEVbQ.text: My first top golf experience was a hole in one!  Great food.. brunch was exceptional!  Why oh why isn't there a location in San Diego??

Rm5_Tef20rm3AXonS6zVrA.text: Whether it is for Brunch, Lunch or Dinner this place has been consistent! I have enjoyed visiting Topgolf every time I have gone. The place has just recently opened but it seems their kinks are getting worked out better and better with each visit. I would suggest 6 people per bay because of space and time to play. Food and drinks are awesome and well prepared! Word to the wise if your planning on visiting for your first time.. Go online to topgolf.com and register for a membership. It costs $5 which is the same for in store purchase however, it will SAVE you A LOT of time. If you register online you can walk in and they will print the membership card right away. Just be sure to have you RE # from the confirmation email! This is a great place to visit for all ages. I just recently was there with my twin brother and sister ages 4 and my 83 year old grandmother. Everyone hit balls and had a great time! Weekends are certainly the busiest so plan ahead. Even in this 100 degree weather they have all the bays chilled with fans and misters.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fore!!

94k2fG_FHW27hs5tp4-WyQ.text: The golf and venue for entertainment is absolutely 5 stars! Great concept and fun to hit balls for any level of player. The food is typical bar food and not the greatest which is the only reason I dropped them down to a 4 star.  I'll definitely be a regular here and do some events for my company here as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Yd-qm737AsXTJW2lWd0xHA.text: I've been waiting for something like this my entire adult life.   Drinks. Golf. Gamification. Music. Culture.   This place has it all. The food is very good, if not stellar. They've done an amazing job defining a menu that's both eclectic and modern. The corporate Chef really knows his/her stuff. Pricing is right in line.   Now, for the golf. Handicappers on all levels have dreamed of a place like this. Grab a beer, an iron of your choosing and let the games begin. Pinpoint tracking of your ball down to the foot and inventive games preprogrammed for quick play.   Looking forward to joining in their tournaments throughout the year.   This place is 5 stars without hesitation.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EQP17uH_57Jl2OWtC3FLKQ.text: We had heard a lot about how fun Top Golf is. Having never swung a golf club in my life (other than in a couple of mini golf outings), I was skeptical about how much fun it could possibly be for a non-golf enthusiast. We decided to give it a shot for my hubby's (also a non-golfer) birthday and we had a great time. We paid $5 for the lifetime membership card and put our name in to rent out a bay for five of us. At $45 per hour, it was a great deal. We waited in the bar area for a little over an hour (we arrived at about 9:45pm) before we got the text that our bay was ready.  Gameplay was fun, even though four-fifths of our group were novices. We signed up for an hour of play and extended for another 30 minutes as the original window neared its close. The servers were friendly and attentive; we never had to worry about running out of drinks as they returned to check on us often. Highly recommended as an out-of-the-ordinary night of fun.

r6jlqBeCpIt80zoO80eJcw.text: I was super stoked about this place from the beginning. It brought a new light to golf that was for everyone in the family even if you aren't a golfer. The staff nows how to personalize your experience and make sure that you are well taken care of.  I was very excited to be part of the platinum membership. I have never waited for a bay and the platinum host when they are around remember your name and are always in a great mood  and there to make sure your receive a great experience.  The reason I am only giving them 3 out of 5 stars is not reflective of the staff but more so in the fact that there has been several limitations since they opened with being a driving range.  Since they opened they cut off tee's .... Not a big deal.. Then a month later without any warning to their members they would no longer allow any Driver, Woods, or Hybrids?? Apparently they underestimated the Golfer's in PHX.  SUPER BAD PLANNING.  In order to rectify this for the members the did refund us for one month because of the new rules that went into effect.  However, the following month I was charge with nothing changed. I put a call into the General manager whom I had a conversation with prior, informing her that going fourth I think the way TopGolf handled this situation the new club rules mad me feel like I was a little kid and not trusted, and not informed which we all should of been rather then walking up to the facility and being asked to return our clubs to our cars in the 115 degree weather..  I do want to point out that their are some amazing staff that does work their and makes my 25 minute drive across town worth it!!   The General manager was kind enough to refund me for another month which I feel I truly appreciated.  It has now been nearly 2-3 months and not much has changed as far as the rules go and in fact seem to of gotten worse..  For awhile now if I brought my own clubs I was again told without any prior information that I would only be allowed to use my own clubs on the bottom floor..  This to me made TopGolf, more of an inconvenience and absolutely not worth the membership.. But I do want to mention again that I was originally charged for this month but then after speaking to the general mgr it was refunded.  I was told that I was see some changes very soon. The only things so far is they changed the balls which now have a horrible and not realistic golf bounce and we are again able to use ONLY OUR IRONS on all floors makes it tough to call this place a driving range at all.. It is still a great place to entertain and have fun but if you are coming her to really practice your game save it for a real course and driving range  I truly love the concept of this biz but because of extremely poor planning and lack of organization I am at the point where if i am not allowed to use my other clubs very soon I no longer feel as though paying out $250 a month is worth the time and effort to go to TopGolf.  Hope they get there act together real quick or else I feel they are going to lose many more fans and members of this great Biz venture.

2sNx7N_tI0q3wqlmAAWmAg.text: The most fun I have ever had on a business outing! They have nothing like this back home in Virginia, too bad, because I would be here every day.  This place will put bowling alleys out of business. It's all I could think of when I was there. I don't golf, but this place was awesome! The food was good to. We were here for a catered event and had some awesome chicken, asparagus, rolls, mashed potatoes... it was great!  I played for free and ate for free so I can't comment on the price, I saw that it was somewhere like ~25.00 an hour. Seemed reasonable, I would pay it if there was one near my house.

2PWa3QK3apg5fEmxHogu3w.text: This place looks amazing, great facilities...but that will never make up for the absolute worst service I have experienced in Arizona.   We were told our wait for a golf spot was 30 minutes.  So we went to the bar to have a drink.  We sat at a dirty table that never got bussed for over an hour while we waited for our golf lane that was only supposed to be a 30 minute wait.  Not only that, but no one took our order for 20 minutes, then only served us one drink and we never saw them again.  It took us going to get a front desk staffer to find our waiter to close out our bar tab.  We were so frustrated that we ended up asking for a refund and leaving.

ZT43aL_C-PQhZTw8O0bKFw.text: Great place to come and hangout. Love the games they have and the concept of the whole golfing and scoring points. Can be pricey but if you go with a group the price goes down per person.

qYuQtyQjmQLIatr0m36NjQ.text: hello went there for my first time and o boy was that a  pack house the server we got was  great and wonderful her name was Samantha York did a great job   made my first time wonderful

8lNKVXKgqPB9UuPKXLpx7g.text: Nothing like what I expected. Now I know why they always appeared packed! Went for my wife's birthday dinner. Ordered and were seated in the bar until our spot was open. Super cool how you rent for the hour and can hit as many balls as you like in that time. An hour is a perfect amount of time for everyone to get their golfness out and feel a little sore the next day. I don't remember which hamburger I got but it was the one with the egg on it. It was awesome. Fries were great. I would have gotten my hamburger a little more rare next time. Loved it though.

r_dLvcHlckj0wynskZsiZA.text: I came here last Sunday with my family to celebrate my dads bday and we had a great time! Even though it was hot out, they did a good job keeping it cool out where you hit the golf balls and eat. We ordered the pretzel bites for an app and they were good. I ordered the mushi and tater tots for my meal and they were also good. Oh, and I ordered a sangria but I didn't like it very much, so I would not recommend the sangria. Other than that topgolf is a fun time!

wuW9mKIjLBJx4I6NWvsPwg.text: Three stars for the fun time and bomb pepperoni flatbread I had, missing two stars because service sucked. This was my first time at Topgolf, and I had such a phenomenal time with my friends. We ordered our food 15 minutes into our golfing time and it wasn't brung out to us till 10 minutes left of our golfing time so about 35 minutes to get our food out to us! Server was very inattentive, and rude. It was a busy night so I am understanding if the kitchen and stuff were busy but all he had to do was relay to us that he was sorry for the wait and he would get it out as soon as possible, but of course not. Work on it Adam D, if you go you'll have a blast but make sure you don't have a terrible rude server everyone looked great and helpful except my server, totally my luck!

Nqpw-XZN0wCp4uqQ5UNDag.text: Awful service in the restaurant. Super slow. Had to cancel my order after waiting for 30 minutes. They couldn't care less

bbbpmcr6S84YFRVxqSfVRA.text: Been here several times in the past year and I always have a great time!! The nachos are killer and the drinks are reasonably priced. This is also the only way I can get my girlfriend to play golf with me so it's a win win!

cye5nhaJ8G2J97-Fi3DesQ.text: If you like any of the following things, then chances are you will like this place: - Golf - Fun - Bars - Food - Competition - Friendship - Smiling - High Fives - Ranch  If you don't like any of those, then you might need to take a good long look at your life. Or you might be a vampire. Or dead.  Either way, this is basically a sports bar meets a three-story driving range, which, yes, is about as cool as it sounds. I don't even like playing golf and I had a good time. The food was pretty typical, but the drink selection was better than your average sports bar. My only real complaints would be not enough seating in the private golf areas and a little too long of a wait time in between server visits.  Again, worth checking out if you're looking for a fun, unique experience with a good group of friends.

_gDVXl8eVsGFx7Pc5Tum5A.text: Excellent sports ball. It's bar food, but super good bar food. Great drinks and fun atmosphere. I took my decrepit, aged mother here and even she had a great time!

zsjALw9IRTSAFDOo0gjHHQ.text: Done.  Over it.  This place has ton of potential and I can see why people have given it 5 stars.  Drinks are well made and almost all of the food is really good.  But I've come here to play golf.  I'm still waiting.  After two visits to this place, I admit they were on busy Saturday nights, we have yet to actually get a lane.    Both times we showed up knowing the wait was going to be long.  So we bellied up to the bar, ordered some food and got our names on the waiting list.  Both times we were told it was a 2.5 hour wait.  In speaking with the employee with signed up with, we were told it would probably be under 2 hours in actuality.  Well bot times we were 3.5 hours into our wait before we tossed in the towel.    If you don't have hours just to sit around and wait, don't plan on playing any golf.  Whatever they tell you the wait it, add an hour.  Good Luck!

tTxa23WX_sUhUyUX43GEqw.text: We are platinum members and we always have a great time at top golf! This week we met an awesome drink runner named Jamie! She was pretty awesome and she was really great at bonding with us! Can't wait to go back! Thank you Top golf for you exceptional customer service!

2_8pFEvfylxWmm1VB2YdjA.text: Ordered 6 items and only got 3 and after like )have an hour of finishing the 3 items(food) we got we told the server that we are missing 3 more items and the she said "what were they again?" so from that we knew they didn't make the remaining 3 items yet and if we were going to wait for them to make those items, it would be another 30 more minutes or more, it was my first time and unfortunately i'm never coming back again

rri9rjxRxcFlhdsepFTgWQ.text: Although this place is quite on the pricey side for two people, it is a great time. Their Bloody Mary's are fantastic! They have great brunch specials as well. The view both during the day and at night is spectacular. Great for company that is visiting out of town!

A8KBPMcqc-zSPDkSJLpI_w.text: The bartender's tonight are the absolute worst. A couple dudes with no personality, walk right past you with empty drink glasses. They have no skills and no clue. You need girls behind the bar. These guys suck bad. Have watched many customers wait for a long time to get drinks and some got up and left.

ALhb-wf8lu_EF7oIu0vUkg.text: Top golf is awesome!  How can you not love ripping some balls and getting the satisfaction of placing some nice shots without the frustration of trying to find the bad ones in the bushes!  The food here is really good also.  They make paying for time in the bay easy and hassle free.  We love coming here for family events because the atmosphere is great for conversation and we can get in some friendly competition.  Fun times!

_dAOwS1ppIXLHkwzPnwKJg.text: We came here for my husbands birthday on a Friday June 17 and it was one of the best experiences we have had! Never has it been bad, but they went above and beyond to make a great experience!  I was worried because we couldn't make a reservation we had about 11 people in our party so we had to have 2 bays, so we went super early to put our name on a wait.. There wasn't one when we got there so we went and had a snack in the bar, nachos were great! I just kept checking in with the front and they kept me updated on what I needed to do to get our bays together!  We got up in our bays at the time we expected with everyone together and our server Brian came right over introduced himself and got us all waters and other drinks started!  As the night went on he took really good care of us and it did get a little warm and I noticed one of the fans wasn't spinning on our side of the bays so I had asked a lady named Michelle if there was anything we could do right away she called maintenance for us and they did the best they could for the fan to be in the middle of each bay and not just on one! She was super nice and made sure there wasn't anything else we needed!  We absolutely love Top Golf, the people, the food, and the fun! :)

4awIx8a-OFbnbIWKtsnjCw.text: I haven't golfed in many many years, not due to lack of desire, but sometimes you just don't make it out on the course.  I have, however, been to Topgolf a few times over that time, and been able to swing and whack and take out some frustrations.  I was in rare form the other night, and it was made even more special by being with some work peeps and being in an outdoor facility in mid-November. Someone turned on the heater halfway through the night which did make it more comfortable, but I was surviving jut fine without it.  I'm a bad golfer, but in that rare form I did manage to get a hold of a few. The good news is, you can be as serious or as silly as you want--there are all kinds.  We ordered some grub, which is nice to have at the handy, and some folks were imbibing, as that's available from their bar and served up at your bay.

VqD0lsLGvkXA6tzu320NIA.text: This place is great for team events! You do need to enjoy golf or at least trying golf a little bit. The food is good and not terribly priced. The golf games available make it fun even if you're terrible (me).

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Double rainbow across the sky man!!

KhnOjF1jBdQIi5XEXHqKJg.text: Goof range and bad or average food nothing to be exited about.  If you like to play golf it will entertain you.  If you like competent tasty food it will Disappoint you.  New trend nothing remarkable.

Hl3syuvoMUIFigAYUMkgEA.text: Can never go wrong with top golf, they have a wide variety of food options. Golfing is fun and is for all ages!

n8hGcPQRcQAlaaynkOk3Pw.text: Whoever is in charge of cleaning the bathrooms (near the bar on the main floor).....needs an extensive raise.   There's not many establishments bathrooms you go into, and come out telling your friends, "that has got to be the best smelling bathroom I have ever smelled", and they come out after taking a leak saying, "you weren't lying about that bathroom"!!   It smelled like cotton candy. Props to the cleaners and management for making that a selling point for this Elite member!!

nEGEqZt2Fl8_UVrn-0vyog.text: I always enjoy coming to Top Golf, especially at night. The food and drink menu are great and the food actually tastes great. The chicken wings, fries and mini donuts are very good. Waiters are quick and friendly.

Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shuffle board

55FnOG-bBBvipsf_frQb0g.text: I love Top Golf! I've been a few times to this location. Even when they are really busy, everyone is super attentive and nice. I like the food here and playing the games are always a blast. I am not a regular golfer, but any skill level can play Top Golf. You also have the option to extend your play time or stop if your group wants either option.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Q2i8ia8TSy9VnzoaNiHxHg.text: Top Golf is a combination of skee ball and golf. You don't have to be a good golfer to participate and have fun. There are various challenges and games you can play in a group setting. I hit an average of 85 yards and my co-worker hit an average of 200 yards. However, I beat him at the game because I was hitting the targets, and he wasn't.   I've been here several times with my co-workers and we always have a good time. The food is pretty standard bar food but pretty good. If you want to save some money, don't reserve a bay in advance. It's actually cheaper to show up and get a bay that way.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Food menu
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MpAxtH5Tx02xox_EV0s4jQ.text: Came here for the first time on Saturday night (3/10/18) with 8 other folks and had a blast.  Here are my quick thoughts on a few things about Top Golf..................  - Be prepared to wait!  2.5 hour wait on a Saturday afternoon (4pm).  Finally got into our bay at about 6:45 or so.  They do text you before your bay is ready, so if you want to go somewhere else and come back, you can.  We just chilled upstairs and played Jenga and chilled the whole time.  The wait is fine if you are with a group, but would be a deal breaker (for me at least) if it was just you and another person on a date or something.  2.5 hours is a LONG TIME to wait for something.  - Incredible service!  Everyone from the bartenders to the front desk, to the managers on duty, to the person assigned to your bay.  Everyone was friendly, helpful and overall in a good mood!  - Food was decent.  We got some chips/salsa/guacamole and some pretzel bites and they were all tasty.  Reasonably priced, too.  I got a Pepsi and it came with free refills all night.  - The Golf.  That's the reason you came here, right?  The golfing part of it was fun.  You can play a slew of different "games" and the computer does the scoring for you.  Purchase a membership card for a one time fee of $5.00.  Otherwise, it doesn't keep score or track your progress.  -  Sensors on the balls seemed a bit "off".  We played a game of "Top Drive" and my one buddy was crushing the shit out of the ball into the intended targets, but it was not registering.  Meanwhile, I can't drive worth a damn, and was hitting maybe 140 yards, and was getting credit for scoring points.  Something was up.  Still fun, but not an accurate scoring system to tell us who actually won.  - If possible, get a bay on the 2nd or 3rd floor.  We got ours on the first floor all the way down at the end (Bay 102) which was a little whack.  All the scoring targets were at an angle, and since you were on the bottom floor, it was hard to judge and sometimes even see the actual target you were aiming at.  It would be much, much better up top looking down.  - Price.  $50.00 an hour on weekends after 5pm.  Seems a bit steep, but when you divide it by your party, it comes out very reasonable.  There were 5 of us that split the cost so for almost 2.5 hours, plus membership, it was only like $30.00 each.  I felt that was very reasonable for the amount of fun we had.  Go during the week and you can get it as low as $25.00 an hour.  Overall, I had a great time.  The wait to get a bay and the sensors (occasionally) were my only complaints.  Good times...so much so, I am coming back sometime this week with my other friends that are coming out for Spring Training.  Can't wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. That&#39;s right, bitches!  Came out on top during our first game of the night.
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My buddy about to hit a shot.  This was in Bay 102, bottom floor all the way to the left.  Weird angle, still fun though.

e1aXu5MWUX1dCOg3-lxfvQ.text: If you like to golf or even if you don't, this is a really fun place. The food is good enough and the drinks are fine. The draw is the golfing and I did have fun. I'm not a golfer so I wasn't very good, but the environment is relaxing enough to still have fun. I would come here again.
