so9nYu7xZifNI3Y7D0DjOg.text: Great atmosphere, amazing bars and golf and fun and games.  This is where I want to be when the world ends.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. One of my favorite places on earth.  Just leave me here to die.

iepay4S_-Lys9u1P-s3RLQ.text: Absolutely fantastic service from Lucky and Kimberly!  bachelorette party...perfect fun

FrFxG1VCabgWkCrt-lpu2Q.text: Went this morning right at opening to beat the heat and the crowd. Got in quickly and didn't have to wait for a bay.   We were a little annoyed because the employee at the bay reservation desk told us that it is currently an "iron only facility" so when you bring your own clubs you have to hit off the first deck and you can't bring your driver to the bay. Apparently people have been hitting balls over the net. They offered to check the clubs you weren't allowed to bring but we just ran them back to the car. They should have emailed members and posted signage but they did not.   Our bay was fine. Nothing out of the ordinary. Took a few minutes for our server to get there, but she finally brought us waters and we ordered a round of mimosas. Those also took a while to get there -- her reasoning was because they had just opened and so things weren't ready yet (not an excuse). Mimosas were more like a glass of OJ with a splash of champagne which sucked.   Overall golfing experience was fun. They provide rental clubs at each bay if you don't have any. Definitely come for the experience. It's a very cool place.

HMeDFWYLFpIG5JOJxPH2rQ.text: I've been to Topgolf about 3 times now. I love going it is so much fun. Just being able to go with your friends and play a game at a "driving range" is fun. I love finding an excuse to go.  Yes I am raving about this place and only give it 4 stars. It's cause service is slow. If you don't order drinks right away, don't expect to see your server or any drinks for 10 minutes. Considering that people are paying by the hour 10 minutes is 15% of your time (if you are there for an hour). I usually go in the middle of the day, so I don't think its too crowded eithere to where this can be warranted.   You don't really notice that when its your turn to hit, but if you are sitting there waiting for your turn, its nice to have a drink in hand.

nmSsNz9iDOYzMe_4b_b_0w.text: We had the best time for Father's Day!!!! It was a great time for golf, surprisingly cool, great food, and amazing service.  We played two games in two hours and Dad got 5 mins of extra play.  The game makes it easier to play with multiple levels of players.  Great for an event!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yum!!!! Great food too

hSwe_zdJIfwkTQ9Qygztfg.text: We typically come here several times a month for brunch in the bar area. Normally, everything is great; however, today's experience was the worst and is worth mentioning. We walked into the bar, which was not busy, and we're not greeted for ten minutes. We actually had to stand up and flag someone down for service. Danielle, our server, came over and took our order (both drink and food). Another 15 minutes goes by, and she brings water. Then we wait another ten for mimosa and Chip Shot. Food comes, I ask for more butter - doesn't arrive from Danielle until end of meal. We ordered a refill of both drinks and they don't arrive. She comes to check on food, I told her it would be better with drinks. She failed to even put them in!! Then, she clears our plates, we ask for the tab. Another ten minutes goes by and she does bring out check, she's reading a book behind the bar with the other bartender!  Again, we had to get up to get her attention. Horrible server and service. Jim, the manager, said he's going to get "actively involved."   I sincerely hope you do.

YIPLEvFBhApKcdyNzgeUJQ.text: This place is perfect for any occasion and for all ages! Whether you want a night out or you are celebrating an engagement Top Golf is the best place for it! The staff is always smiling and anticipating your every need! The entertainment is never dull and the food is on point, made from scratch, not your typical bar food!

plUUb9aE9ZDxatDi1E5Bkg.text: They served us all beer at the bar without checking our ID's. They then denied one of us from drinking at the golfing bay because he had a vertical California ID, even though he just had a beer and he's over 21. Hostile staff kept an eye on us for the rest of our visit.

wcm1cGmCICZbStycrSWlfQ.text: Awesome for the golf portion. The games are fun, and it's a great thing to do with friends who do golf, and those who don't too! However I've been here numerous times now and have had consistently HORRIBLE bar service. Literally we sat at a bar with a group of five for over 20 minutes without so much as an acknowledgement! I had to walk to the other side of the bar to ask for someone to come over, and we still waited over five more minutes for anyone to come over to us.   Weekends are busy so you might encounter a wait, which is fine. But the hosts don't communicate to you how much time that wait may be. They just simply say "ok, we will text you when it's ready". No confirmation that they have the correct phone number and no estimated wait time. Being in customer service for so long, I was very disappointed in this. Communication is key!!   Bay service is very hit or miss. Food is actually pretty good, I've tried a few things and have always enjoyed it. I've had Mike C. as a bay host twice now, and he has been the best!   Tournaments are extremely unorganized. It goes back to the communication thing though, apparently their system went down, but they didn't communicate that to anyone, so instead everyone just sat waiting for almost an hour. It ended up being almost 6 hours, which was far longer than anyone expected. They were busy, so maybe the staff just wasn't prepared, but the service was horrible in the bays we were assigned during the tournament. I actually sat in a bay for 45 minutes and not once did a server come to offer drinks or anything, so I ended up just opening a tab at the bar and walking to get my drinks for the rest of the time we were there.   Overall I think there is a lot of room for improvement. Especially since it is an established business with numerous locations, I think I had higher expectations for them! Hopefully they will work the kinks out, because it really is a fun place to go. It's nice to have something different as an option for entertainment.

Mc2-2HEe-c7bt4siUX7a1Q.text: Top Golf is super fun! Loved it! Great vibe and good drinks. There is tons of parking. Tons of games to play while you wait for your spot. The food was ok that is really the only thing that they could improve!  I can't wait to go back!

M9thAfMz6wgUr1pH7KmZgQ.text: My husband and I were in town and wanted to do something different. We don't have anything like this in Orange Count, CA so this was a fun date night for us. The prices were fair and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend this to anyone, we can't wait to go back!!

tfis6EWuPJRG-ak0ck5L4Q.text: This is my first visit to a top golf. I'm in town for a work event and my entire team went to this top golf tonight. We were given a putting space up on the third floor. First I want to say how beautiful the view is. The mountains in the background are amazing especially from the third floor. We were there in the evening and also ordered food. The food is OK nothing gourmet. The service was good though the waitress is very prompt and polite. The golf game itself was a lot of fun and the set up of the course is really cool. As the sun goes down the view gets even better between the sunset and the way the course gets lit up combined with the view of the very colorfully lit casino in the background. I'm giving top golf in Phoenix Arizona four out of five stars because the views are amazing the game is fun but the food is just OK if the food was awesome I probably would've given it five stars honestly. Can't wait to go to top golf back at home and take my husband now that I know what a fun experience it is. I think this is more fun with a group then just one or two people would be.

x2ardbkyfNc8VRKbJGq8kw.text: Scores would not record so it made it frustrating We brought family here for the first time and it was disappointment  Good service and good Prices were average

rDtVa9hX_MXRyiRm2Q9Tlw.text: It's fine but not if you are going to work on your game. This is purely a "have a few beers and laugh with your buddies place". Cool place to check out once but I wouldn't sign up for a long term membership.

hLK5kbrGa0fD6eBBjE5Fkw.text: Great for all ages (kids or adults).  Great for golfers or non-golfers.  A fun spot to go with a group of people on a night out.  I have been to Topgolf on numerous occasions and always have a fun time.  On the weekends there tends to be a wait, but it is well worth the wait.  They have a really fun menu to that is served while you play.

g9DqXV9TU1RVYOiGNqi56g.text: The only downfall about Topgolf, is that there isn't more of them. What a great way to bring golfers and non-golfers together! Everything is interactive; it makes the game of golf a challenge for the advanced and fun entertainment for the novice. Make reservations if you can, it gets packed here and the wait can be all night if you're unlucky.

1wlylKT9y5V5pQ0UafTwag.text: Our server Alicia was fantastic and friendly.   We came to celebrate a birthday for a friend and had excellent food.   The fried chicken sandwich is delicious!! At ye end of the night our machine froze up and Michelle came to help us and was so helpful.  We will be back!

TdmWvIK55L1Knwd78a899g.text: TopGolf is a great place for a social gathering with your friends, family, or coworkers.   The concept of TopGolf is pretty cool and definitely fun for all level golfers. You get points for the different shots that you make and you compete against the people with you. I don't even go to the driving range too often and it was still very entertaining.   There are 3 floors that you can play on. We were on the first floor and while you play, there is music and tv's that keep you entertained while you are waiting for your turn.  I went with some guys from my office and we played for 2 hours. We all had a great time and competed against each other for bragging rights. It's a great place to relax, hit some golf balls, drink some beer, and eat some good food.  We ordered the chips and guacamole, the flatbread pizza, the buffalo chicken rolls, and the chicken quesadillas. Overall the food was very good. Not to mention they have a good beer selection on tap and bottles.  They also have pool tables and shuffle board inside if you want to hang out and drink after your game is over.   Unfortunately I am only visiting Scottsdale, so I won't be able to return for a bit, but if I'm back in town, I will definitely come back.  If you're looking for a place to hang out and have fun with friends or have a birthday party/ celebratory get together, TopGolf is a great place for that.

4GeIQ3m6Q54sYnhMpDsdkw.text: Great place! We went with a group of 10 and played at 2 bays next to each other.  Prices were decent and service was excellent! Would definitely recommend this place for any occasion. We will be going back!

QNeMP-ZpX7KtF9JBwsB9sA.text: Topgolf is easily the perfect place to have a great time with friends or family, for celebrations or just a day out! We visited yesterday to celebrate our dear friends birthday. We were greeted with smiling faces and welcoming staff. Our server (really wish we remembered her name) was lovely, consistently refilling drinks and having fun making conversation. We ordered the cheese dip, wings, and flat breads. ALL THREE ARE A MUST. If you are looking for a great deal on beer, their buckets are a amazing! Personally, I had the Topgolf Tea and the Tipsy Palmer. So refreshing on a hot day. The actual concept of Topgolf is so fun, you don't have to be good at golf to have an awesome time. We finished our night with a hospitality guest service manager, Michelle! She was professional and friendly, and we will definitely be back to see her. Great energy and just so excited about her job and the company she works for! Overall, can't get much better than Topgolf!

fX7Ff90iTkj_jLljdqrUfg.text: Love the design and concept. The workers always seem a tad bit unorganized though.

CFqVIwTJZN92kFQ1jreRow.text: Freaky golfing from the third story without falling off. Definitely try it at night with the lighted holes. Private parties are fun and the food is so good you would swear they didn't actually cook it there, but they do.

njKz9VrYY3SJ9OVSBk1XyA.text: I took friends here that were visiting from out of state who love  to golf on Oct 10th 2014. We went to rent out two golfing stations and there was some type of glitch in the computer system. We had a rock star in training who was waiting on us and was having some issue with the computer. We were patiently waiting for at least 20 minutes to have the issue solved. I am not sure what happened however the manager Cory came over fixed the problem and comped both stations for free for the inconvenience. Now that's what I call great customer service. Thanks Top Golf, I will definitely be back.

NhW75IsicZiZREygTRSTvQ.text: One of my favorite activities in the Phoenix area. A good place to hang out with friends and eat as well. The food here is actually better than I was expecting too. A good time for beginners as well as advanced golfers.

tU-X8TudUJykr2GV60SFjQ.text: We held an event on 12/18/14 and had Chelsey, Bambi and Ashley h. As our servers. These girls gave us the best service ever!!!!! They exceeded our expectations we will definitely be returning for future events!

Un8Q9Npog-yodE3YKC_9IQ.text: We took our out of town guests to Top Golf and had a blast. We enjoyed the target golfing experience almost as much as our company. Thanks Top Golf- awesome facility.

v3WKlFgWIDaP-zF4KwwyRQ.text: I've been to this location multiple times. Yesterday we planned celebrating 2 birthdays at TopGolf.  We checked in and let the guy know we had 10 people with 8 people playing golf. After an hour wait, we finally got our spot on the 3rd floor which only had 6 chairs???? Hello top golf I told you I had 10 people. They were kind of accommodating and let us have the seats next to us. The food is great but the SERVICE SUCKS. We ordered drinks and appetizers which took over 30 plus minutes to receive. Very frustrating. I would recommend ONLY coming with 4 or less people. They are not very GOOD at LARGE parties. I had to argue the whole time when I was trying to enjoy my birthday party with my brother. Wouldn't go back unless we had a small group.

DI2m4lelX5MwaLQ_u9FIjg.text: We went to topgolf 9/20/12 for a birthday. There were 12 of us...  To start when we got to Topgolf we were told to stand in one line. We waited in that line for aprox. 20 mins before getting to the counter. At the counter they were having difficulties with the computer and it took another 20-30 mins to check all of us in. During the check in process I asked a friend of mine to go check on bays for us at the concierge desk.  She was told at the concierge that we could not check in without having everyone's players cards present. (Prior to going to the venue I had purchased to 2 VIP passes so that we could prevent the waits and be moved to the front of the line for bays.) Once we had everyone's players card the concierge then let us check in for bays. They told us that if we wanted the 2nd or 3rd floor that it would still be about an hour or two wait for us even with the VIP passes. So we opted to take the first available. They put us on the first floor in bay 102 and 103. Someone from Topgolf brought us to our bays and showed us how to use the computers. That was extremely helpful... but then we noticed that there were only 5 and 6 clubs in each of the bays. I went up to the front desk and asked that they brought us more clubs and was told someone would be down there right away. That NEVER happened. I went back up to the front desk and requested clubs again and still no one came. The golf itself was fun, but we would not return to this venue. If we want to hit balls, we will go to a regular driving range and save on the headache of the crowd, the lack of organization and be able to use multiple clubs.

zl0sOzg4pLJjlK0-1QtCRw.text: Really a great place!  Awesome scenery!  Great idea and game.  Bar and food was good but way too expensive.

-dmGXDiYZ-U81hNjJX-TSQ.text: This is my third time at topgolf . During the cooler evenings in az they have heat lamps at every golf bay . Evenings are very busy so have patience . We have tried the food and it's been very good . Crowd is both after work groups and family's . They seem to control the idiot factor ( over serving , club throwing ) as much as possible . We will be back . Weekday mornings and afternoons are the perfect time for a less hectic visit .

ha-oYBQ0KQGMbQNAgR4KEQ.text: I love this place but have been here 4/5 times and have had horrible service every time!  I sat at my bay for 20 min with no acknowledgment and previous times waited over 10 minutes to get drinks I ordered!  I hope management sees this!

N38mRJXDNA0WYeVfnro5kg.text: This is a great location for business meetings or a family / date night out. Great staff, solid service and food.

G0OKXuwxuHm37E-3tEIJ3Q.text: Super crowded!!!! The concept of top golf is really cool. It kinda reminds me of bowling but has way way more people there. There's people everywhere waiting to play this driving range game. I went for the first time on a Saturday evening. I don't suggest that time especially if it's your first time and your excited to check it out.

rQicr6krScgv0MsyAlDAgQ.text: Had a new trainee Austin help us. He did a great job. Was very polite and informative. Very professional young man. We have been here several times this place will continue to be top of the line entertainment.

ar1LVFais8QzSfNCXGGDrQ.text: I went to TopGolf yesterday for my boyfriend's birthday. We got there around 5:30. We had to get in line to get our one time membership card. After that we had to go to the concierge desk to set up our time to play. The wait was around an hour and 15 minutes. Parking was full but we lucked out and got one fairly close to the facility. The concept is really cool. The main thing that stood out to me is all the other activities people can do to entertain themselves while waiting. That made the wait time bearable. The actual game was so much fun!! $45/hour isn't too bad when you're splitting it with a group of friendz. I can't wait for the Gilbert location to open since it's right down the street from me!!

xE_-kg53IiwcQB0jSoC9ag.text: First time visiting TopGolf and probably the last!   Granted we did go during a busy Friday evening but can we say TERRIBLE service in the bar!  It's first come first serve so we quickly sat down at a table when people left. Took 5 minutes before someone actually greeted us only to get her money that was left at the table and then leave. She came back 5 minutes later to ask us what we wanted to drink and when I asked if someone could wipe off the table she tells us that if we sit at a dirty table they assume that it's our mess... WTH?!?   Gave two stars for the food which was good... But took forever! Had the nachos and chicken and waffles sliders.   For as many servers there are tables don't understand why they are so slow and so unfriendly.

61M76-ZCjwqVFG6ntGS_qg.text: This review is mostly about the food, but the service and overall ambience are also contributing factors to the perfect score. Our group of 3 ordered the spinach and goat cheese salad, along with the Thanksgiving Burger, the Veggie Sandwich, and the Crab Cake Sandwich. Everything was absolutely awesome. One of the better crab cakes I've ever had--what a pleasant surprise!   Great music selection, and even for me--a non-golfer--I was entertained. Misters and fans abound so you're sure to stay cool even in the heat of summer. Service was friendly, fast, and attentive. I found Top Golf to be an upscale-bowling-alley-meets-driving-range and I absolutely loved it. Original, fun, engaging, trendy.  I'll definitely be back.

su_eI_-LCOfuOm5boRyg7w.text: In town for spring training and my sister and brother in law wanted to bring me here!  I've golfed once and have hit balls a few times.  It was awesome Because you're not worried about running out of balls.  Trey and Riley came around and gave us all a round for our money. All sports games were playing on TV while we waiting for our tee off... Food was good, service was good, level of fun was great!  Good beers on tap! Would definitely recommend to anyone in town looking for fun!

DolGrbUsCkMxDVR8-NOnkw.text: The golfing experience Is really cool & fun. I think offering food and drink services is awesome, however I am totally unimpressed by the food & service. I ordered a pepperoni flat bread pizza. It was chewy & gross like microwaveable pizza. Our waitress was super slow we got 1 refill the whole time & we were drinking like crazy (as its hot outside). Too bad /: (currently waiting for my French fries I ordered 20 min ago)

bVHRPBtxHnngpBEPLADibg.text: This place is a blast! Great for parties, you don't even have to be very good at golf to have fun. It's clean, has great staff, and is easy to start and get going.  Price is decent, and it's Very accommodating for good golfers and beginners alike. Highly recommended.

4O1V9WRg_B2uWaaLRxBjSQ.text: What a fun place! We had our company Christmas party at top golf and it was a blast. We were me outside at the door and directed where to go which was a bonus. We had at least 3 servers who were lightning fast bringing our food and drink orders. There was inside and outside seating for our party and heaters outside if anyone got cold. Perfect place for a party or if you are looking for a place to take a group. All in all, great time.

J_hC9qkaSHnrjINgsCdUxQ.text: So cool. Cool place to hang out. Not too fancy. You can wear casual clothes. Servers bring food and drinks right to your table while you're "golfing." It's really easy. I've never played golf before and even I had a good time playing. Food is even good for what you would think is more of a bar. Relaxed, chill environment. Love it!

rnO4eWBHSFQDp5R1Uo-l-Q.text: Had an amazing experience at Top Golf. Our server Dan Shafer was the man, helped us set everything up, was spot on with the drinks and didn't rush us at all. Highly recommend for work functions.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

6CRLSqN4LpC3TIvlFrf-ww.text: A little overpriced & Slow food service, but the staff is nice and it is a fun place to go on a weekend with friends.

I20IDYeV6Sj5yceWQNXAZQ.text: first time here this place is amazing and full of fun also our server dakota provided us outstanding service definitely will be back

CuVS9GIMStaz2GGedpsdAg.text: We went here for my husband's 50th birthday party on a Saturday afternoon. We picked this place because my husband loves golf, and my SIL had gone to a Top Golf for a corporate event, and had had a great time. We paid $151 for 3 hours and 7 membership cards), plus another $95 for food/drinks.  We were a party of 7 initially, growing to 10 by the time stragglers arrived. We had an issue in signing up where the printer died, and I had to wait while they got me all the membership cards, etc. What I didn't realize was that even though I had waited in line and paid, I was not yet on the waiting list for a bay. Getting on the wait list happens in a second line at the Concierge Desk. I was pretty upset when I found out that multiple groups who had come in after me who had not gotten stuck with a nonworking printer had now gone over and signed up for bays ahead of me. (I was frustrated that the front desk agent didn't suggest I go over and sign up and then come back to get the remainder of the cards.)   It was my husband's party and I wanted it to be perfect, so I over-reacted just the slightest bit. I asked for a manger. Kudos to them, they handled my over-reaction very professionally and diplomatically. I felt embarrassed afterwards (sorry, guys!), but my husband had a wonderful time, didn't think about all the many pressures in his life once during the entire visit, and I am very grateful for how they handled the situation.   We had a bay for 3 hours ($35/hour). And I will say the 3 hours flew by! Six people can play at one bay at a time, but you can remove/add players at any time. In my opinion, a single bay can really only accommodate 7-8 people with any comfort (max 4 on the couch, 3 at the high top table behind the couch, and 1 player). So if you have more, you probably want two bays. We were lucky enough not to have anybody else in the bay next to us, and, of course, we spilled over to their area.  They have different games you can play by hitting the ball into targets in the range. We weren't serious gamers/golfers (well, except for my husband and his father!) and just had fun hitting the ball. From a total experience perspective, the evening is probably the better time to go because the targets are lit up. But I think the the daytime is a little more low key (less crowded, less wait time). As many have said before, they don't allow drivers or hybrids currently because some players have put balls in the neighboring parking lot. Hopefully they will fix this soon, but you can still have fun without those clubs. They do allow you to bring/use your own irons.  Our event administrator was excellent (Christine). We brought in a birthday cake, which I was afraid would be an issue (bringing in outside food), but nothing was said (thank you!). And we certainly ordered enough drinks and food to make a good tab.   They have some kinks to work out yet in their processes (like being sensitive to people not wanting to wait longer than they absolutely have to!). But I would recommend this place for a fun party for anybody whether they play golf or not. Maybe a little more fun for the golfer, but nongolfers can certainly enjoy cheering and heckling (did I just reveal something about my family?). My husband and I talked about how much fun this place would be with some of the golfers we play with, so I think we'll be back (either here or one of the other sites they are in process of opening).  The one thing that was a little frustrating was understanding the scoring system. Sometimes a shot that hit the target didn't register at all, sometimes the same shot would have different scores. (This was mainly a problem for the competitive and analytical among us!) Personally, I think this problem is solved with just a little more alcohol!

m-jEslgn8ZiiwdWxqXNE7A.text: While we have had great service before tonight was different. Was not packed at the bar but took 30 minutes to get a server after asking multiple times. Bartender had some smart ass comments about my party getting our credit card back.

h-eFhw_p9sMvbQz5h6OAwg.text: I have been here quite a while. Had the best experience all these time untill the last two.. i have always came here during  the day which i may say it was awesome  the staff kept up with everything(food, drinks, refill) always checking  in on us. Each time  we always  hit the  bar after words. Till i went during  the evening place was pack and had a group  of 9. -.- lets start  by saying the server  didn't  show up to often. We all order food at once  so we wouldn't confuse  him. He had a smile  on his face but knew something  was wrong. Only 3 plates  showed  up when good came and when wr ask him where the rest was he replied  by saying he forgot. An average  drink took about 15 min.  And we had to hunt our server down for our  tab. At the end we still think its a awesome  place but will not go at night, it sucks.!

xfB43bDmcBjMBOPXwjR0pg.text: Amazing atmosphere, food and games! Such a fun date night or a night out with friends! All staff are very helpful and knowledgeable. There are several games to chose from which keeps it fun! Cant wait to come back!!

xxMjSewJULWk8N-ziOmeuw.text: Great place to go and have fun.  Long wait to get in, but the wait is because it's very popular.  Food is good, but not great.  However, it's definitely a great place to go have fun.

WNVh4q_vUFCH50xhgqEXdw.text: Some friends and I went to try to get a bay the other night and the guy that helped us to get our card was completely rude! I love top golf but the cashier just made me want to not want to come back again, I get it you're busy and maybe tired but he didn't answer our questions and just made the whole experience for me and my friends unpleasant, hopefully the next time we go back the experience is better

DthcGpN37RUzmOH6Og9EGw.text: Fun concept but very expensive, if you just want to hit a bucket of balls is your thing go elsewhere. The place is run a lot like a bowling alley which it essentially is.  Fancy Scottsdale drinks, some decent beer options but too many Budweiser (Four Peaks) products.  Food is mostly appetizer driven and burgers and sandwiches.  Nice but like everything else a little on the pricey side.  The system is hard to understand and there aren't clear instructions when you arrive,

L29peRkQ5ghy0RZSam1Sfw.text: This place is awesome. Everyone was super friendly and the games are way fun. A tip: go early in the day and with a group of friends. It's not nearly as busy and when you split it up it's very affordable. Still no drivers allowed but that's okay. The range is only about 215 yards long so hitting the targets doesn't need a lot of power. I can't wait to go back!

RtBQtCCCpLw0UewYIY561g.text: Well horrible first visit. ...xoxo don't get a waiter to save our life. Finally grab someone to some, nothing then grab someone else just to be told it's not my table.  Then order drinks, they a are the wrong ones and then takes another 20 minutes to get the right ones. Talked to manager and all taken care of.

U1en7b3otdgovXLi5baYFw.text: The concierge, bartending and wait staff were all wonderful. Special thanks to Austin who was exceptionally helpful and a pleasure to talk to. We can't wait for Topgolf to open back home in Vegas next year!

rMKWgqr6SSrDiJHWy3kStw.text: TopGolf is the place to be for a great time in AZ. Megan and Trey are the best. Really took care of our group in town from Florida. Highly recommend to anyone who is in town.

kUqXjgrUPYz7QA5xt_JFsw.text: Great place for the family or group of friends! We went Sunday afternoon and they were so accommodating! They put us in bays next to our friends who had arrived earlier. Kids (age 5-17) had a blast golfing as did the adults! Service was great as was the food. Better food than expected! I highly recommend this place for an afternoon with the family! Everyone was smiling the entire time:) we will definitely be back!

y_BC-ylIy52mx6wwrMFRhw.text: This place is great!  It would get that last star if they did not limit us to irons...  Someone made a big boo boo when they opened this place and did not design the range to support long woods or hybrids... Other than that the place is a lot of fun.

J68r_A6z99meSKgEGd_s4w.text: I will never go to this place ever again. I booked a party for 20 people. The week prior to the event several people became sick with the flu. I called the day prior to adjust the reservation. I was told they had already prepped the food so I said I would be willing to pay for the food since it was already prepped. However, why should I pay for golf for people who will not be there. They refused to reduce the price of the event. We were willing to consolidate to fewer bays so they could rent them out to any of the hundreds of people waiting in the lobby to play. They said I needed to give them 7 days notice. How are you supposed to plan for the flu??? I booked the event from 4-6 PM. However, they took the food away at 5:30. So apparently it's ok for them to not stick to the contract but they force it on you even though there was a serious flu outbreak in Phoenix.

59r1rrUoUGf7YOU1bU3YVA.text: Junior golfers look elsewhere.    The front desk and "Concierge" (and I put those in BIG quotes) and check in staff is like a bunch of teenagers at the mall.  They are just there to take up space and annoying you.   Inconsistencies were everywhere. We are told that no one can bring drivers. OK.  I'm fine with that.  But I see about 5 bays with hackers swinging their drivers.  I inquire about the obvious inconsistency with 2 different staff members and their response was "oh I'm sure the manager will tell them to stop.  There's nothing we can really do about that."    But they insist I walk my clubs back to the car and stow my hybrids.  REALLY?  My son who is 4 wanted to use his driver so he hit a whopping 30 yards.  Nope she said everyone is held to the same standards.  OK robot...but did you just tell me there's NOTHING you can do about those guys using their drivers???    Dont' claim to be junior friendly when it's the complete opposite.  Golf is a dying sport as it is...let's find a new way to make it even less appealing for them.  The definitely should revisit their junior policy to something that makes common sense.  Anyone under 10 can use their driver doesn't seem that out of the world to me.  And adhere to the rule you "impose".   I saw at least 3 other kids with their drivers and no one telling them to put it away.  When we finally got to our bay, the "concierge" guys said "I woulda let your little guy use his driver...the rule is totally stupid."  And so I'm thinking...oh so the rule is dependent on who sees you walk into the door.  Take my advice...sneak in your drivers all you want.  I should have.    The waitress service was nice and prompt.  Food was better than expected.  Facility in top condition.  Too bad junior robots run the front.

4XuFIXhMFu-DaB-vdpunug.text: After receiving an immediate response from Top Golf management, Trisha, I decided to give my experience one more try. Trisha offered my friends and I an opportunity to try top golf once more. We were able to go back to top golf on a Saturday night and another manager, Scott, made sure we were taken care of. We did not experience any additional technical issues while we were playing and the service was great. I am so glad I gave them another try, and I will be back for sure! Thank you Scott and Trisha.

UMXFq6i5UqN5km5hQOfr-g.text: Perfect place to stop for lunch on a work day. Great food. Watching people golfing makes me not want to go back to work!

Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Burger and sweet potato fries

Chaq_7c9y2ipEZ6hA4UVIw.text: So I told my boyfriend about this amazing heaven on earth place in Chicago called Topgolf.  Sadly, the closest one to Los Angeles is in Scottsdale, AZ. Of course, after telling him about it, the only right thing to do was drive there.  And it was awesome!  Due to the drive, we arrived kinda late, close to 8 pm.  I would suggest getting there early because it's THE happening spot. Even though there were a lot of people, the process was smooth.  There was valet, but my friend just dropped us off and she looked for parking. My bf and I checked in and were told it was a 2.5 hour wait.  It was ok because we just headed to the bar and I had the tater tots.   I am quite obsessed with the tater tots.  You have to have the tater tots.  Anyway, although it was busy, the flow was fine.  We just went to the bar and had food and bevs. Also, the staff was ridiculously nice and accessible.  If you had a question, there was always someone around, whether the bar, the floor or the bay. Once we got a bay, they helped us get situated and bring out stuff to the bay.  Note: Topgolf on a Saturday night is more akin to a happening bar than a driving range-- people were in casual going out/bar-hopping clothes, compared to golf gear in Chicago.  Also, I think my friend who lives out there and I were the only ones who brought our own clubs.  No biggy.  I was there for the tots, beverages, and golf-- in that order.  It's Topgolf on a Saturday night.  It's more of a party.  Just letting you know this so that if you are a serious golfer and really want to practice your drive, you know what's up.  You can still practice, but don't get Type A-anal-retentive about the crowd.  Super fun place from novice to advanced golfers or people on dates or trying to get a date.

CVMto0ITdb7HB7hsd1ALUg.text: Good time.   Better to go as a group with a bunch of people to keep cost down  Made fence higher so you can use your driver

ygjdhYypREUwr7GrmeThMQ.text: Worst place I have ever been to. Security was non stop lurking and it felt like we had no privacy. Also we told them that this was our first time playing golf and they just left. We had to figure out how to do/work everything by ourself not only that but one of the waiters were scoping out how long we were going to be staying.

lxcNzAawnnP0sTddqpbbfQ.text: "Please sir, can I have some more?" Food portions make me feel like an orphan. Great entertainment though. Whether you're trying way too hard & practicing for the next PGA tournament or you're not very good & enjoying more beer than you should like myself or play even as bad as the more recent tiger woods, you'll have a grand ol' time. I'll cherish my players card as I travel to Colorado & Texas to continuously suck at the game of golf.

1TK9Cfb1futDJBpajLA0iw.text: On a sunny hot day like it was on Saturday  it was refreshing to have two wonderful Top Golf associates take care of us. Michelle and Desiree were extremely hospitable and attentive. They had great patience with a big group of sweaty drunk fellas. It's not easy and they did it with smiles. We will definitely request them next time we come back.

taml0a5cfNbiSAtgf7g0PA.text: This place is like mini-golfing on steroids! The great thing about top golf is that you don't even have to be a great golfer to enjoy this type of golfing! It's like playing darts with a golf club. Each time I've been here (whether it's 1pm or 6pm) it's been relatively packed, wait time can range from 5minutes to an hour and a half. The good thing is that there's a bar to kill time while you wait for your bay to open (they'll send you a text alert once your bays available). The food here is decent at best-stick with their sliders if you know what's best for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet view of the mountains!

uiF8kAOKUmglzDAb9FnSdA.text: Top Golf was a blast. They have more then enough people on staff to make sure that questions are answered and that you have service at your tee area for drinks. Everything is reasonably priced.   We went in the evening when the lights were on which was fun. Shot off the second story.   Things to consider: - Didn't know you have to have a lifetime membership first before reserving a tee. It's just $5, and I recommend doing it online before you get there.  - With 6 people, one game lasted us about an hour. So figure out a good pace for playing.

n3ztsjfLK8j7lBzp-98fCw.text: Great service! If only I knew how to play golf properly, I would look less of an idiot....Nice venue! Great staff! Reasonable food and beverage prices....

CaBX-vD1UJsmuM-zOMZ-cw.text: We've been too top golf once before, got into our bay within 10 minutes and had a decent time. But our second visit was terrible, we arrived and were told it would be a 15 minute wait to get on the top floor. 30 minutes later we are still waiting for the text to say our bay is ready, so went to ask the front desk lady if it would be ready soon and she said 5 more minutes as they were cleaning up our bay. Another 30 minutes later we are still waiting! Had to talk to a supervisor and he didn't look into why we were waiting so long and didn't even offer an apology. Ended up waiting a total of an hour and 45 minutes and just decided to leave. There were countless bays open the whole time. We will not be back

7tgjSoh4mYQrbDwHBGASiA.text: Top golf is great.  Michelle (managerfrom Boston) is awesome.  She made EVERYONE in the group feel welcome.  Misa was the waitress and she was great.  I will be coming back soon PAM

E5_gyBwVmZu5CYSHLdBScQ.text: Was really disappointed with the service here. The activity itself is fun and has a great vibe but the servers were just awful. Came here on a double date last Saturday and not only were our orders incorrect but the server never checked back on us afterwards. My friend had to eventually wave down the server after waiting 20 minutes since she was just talking the whole time to another coworker on the other side of the bar. Would suggest coming for the golf games but get dinner beforehand at another place nearby.

cTzfafNA4xU3ulE68RGStw.text: Great place! We went for a few drinks and some golf - really cool. Now, it takes some time to get your membership card but, once you get set up and playing, it's a great time. Family friendly too. We didn't eat but the drinks were priced right for the area. My wife had never even swung a club before and she had a blast!

dbGy1JlEKLzI04ruuygDqA.text: I moved here a few months ago, Friends flew in with a group of relatives from 14 to mid 90s we decided on top golf as a place to spend the evening. It was the right choice for conversations and something fun to do, the service was very good. The icing on the cake was when we left college students were coming in by the busloads for a Halloween party I would say top golf is doing pretty well and we sure had a good time!

8Va-kWwCsfGo29OrEXG6Gw.text: This place really fun, but the staff is a hit or miss.  I have been here a few times and can make a fair review that there needs to be more staff and more training for the weekends.  The precious time I came we waited approx. 15 minutes for an attendant to help with the system. We also met our waiter and were served some time later but the orders were incomplete.  This was about three months ago and not much has changed.  We arrived on a Friday and were okay with waiting for a "lane" for about an hour. We enjoyed drinks and the ambiance and decided to order. When our lane was ready we asked the waiter when our food would be available and if we could transfer to the Bay Area downstairs. He kindly went to check.  No food order.  Instead of apologizing he said we must have orders from someone else. I explained that was False because I asked about a specific dish and he said it was spicy. He asked if that was okay. Instead of admitting his error he simply said, "there is no food for you." Instead of offering a suggestion to fix the error we were left trying to figure it out.   Going to the Bay was a bit better... Once we found the waiter. She was great and apologized for the error. But we still waited for dinner for another hour.  Poor waitress left to clean it up.   I love the ambiance of this place, but please don't come here hungry. I am sorely disappointed in the service, especially when I was expecting and okay with spending some money on food and drinks.

5JJL0V9ulJQY8zdDpercaQ.text: The food is not very good and their drinks are terrible. The cocktails there are awful  and the beer tastes like its above room temperature  . However the concept is awesome and I like the ambience

K9Pp3BB4NLHNbCZ3oe1X8g.text: My only real problem with this establishment thus far is they over serve ppl. I have seen several men and ladies stumble out, one ending up with a broken nose!! Inexperienced bartenders not only need retraining on proper pours but a refresher course in basic cocktails.   I love that they have Valet as it is too hot to spend forever searching for a parking space, with membership it is complimentary, just dont forget to tip! This one guy, John, he runs so fast to get my car I cant help but enjoy the view!!   Tasty food, a bit on the slow side but those kinks will work themself out in no time.

Z8ErvzIHdTivpjMQ3xCfDA.text: i just moved out here from boston 3 months ago. Michelle made me feel like I was back at home with her hospitality and wicked sweet accent. great food great atmosphere, can't wait to come back soon!!!! Brittany our server was awesome too!

c57zI6tA3xnSuqV9MDY1bw.text: Just to be clear, this is a review of the administration at this place.  I'm sure the food, drinks, atmosphere, and golf are fantastic and fun.  Because of this, I figured that planning a small business meeting here would be a good idea.  However, I didn't know that dealing with TopGolf is filled with more red tape and needless rules than the IRS combined with the DMV.  I just spent 2 weeks trying to arrange a small meeting where I would give TopGolf over $700.  Below is what I wanted on Saturday, November 14th.  All hourly rates are on their website or were listed on the event planning PDFs they sent me.   * Conference room from 9am to 3pm @ $40/hr ($240 total) * Hitting Bay from 3pm to 5pm and 5pm to 8pm @ $35 and $45/hr, respectively ($205 total) * Food/beverage minimum of $300 that could be applied both in the conference room and hitting bay (for some reason, a food/beverage minimum is required to get the conference room)  They turned my offer down and said they were already making too many concessions in their previous proposal.  Bummer.  Anyway, everybody I talked to was very friendly and eager to help in the typical corporate fashion.  You know....pretending to give a darn, but really just wanting to move on to a person/company with deeper pockets.

G4o4reoAMyjFMFx2IAk8fg.text: My first time and so much fun!!! I like the variety of clubs they offer so you're not just hitting driver.

79zjLDn-AjfN6A15tRbhVA.text: From the minute I walked in the service and clarity of communication was awful. We were told to go downstairs to order drinks and food as the wait would be just under two hours.  We get to the lower level and no one to be found to place an order for food and drinks while 20-30 staff of top golf have walked right past our group. I finally asked someone where we should place our food and drink order and was told there is a private you shouldn't be down here after I was just told to go downstairs Then a waitress shows up and says for sure we can take your order we have two hours before the private party. Place our order then another person manager with attitude comes over and says we can't be down here. Ok grab us a table upstairs help the customer out and she says no you just need to go find a table on the main level or the terrace level 3. Nice!! Wow, get it straight folks, no problem with the private party but get your team on the same page and stop jerking the customer around.

UYM_CpOyDnKOFJ9QBtjUOg.text: We are no strangers to Topgolf. We regularly bring our friends, from near and far, here for a good time. The great thing is you don't have to be good at golf to have a good time! (The full bar helps too). A big shout-out to the team leader, Michelle Padula, for always being SO helpful and fun to be around! I always ask if she's in because I know we're in good hands when shes around.

9HpwpRG7Q0ajpgzDHR2Frg.text: In one word: Fantastic.   This is a destination golf facility that doesn't disappoint. I was recently in Scottsdale with my girlfriend who was initially nervous about the golfing experience. When we arrived, we checked in, went to get a beer and were immediately moved into our bay. I can't say enough about the atmosphere - service is great, people are laid back and everyone is having a good time. There are plenty of ways to score points, and plenty of games for people to play, so everyone ends up having a great time!  On top of that, the food is amazing. We had both the Mango Habanero wings and Buffalo Chix flatbread - both were excellent. Tables around us were also happy with their food.  Note: GET THERE EARLY. Friday/Saturday nights, the wait can be as long as three hours. We went Sunday afternoon, and there was no wait.

alNWI0ztomjObjGIXlFtmg.text: Really fun place.    Regarding the golf you pay by the hour and, honestly, an hour is enough.  I'm a golfer and I'd had enough after about 45 minutes.  The games are pretty fun (I'd recommend Top Shot for a group) and the waitstaff was very good.  It's a little confusing the first time you go but after a bit you'll get the hang of it.   We ate dinner in the restaurant downstairs and the food actually surprised me in it's quality. Very tasty, fast, and reasonably priced.    It's not something I'd even attempt to go to on a weekend night as I can imagine it's a cluster@%@# but during the week, it's a nice spot for group outing.

PP8oY8dQXLiOEXF3h7Q5UQ.text: Loved the facility and views are amazing while hitting high tech golf! The food menu was good and the quality was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great family place
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great play time

R7_PYGOgKcU8T38kwT1RGg.text: Let's just say we are having an AMAZING I me thanks to our host Summer she rocks!!! She's so much fun! Great customer service, she's interacting with the group! Awesome!!!!definitely coming back !

vZsPUrcpB-uPmc0z-yRB-A.text: I was at the main bar tonight and waited 30 minutes to even be acknowledged, then took 5 bartenders to scan my id and charge my card. After that, i waited another 25-30 minutes to order food. If it weren't for the barnacle, Tyler, I would have left and probably wouldn't come back. I noticed many people have to wait anywhere between 10-30 minutes to even be noticed. This is unacceptable and unprofessional. Thank goodness for Tyler!

sfXT8cVt7fZAptmxo20f5Q.text: Finally made it. Food & drink ok but great concept & entertainment venue. Recommended

E9bL5DM7jUpg9oLtwqBQDA.text: Love Michelle (the team lead)! Every time we come in she is always in a great mood! Always love coming in when she's here

mkOoaOFRx0pznpPleKXyXA.text: OMG I need this place in Tampa!!!  I was visiting Scottsdale and went there on a Friday night. This might be one of the coolest places I have ever been to! What a creative idea and I bet they make millions.   This is definitely not your average driving range. It is two stories and is a bar. Each section is like a VIP area with couches, table and your own section to golf.   I've never been to a place like this, only seen it on tv and I am highly impressed!   First, the service was great and attentive. We received everything fast without any issues. I was drinking and not eating but my group ordered various things from burger to salad and everyone was satisfied.   The range overlooks a beautiful view of the Talking Stick casino. The computer calculates how well you do so you can play for fun or actually compete. You have to pay to play. I believe $30 or more. I wasn't playing much but I hit a few times and not bad for a newby.  Overall this is a great fun spot that also has music and it's a great place to hang out with your friends! I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

7zYEbQJ7EdYRq538J1938g.text: While the games are a lot of fun, the service here is consistently horrible. Good luck ordering drinks and food, or even getting anyone to acknowledge your existence for that matter! This place is a joke!

hnjlz4dkH5IoEy_apWMKnA.text: If you like hanging out at a bar this is better! The golf is a blast and the prices are reasonable. The food is very good but the service is a bit slow so the food is a bit cold. Still a great time to spend with friends and family!

VdUwe-TZNl6d4xlq9ymCwA.text: The experience of golfing off the edge was fantastic and fun but my disappointment comes mainly from the staff. Our waitress never returned so we ended up going to the bar to order a drink. Then the continued immaturity from the staff was ridiculous. Staff were chasing each other around the bathrooms/restaurant area flirting constantly. Then towards the end when we were leaving, they were goofing around behind the bar that ended up in a glass being broken. Did they handle that professionally? Nope. They started creating more of a scene than was necessary at all. One of the younger guys was d*cking around with the bartender very loudly saying, "what the f*ck did you do that for, it's all your fault!" In a joking and completely unprofessional way. All customers were looking at them by this time and instead of apologize for the interruption they continued to goof around and curse behind the bar. For the $50 an hour that they charge to golf, I'm shocked that there was no management or maturity among the staff. Extremely disappointing.

1mCH5jFes9Om4AJfulv6Ug.text: Great team building event. Good food and very nice local beer selection. Being from the Midwest, any outdoor activity in January with warm weather is a big plus!

_B9DrWU1sbOoLOfyX87ZnQ.text: Love this place!!!! We have been here 20+ times. I highly highly recommend it. The ONLY reason I gave 4 stars is because, I've been here so many times and spent so much $$$ and today, they refused to allow me to bring in my Starbucks coffee! :( This seems ridiculous to me but we still love this place

w0p8OoSYmLdXDASaXkMsIA.text: Exceptionally poor customer service experience. It was very difficult just to find someone to take a drink/food order. Also, due to poor, outdated systems, the manager was unable to credit my credit card and allow me to use my Top Golf gift card. Come on, this should be a simple process. Very disappointing!

soSOJ3T5s5PylmD9_Wzb6w.text: Lots of fun! Friendly staff with great customer service skills..went on a Wednesday morning and the price was $25 and hour. Defiantly would not pay more than that. But at that price it's fair.  Call ahead to check pricing. At times it can be $45 an hour. Defiantly would not be a fair price at that. But I can handle $25 :)

SS0OJxVE8JdrzqVWhfLy4w.text: Cost friendly, super fun and great for dates or groups! Recommend getting the 3rd level!

iBgk9kUK1jpzzrkZ4eVa3w.text: Great fun for an evening of dinner, drinks and golf with friends! Would be good family and client meetings or really anything depending on the time of day you went. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was packed and lively. We grabbed dinner so the hour wait to golf was perfect for us. Plan to grab food/drinks if you can because the evenings usually have a wait we were told. We didn't mind the couple glitches with our scoreboard but keep that in mind if you're playing for keeps!

GZ2mhinFIalxmDPej8i0NQ.text: Great concept for an active party! Hit the ball while having fun with friends, eating really great food, and having some drinks. Staff super nice, food is fantastic and well priced, and time just flies by! Sat night here is a blast but be prepared for a 2 hour wait. It went fast for us because we hung out in the bar and had dinner and drinks. A must go at least once!!!

tv_Yz6Q6P1mQMonIQOF3_A.text: This place is amazing! Fun for the whole family. Even if your not a golfer it still has its perks. We love to come here! Thanks for all the fun top golf! Food and drinks are also amazing.

J7vPRgT-WstRR1i5-d4ewA.text: Love this place! We have always received great service but this last visit was made exceptional by our server Kat!! She was upbeat and ready to provide anything we needed. She made sure to consistently check on us and cater to anything we needed. She made food recommendations as well as drink ones that were on point. I recommend the asian wings and cheese fries.....and that chicken and waffles sandwich surprisingly good. We'll definitely be asking for her specifically the next time we go. Thanks Kat for making my visit with my husband and friends a fun one!!

yCSgl37v6gKyOBbSilaZFA.text: So much fun and experienced the best customer service! Everyone was so nice and the food and drinks were great. Will defiantly be back when I'm in town and have already recommended this place to several people who live in or visit the area frequently.

txjbtxd4hvCprVvmnSh8EA.text: Really wanted to like this place.  I'll probably do this twice a year and do a guys night.  Like someone mentioned, one ball at a time, takes time for the points to register, the hour can go quick.  The matts you hit off are pretty worn down and hard to hit off of.  The way the points are calculated is always a guessing game, it's really inaccurate.  You can basically find one hole and fixate on that one the entire time if you want to win.  I'd recommend doing 5 balls at each hole and turn it into a competition.    The layout of this place is a C grade, it can get really congested.  Lines go out the door, if you want to get to the bar or to the tee boxes, you have to worm your way through.  It's confusing about what line to get into even though there's people to help out.  The bar is great, though it should have been more detached from the entrance IMO.  Drinks are very expensive, mixed drinks are tiny.    Our host was awesome though, Brock.  We came in a party so our 3 lanes were reserved, he was very pleasant.  I hope when I go back it's a guys night and it's more enjoyable.

SlsXn_t6B6PuHD1ccdNSxg.text: We have a blast every time we come here, from my nine year old son to my  50yr+ parents! Prices are reasonable and there's plenty to keep everyone entertained even while you're waiting for what at first seems too long for your bay. The wait has never been as long as they quote, but either way we're having a great time by the time it's our turn and it keeps on going. Friendly staff, good drinks, decent food, what more do you need?

gWXqsEX5rLg3FDSh4S6CXQ.text: What a fun place! We went here on a Fri night. A storm was blowing through the area so we were delayed with getting started golfing. Food was decent, drinks were a little watered down, but the game was a blast. The check in process was Slow... One of the bay computers went down during our session. We would return just maybe not on a Fri night.

zaN84-HdifxpbheRq2lRJQ.text: Yesterday Saturday August 13, we visited top golf for a family night. Kaylynn was our server and gave great customer service. She had a lot of tables to handle and did it all with a smile on her face. We had a great time talking to her and hearing how her night was going. She did everything she could to make sure we had a good experience and we all appreciated that very much. She definitely deserves props and all the tips.

pmKCrQ8Dy39UwR1akELSJQ.text: Lots of fun. From the employees in general to the atmosphere this place is completely perfect for a fun Saturday. We were visiting from Orange County (build one in the OC) and came here in a group on Valentines Day. We waited about 30 minutes and hung out in the bar prior. The drinks were good and well priced in my opinion. It can get a little pricey at night, when we went, but its all worth it in my opinion!

hLe5cDFT4MsqbGtFzVLJoQ.text: We had our first experience at Top Golf last Friday and we loved it!! We'll definitely be going back soon! We were on the 1st floor and our waitress was Savannah - she was AMAZING and very attentive to our group all night long. I would give her 6 stars if I could! Thanks for such a fun night, looking forward to going back soon!

CBLKhF5wDrhBSMIZcvgD8A.text: I came into Top Golf for the first time the other night and it was so much fun! I would just like to make a shout out to all the employees at top golf, everyone is so friendly! But I would especially like to acknowledge our sever, Danielle G. She was so sweet and attentive! I ordered all of her recommendations and they were all amazing! (try the buffalo sliders and chicken tacos trust me). She was super helpful explaining the rules of the game. We had a blast! Everything exceeded my expectations and I will definitely come back!

yvtGBds1Tw7uV8dJgtOD3Q.text: Our party arrived at 11:15 am today, when the price is $25. The place was packed. We waited in line to become life time members at $5 each (membership is required), then waited in another line at the concierge's desk. We were told it would be 45 minutes to get to our spot. Since we would not be able to begin our fun, it would be after the 12:00 cut off for the price increase from $25 to $35. Whatever. So we decide to wait in the game and TV room. The waiter, Dan, came and took our drink orders. He brought them about 10 minutes later and we ordered appetizers and one of us ordered ice cream. Plus, 3 waters were ordered. Nothing ever came. About 35 minutes later we asked Dan where everything was. He said he'd check, and we also asked for the water. Another 20 or so minutes went by, and our group was called to report to our spot. Suddenly, Dan was there!! He wanted to make sure we got our food and said it would be delivered to us. At this point none of us even cared about our food. Within minutes, the food appeared, like magic!! I asked him again, for the 3rd time, for water. About 10 minutes later, the water arrived, along with 2 beers which had been ordered. So to sum up, when you get there, bring your own food and drink because by the time you get it it will be time to leave. I did see a sign in the ladies room they are having a hiring event on March 22. Maybe they don't have enough employees right now. I'm certain they don't have enough cooks, and they definitely had poor customer service today! Anyway, the golf part was fun but we were on the very bottom floor. One of the people I was with said it's more fun to be on the floors above. You'd certainly get a better view. I liked the TVs since it was the first day of March Madness. This location is crazy busy. I have heard the Gilbert location is not as busy. I doubt I will go back to this location. I think i will just go to a driving range at a local golf course and hit balls. I don't need all the glamour and Scottsdale fanciness this place has.

7B_B8GAX3b_3lYMFvpOHfw.text: Obsessed with this place! Came for the first time while visiting for Spring Training. It was so fun and I have never golfed. We hd a group of 6 people adults and children and everyone loved it.

7FH3raa7KDL99KIBOUvIVQ.text: Had a great time. Great service.  Too bad its in Snobdale I mean Scottsdale.  Some 60+ old man killed it for me while he was attempting to hit on me in front of his wife and my husband and son. Can't wait for the Gilbert location to open (where we live) to get away from the Scottsdale vide!!!

k37SiaIqCNThviNM9kA8gA.text: We had an amazing time!  Great fun for all of our party.  Even with my lack of golf skills I still had an excellent time.  The food was terrific too!

mTGVtkWlM8muqOEtnoxZiA.text: One of the coolest spots around and I don't golf at all. Awesome place, technology makes this place amazing, amazing server(Bali)  who gave me a vet discount and pushed me to the front of the line, delicious food and the MAN-mosa was great. I'll be back many times in the future

jMNAZQExLuRH4dmXoqoPYA.text: Was visiting from Los Angeles with some friends. Had been drinking there for a cool 3 hrs with the boys. It was finally my turn to buy a pitcher of beer and they refused me because my ID was vertical instead of horizontal. I went downstairs and continued to drink the same beer that I had been drinking for the past hour.....all of a sudden approached by security and escorted out for not having a horizontal ID. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?! Had been drinking there for the past 3 hous and all of a sudden its not okay and i get kicked out for my ID being vertical instead of horizontal. I am 23 years old for goodness sakes. What a load of shit. Wasn't the only one with the horizontal  ID but was the the only escorted out of the place. What a terrible experience. Thanks for nothing. Hope you guys figure your shit out sometime soon.

A6ywW160gy-FzvZFbuK7hA.text: Great place and a lot of fun! Would of been 5 stars but the service was terrible. First off my valid Texas I.D. was denied by the manager who was a complete dick. Second off its mid summer and over 90 degrees outside and it took over 20 min to get a pitcher of water and then another 15 for them to bring out glasses to go with the pitcher. Our waitress was gone the whole time.. The worst part is that all the employees were sitting around chatting while we were waiting. COMPLETELY UNPROFESSIONAL AND HORRIBLE SERVICE!

y1pLZD0PV_4fcr_xWd9EqQ.text: I was told I had to come to Top Golf if I am ever in Scottsdale. Well, we all went and had a grand time!! We all played, had a few drinks to unwind after along day at work. Service here was on point and they were all very helpful in explaining the rules and the best approach to play the game. Really love the view of the Indian Casino with all the lights, and we even managed to see the dry Thunderstorm without the rain. What  a great time, and I highly recommend coming here after work, or simply to spend time with friends and family.  Until then, Cheers! ~ :p

mVcXHfSJng6Ns4krr-I8fQ.text: Little pricey but still a lot of fun. The food is really good. Make reservations if you want level 2 or 3.  Staff is super nice and helpful!

RmlmTzTzkiwf_tFUGEPWaw.text: We came for the first time on a Sunday! Wasn't too busy. It was fun, and the customer service was great. We didn't really eat there but we got drinks and an appetizer. Very good. Prices were decent.  Our server, I think his name was Christian was super nice and very attentive. We will go again.

6_1n5zjWLzewZI_eHK9kHw.text: Ugh I hate that I can't leave a better review. Been here several times, and came this time for my birthday with my family and was pretty disappointed. In short, I'm disappointed with the service. The facility is cool and the food is actually really good. We reserved online and noted birthday as the occasion and asked for left-handed clubs. My mom wanted to bring a cake, but we were unable to reach anyone at the location (on hold 20 minutes and gave up). When we got there they said no. I told them it was my birthday and not only could I not bring in my cake, they didn't provide any dessert which was pretty weird to me. Also, we request left-handed clubs three times before we received them. Workers not very attentive, so don't expect anyone to go the extra mile for your special occasions.

_Du9XTtvjuU53_R_lIa5FQ.text: Holy crap this place is awesome! I have been here twice so far and have had a blast every time. It's a little on the expensive side, especially if you order food and drinks...expect to spend at least $70-$100. If you're coming to play just one round of golf with a few people, it's relatively inexpensive but who can come here and not drink? It makes it all the more fun, especially when the servers come right to your bay. haha.   The golf bays are really comfortable complete with patio couches and tables and heaters in the winter. I recommend getting a bay on the third level if possible...the view is better.

WJYFZPXBEHCLaNXVHOhGiQ.text: This place is like my new fave place.   The prices change depending on the time of day. It can be a tad pricy but if you go in group setting, it's totally reasonable. You can play for an hour at a time, and you can add after that is up. Or, you can just set a specified time frame. The atmosphere here is fun and it's a good time.   The food tho, is delicious. I love the mushi. It's a burrito that is cut like sushi. It's delicious. My son loves the donut holes. You get to inject it with flavors. Delicious.

BYgq0YVPomlaXCORSUPvBQ.text: I visited this Top Golf location a couple of days ago with my mom and friend. My mom and I have been to the Chandler location and assumed this one would be the same. Unfortunately, we were very disappointed. We ordered the nachos which looked like they had been thrown together and sat under the heat lamp for too long. Our flatbread was nothing to write home about. The pork sliders were great and the pretzel bites were average. The margaritas we ordered were extremely weak and not worth the money.   Zachary guided us to our bay and gave us directions. He actually made a sarcastic remark that wasn't appreciated.   We each had 2-3 balls that didn't register a score despite being hit somewhere into the targets. We had a few balls bounce out, but at least 9 that didn't and the score didn't get counted. For those of us who are horrible at golf, every point counts. We mentioned this to our server who explained it away as the sensor on some of the balls not working. It was disappointing to pay $35/hr for balls that didn't work correctly.   We don't live in the area, but if we did we would not return to this location and instead would go to the Chandler Top Golf.

OYMdORcxlH8b7Rn7d1jRgQ.text: We really enjoyed our time here.  Be ready for a pretty big line on Saturdays.  It's a popular place because everyone can do it.  I mean, who can't swing a club, drink beer and eat good food?  We got a spot downstairs on the ground floor and it was really exciting.  The guy who set us up helped us through all the options and even gave us a half an hour of time as we waited for the rest of our party to arrive.    It's a wait to finally join in the fun but it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. respect the swing
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. some what of a golf swing

G-5DTrrHsCa8PPAMaweyhQ.text: Was a lot of fun, even for non golfers.  Good food as well. Workers were nice and friendly.

vMTtB2tLL1Ws-s6VDVq4fg.text: Rip off! Over charge for everything. Have to pay to make reservations. Have to pay for "membership". Have to pay for your name to appear on scoreboard. Will NEVER EVER go back. This place doesn't deserve a star at all.

hdLX9J62526U9BC8cLih3A.text: Fun place to play golf with friends and family. They also  have two pool tables and awesome drinks. The only bad thing about this place is the wait time. We went Saturday evening and was told there was a 2 and half hour wait time.

lvtxI4ldQaSFxY6AefaaxQ.text: Came on July 4th. How Americana is that!!! Had another fabulous time here. I brought my nephew who had never here. He loved it. Staff was great. The fans and misters were working hard too. This is a place to have fun, eat awesome food and shoot some golf balls.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yummy
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Watermelon popsicles! So yummy
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. You got this Thomas!

3rc3R3hTHTJbKa7bpqyhxA.text: No better place to come if you're in the mood for any or all of the following: golf, good food, a sporting event, drinks, fun up-beat staff, great view, and more!

Ha7IUTljX-ZTnFd81NYCrg.text: We went with a group of 12 on a Tuesday morning.  We had the best time! Ample parking, modern and tons of seating and space.  You get a card, clubs and a brief rundown of the rules. The bar menu and snacks kept everyone happy too.  There are also cornhole, a giant jenga set and fooseball too.  Definitely a good place to bring out of town guests or clients.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View from 2nd floor

8jM6A25Df9KPoApvWZy1HA.text: If I could make sweet sweet love to a location, it would be Topgolf. Combine a cosmic bowling atmosphere with a driving range, and a bar, and what do you have? An erection.

0i-gADBMaXEqELtXM92dNg.text: Top golf is a wonderful experience. I went to the Vegas location once with friends and had a great time. During my honeymoon, my wife wanted to check it out. We had a great time. The food and service was excellent and I golfed better than I do on the golf course. Something about relaxing and drinking beer and eating good food makes me golf better. We just need one in Southern California!

fURWXNwvZdZgyaGnA4hFwg.text: Aside from the entertainment from watching work people get really riled up about golf, I didn't think our work event at Top Golf was that great. The food choices for vegetarians were pretty limited and the spread we had for the group wasn't very good. It was also hard to get ahold of a server to get drinks. I did have some fun hitting the ball a few times but since I'm not a club head, I got bored pretty easily and there isn't much else to do here.

eTsLk4BUEGDVaxMAvCSeZQ.text: Wildly expensive but also wildly fun, Topgolf is kind of addictive! I've come here twice in the last month- once with a group of co-workers for a team building activity and once on a date.  The food on both of my visits was unfortunately not great though.   The first time I came I ordered the shrimp cocktail and it was honestly disgusting. The shrimp itself was fine but seasoned with (I think) paprika which wasn't a good combination IMO. I choked it down but not enthusiastically. It was served on wonton crisp-like chips with uncooked onion, jalapeno pepper and funky tasting cocktail sauce. I did not enjoy it AT ALL. I dumped all the toppings off and ate the chips by themselves and only because I was starving.  The second time I ordered a quesadilla and it was also noooo bueno. The cheese wasn't fully melted and tasted kind of like a kraft single melted between two tortillas. The peppers on the quesadilla were cold and uncooked.  The guacamole served with the quesadilla was bland and mediocre.  The only thing I enjoyed was the cookie & marshmallow fluff dessert my date and I ordered. It was yummy.  The price for an hour of golf varies depending on what time you come. In the morning it's $25, from 12-5 is $35, and after 5 it's $45 per hour. I came after 5pm both times I visited Topgolf. For a group of five coworkers, $45 is a bargain. BUT for an intimate date with two people, it's a pretty steep price to pay. I think on future visits I will eat before I come and only get drinks & dessert here and I'll likely come in the afternoon rather than the evening.  One thing I have to give them credit for is that they make a major effort to keep you cool in the summer heat. They have numerous huge fans (with misters attached)  blasting every which-way and you definitely will NOT get hot here. Love that!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp cocktail- &#39;A&#39; for presentation, &#39;F&#39; for taste.
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mmm cookies &amp; marshmallows fluff!

fWQSYcxYjw1AfFDux-UcsA.text: Total rip off if going for a Birthday or get together.  Tried to reserve 2 bays for 10 ppl to get together and hang out.  Website says 35$ an hour per bay.  After talking to Alana Palacio the hospitality consultant, we were told the total to reserve 2 bays would be $642.93! Basically forcing our group to purchase 300$ in food and charging $240.00 for 2 bays for 2 hours when again, the website says $35.00/hour per bay....why the additional 100$ charge Alana? After a $60 service charge and $40 in taxes the total is $642.93 for 2 hours of golf!?

70OTJ4woJUaWrrlc15g-8Q.text: Had a really good time here for a friends birthday, can be pretty pricey for 35$+per hour, but it's more of a bar type atmosphere and the food was okay, especially when the menu is only bar foods. The drinks were pretty good, and the atmosphere was amazing. Definitely recommend going here to see celebrities and to have a good time

WLhZWF8lBglQ1h9hvSk_nw.text: Had an amazing time at this TG location. Our server was so nice from beginning to end. Even helped us figure out how to work the touch screen.  Although we didn't order food...we did order drinks.  Drinks were ok....just a bit watered down for my liking. I don't come to TG often so I guess it's ok.  My next visit to AZ, I will come back!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

_E-Ul53aTrocmqCjp1P8FA.text: Fun in the sun, as others may put it! Topgolf is really a kid-friendly recreational arena that combines bowling/golfing fun for the entire family (for a modest fee, of course). Food and drinks are also on the higher end of the general price spectrum, so don't be too alarmed if your wallet ends up feeling considerably lighter by the end of the day.  The golfing bays themselves are well-kept, and you'll be regularly/frequently attended to by the staff members, which can be good or bad, depending on whether you order food and drinks or not... Otherwise, it might just seem a bit awkward, if all you wanted is ice water, and the server asks you numerous times throughout the hour if there is anything else that you may want to order. This was also the case when I was just playing billiards with my coworker on a random, rather empty, weekday afternoon after work (thus, we were dressed in clinical scrubs). We were asked by 2-3 different servers if we were there to play golf as well and/or if we wanted to order food/drinks. At the end, we just succumbed to the pressure and ordered a beer and a hamburger + fries (which weren't anything special in and of themselves, but did cost us a pretty penny). All in all though, our billiards games were fun, despite the occasional interruption by the servers and the side glances at the only two people playing pool in the recreational room.  Suffice to say, Tolgolf can be a fun place to play some pseudo-golf (when it isn't too packed), but I doubt it's a place that serious golfers will frequent, due to its steep prices for a golfing bay, food, and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Indoor fun!
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Clubs!

pDKFRoYlS_-xIpSgIdCxwA.text: OUT-OF-TOWN guest here! Coming from the cool crisp Pacific NW to the fiery hot Arizona temperatures the misting fans were the BEST. The service was great. My team and I had the buffet spread, which was served hot and ready. The staff was extremely helpful and always approached with a smile.
