Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gmTGsCtakEtWPLVP6fnNVw.text: Really fun and reasonable. We were able to go on the weekend without reservations and didn't have to wait. The employees were really helpful and attentive since it was our first time. Food was good. Spent about 1.5 hours there. Good for kids 5 and older.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

yhT1VlJRM5niosOaVjuDfg.text: It is a place to be young, old, good at golf...or not, for family outings, for couples or friends, and even for business functions...its all great.  Objective is to hit balls into circles at varying distances on the range and get points which are calculated by the computer. This is not like real golf where the ball must be airbourne. Aim & hit... "It's in the hole!"  "Tiger Woods." Minus of course the affair. I must have uttered these words a few times during our visit to Topgolf in Scottsdale.  The facility has so many bays on three levels, you loose count.  They have two types of bays. High tops to sit out and others have an L shape sofa type seating. Second and third floor have the best views. Awesome sight especially at night. All the neon lights are up out on the field. The twinkle lights of The Talking Stick Resort & Casino adds to the ambiance as well. Cost depends on the time of day you go. $25 per hour (per pod or bay not per person) before noon. $35 before 5pm & $45 after 5pm. Each bay can holds 6 and can play for this price. Clubs are included both for men & women or you can bring your own. Purchase a granted lifetime membership for $5 to keep your score, progress and is valid across the country.   For those in the party mood, this is also a great place to chill and have some drinks and food. There is also a billiards area, shuffleboard tables, restaurants on each tier & bars. Loads of fun!  Also have rooms for private parties.    Not quite ready to end the night?  How about going over to the Talking Stick Resort Casino just down the way.    Such a welcoming escape from reality and a fun way to pass the time. Overall, I would definitely return again when in town. Also looking forward to check out their other locations across the country too.  Good service, very clean & well-maintained with friendly employees.  The golf itself is fun.  "Just tap it in. Just tap it in. Give it a little tappy. Tap Tap Taparoo." --Happy Gilmore

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. view from the 3rd Floor

bbwwWTLozOBEIrMeUWfUgw.text: Friendly staff. Great place to go hangout with friends. Play golf and eat and drink all at the same time. Who can complain?  It's always clean and efficient service provided. They even got heaters for when it gets  little chilly for us Arizona residents.

BdEJLfiFmH90fHBqY6t69g.text: I'm not a golfer by any means, but still had a great time. Even if you're not there to hit a few balls, their food and drinks aren't bad, and typical prices for an activity such as this. They do have a full bar, so the options are endless and great for accommodating even the pickiest of drinkers.  I highly recommend making reservations ahead of time as it gets packed, even midweek. The process is simple: go online, find the date/time you want, pay a small fee and voila, you're done. Know, you can't book more than seven days out, so if you're a planner, that might deter you a little bit.  Everything is electronic and your server will walk you through the steps if it's your first time. Once you're setup, you aim towards your target and try to rack up as many points as possible. I don't think any of us were really there to compete as we just kinda took turns hitting things and seeing how far we could make them go. Definitely made for some great boomerangs.  It's a great group activity and I'd definitely do it again if in the area and looking for something to do.

mO22oUvNF-7AnpDEibnYVA.text: This location had awful service in the bar area during my visit this Saturday. The waiter was clearly struggling with our party. We had one menu for 7 people and then we asked for more and he gave us 2 more..then we couldn't get napkins, plates, water.. It was just a mess. The golfing section had good staff at least.  Everyone enjoyed their food but my burger was very undercooked. Our party spent almost $400 for a mediocre experience.

A6QxQPy4vENNz_OlOeLaBg.text: This place is pretty awesome. You get to whack balls while in a bar! It is awesome. The food is pretty good and the alcoholic beverages will make you feel like you are the king when you hit one of the targets!   This place "normalizes" the golf game, because if you whack in the general direction you will be able to get something, and it's always fun when you got something in golf. Clubs are complimentary; Upgrade to Tyalors for 15 bucks.   The only thing is that they rent by stalls and time and it can be pretty expensive if it's less than a threesome going. An hour is 45 bucks and if new member additionally 5 bucks each person. But overall, very good experience and I am already planning on motivating the horde! We shall drink! Eat! Golf!

-lRyh_mqje5zDDxK0sAlcQ.text: My work team had an event here and I really enjoyed it.  We did have preset space at one end of the driving ranges and had a set menu of food.  So I don't know how individual activities are.  We had a very good golf instructor who walked us through how to use their system.  He always worked with several people on their swing and how to improve.    I believe we had the FAJITA FIESTA buffet.  Steak and chicken fajitas with peppers + cilantro savory rice + chipotle-braised  black beans + tortillas + chips and salsa and guacamole (extra cost) + shredded cheese + pico de gallo + sour cream + chocolate chip cookie bites.  We also did the INJECTABLE DONUT HOLES - cinnamon-sugar dusted donut holes + chocolate and raspberry filling.  Everything was really tasty.  Loved the chips and guacamole.  Fajitas were really tasty.  Loved the donut holes.    Our waitress had a big task on her had with our large group who like to drink.  She was pretty fast and was able to get us new drinks with ease.  She deserves a big tip.  Overall a fun place, even for those that don't golf.  Good food, good drinks, fun atmosphere.

cvgING5dkNlM3AoOStV7Vw.text: This is a double review. I've been here for both a typical golf experience as a party of 6 and to have our son's 7th birthday there.  Party of 6: We reserved an early bay on the weekend, making it about $25/hour. We also bought food off the menu and the nachos are absolutely incredible. We also liked the wings, pretzel bites with the beer cheese, and veggie burger. We had a bay on the second floor and loved it. The misters were on (hot day). It could've been slightly cooler, but was still an awesome experience. We vowed to come back again soon.  Birthday Party: Our son loved our experience so much when we visited in a smaller group that he said he wanted to have his birthday party here. We booked online for a lunch party (12-2pm) for 12 kids for $300. It works out to $400 because of gratuity and fees, but in my opinion, it was a great deal. The golfing for a bunch of 7yo kids was more just hitting some balls, but it was perfect. We had a double couch setup, lunch was delivered (chicken strips, cheeseburger slider, fruit, tator tots and unlimited drinks) to each kid. The portions were awesome. We only had 10 kids, but they still have us the 12 meals. We were allowed to order more items, too (not included). The kids loved lemonade and our amazing server brought pitchers and cups. They have a gift table, cake table, water station, the works. It was held on the bottom level (safer) and this time, they turned on the heaters for us making it perfect. Our server was the best, the event coordinator visited our area a few times to check in and make sure all was well, the overall coordinator checked in via phone/voicemail with me multiple times and they even had our server waiting at the entrance when we walked in with a framed sign that said my son's name. Made him feel so special. When our time was up, we still had a couple kids waiting for their parents so we went to their outdoor area and the kids played bags/cornhole and enjoyed their goodie bags (not included).  It was super awesome and we would do it again!

LURm2JaHO_Tq9_7bgL910g.text: This was my first time to top golf and we had a group of 11 people. The servers were very nice! We had taken two bay, never realized hitting golf balls would be so much fun. Took some time to figure out the right club for the shot. They had some good food as well. Me and my wife ordered boneless chicken wings and flavor that we have selected was Asian sesame and we also ordered peach ice tea. The chicken was little sweet for my taste and I found the peach tea quite refreshing. This place is good for not only groups but you can still have some fun if you come alone or with someone. Me and wife will surely visit again for some more swings!

4PidGUbOuZhV8xzZFW7i9Q.text: I always love going here with my friends and family. I may not be that good at golf but it's a lot of fun. My only complaint is that the pricing to play is really high.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dYb60e7x5_pyPB1Q3MXEaA.text: Topgolf was super cool. I'm not experienced in golfing and I loved the low-key feel of this place. Such a range of people and skill levels were welcome to play golf. My whole family went for a few hours and everyone had fun playing the variety of games offered. I can't figure out their amazing technology which makes learning to golf so accessible and mastering so fun. This is the bowling alley of golf, but much higher class. I think their secret to success must be in the fabulous variety of food because golfing there is so inexpensive -- $25 an hour for 1-6 people. They offer table service of drinks, breakfast, brunch, lunch, and snacks. I saw advertisements for great happy hour deals too. To be honest, I'm not a big sports or bar person, and I really had fun at Topgolf. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

v2pQfeWqvL7cVyelM5sMsQ.text: I am not a golfer and in-fact the team we went with, all of us were amateurs. We had our team outing here and totally a good place to be. They accommodated about 15 of us and We were allotted 3 bays and had a great recreational time. It was a good outing and break from work. The service we had was super awesome, the lady was with us through out and made sure we were getting what we wanted.  They have a full bar with lot of options, since we had to get back to work I chose not to drink. The bays were super clean and the clubs were well maintained too. We had a blast playing and it was a lot of fun.  For the food there was fajitas for buffet and I would put that the food was not so good, it was more like a bar food and wasn't that great. That being said I loved the cookies they gave for dessert. It was tasty and fresh.  I would recommend reserving ahead on time coz its packed most of the time. Overall had a nice time and would definitely want to come back to get the balls into the target.

QuUmTPsIXNJwDKo6lurS4Q.text: I didn't think I would enjoy a group outing here, but I thoroughly had a gas of a good time. Since I didn't plan the excursion, I didn't have any interaction with the staff or the logistics, but I loved the activity itself. Might take it up as my new hobby for 2019, even!  There is a console for you to play an organized game or you can do what we did and just hit balls for the sake of hitting balls for your time on the green.  Also, their snacks are delicious. We had the pretzel bites, some queso concoction (chips were from bag, but the queso more than made up for them), nachos, and fries. Nothing about any of that is healthy, but no golfer ever mentions needing to watch their figure, so don't hold back.

iiw7WiOOOT6iqQOSXhKr7Q.text: I've been to a few different Topgolf locations and I absolutely love the concept! It makes the most frustrating game on the planet approachable for everyone regardless of age, size, shape or skillset. Kinda like mini golf...only if you're not paying attention you can step into someone's back swing or fall off the 3rd story platform. :-)  This specific location has got to be one of the best I've been to. It's a massive venue with tons of reservation areas. The staff is on point and the food comes out efficiently and tastes much better than you'd expect from any place there's a possibility of someone yelling "fore!"  When will you guys make San Diego happen!?!?

pttUGooKwqv3gpTQHexPpA.text: This is a fun place to go to and it's kid friendly too! We were greeted by a nice gentleman that walked us to our area and he was very friendly and gave us information on how to use the golf screen. Then a few minutes later we were greeted by Lauren to ask us what kind of drinks or any food we would like to order. She continued to check on us frequently and made the experience that much better. We ordered a pizza flatbread, chips with salsa and guacamole, and French fries with ranch. We all also ordered drinks that were brought out to us very quickly and we never had to look for anyone to order the next. All the appetizers we ordered were delicious and came out quickly as well.   We did one hour of golf and it was a fun experience with some great views. Also living in Arizona it can get very hot, but they do everything they can do to make you forget how hot it actually is by keeping us cool with misters and fans. I will be back and next time I will be bringing my son.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

R_V6345wBI9XimIBM3PnpQ.text: I've only been to Topgolf once before but have had fun every time! I'm not a golfer at all, but my friends wanted to check it out on a Monday night.  We had been trying to go for a couple weeks and realized that the best way to ensure a bay is to reserve one online. Even weeknights are very busy especially at this location! We stayed for about two hours and the service was great. Everything is done digitally and the waiters/waitresses are very helpful if you are having issues. In addition, they are able to split the cost of the bay between the people present, which I thought was very handy! The food is pretty good and decently priced and they have a large selection of beers and a full bar. I was so excited to order the injectable donut holes and they did not disappoint. If you do order them, I would definitely suggest getting raspberry jam as one of your fillings because that was by far my favorite. I also enjoyed the chocolate (but did not try the Bavarian cream).

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Injectable donut holes

of28xB5neyPS4m6MxLFhuw.text: It may have taken me awhile to make my way to Topgolf, but now that I've been, I hope to return again sooner than later!  My group of approximately 20 lucked out and scored a couple of bays next to each other on a recent Thursday night... it was the perfect place for "happy hour" and to literally unwind after a couple of days of in-office meetings.    We enjoyed some drinks and appetizers and chit-chatted while taking turns teeing off. It was fun to see how skilled some of my colleagues are at golf (and also to laugh with those that are not so skilled too...me being one of those)!  The staff at the bar and working the bays were all friendly and attentive, and the facility is huge with a super fun vibe.  There is fun music playing but it's not too loud to where you can't have a conversation.  There is comfortable seating for those hanging, watching, waiting for their turn to tee off too.  In addition to the area we were hanging in, this venue offers a bar, retail area, billiards area, shuffleboard, multiple restaurants, a rooftop terrace with a fire pit, over 200 HDTVs, private event spaces and meeting rooms, and free Wi-Fi too.  The Topgolf concept has really seemed to take off, and I can see why.  I look forward to returning for date nights, family playdates, parties and more.

9sV4tZRYsnIzOSmcnThfUQ.text: Amazing amazing amazing. I spend countless hours here while I'm on a business trip and the service is amazing the facility is amazing and they have a onsite director of instruction who gives lessons. His name is Jesse Hughes and he told me that he gives lessons and I told him I was flying out soon but thank you. He offered to look at my swing (I was struggling lol) Then gave me a a short lesson no questions asked no offer of services. Fixed my swing in minutes. If this guy does this for you Tip him! His lessons are $115.00 an hour and will come back to visit him next time. Fun weekend thank you Top Golf and thank you Jesse!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1dsMg7zOly7KwNSH9tGdBQ.text: Food, Drinks, SHADE, and Golf.  Such a great combo!  Fun place with friends or as a date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Not a bad day...

MiEO9HBMkEZWADeqsNqTZA.text: Michelle was a great help in making our time at Top Golf great!   We had an issue with our machine (some software error) because the guy that was playing with us had a high score that broke the game.   She visited with us, and made sure the issue was corrected in a timely fashion, and would highly recommend coming back.

Rne-prrArdHiU4eZvTxXEQ.text: Be weary of the servers at Top Golf. Especially ones named Hannah M. She altered my receipt and gave herself a 110% tip. When my credit card company called to dispute the charge, the manager called me back the next day and tried to refund only the altered tip. I didn't even get an apology for the altered receipt, overcharging my card, or spending a Saturday on the phone trying to get the charges reversed. You suck top golf.

Itl89AES7q-uTx6oig4Q-g.text: The last couple of times that I have been here the rooftop patio is always closed off and or rented out. I understand, you are quite busy. That is the least of my concerns at a place I've loved for a long time. I need to make a very accurate comment about this place; the service is absolutely horrible! On more than 5-10 occasions I have come and sat at the ground level bar, new downstairs patio, or rooftop and it takes multiple people to recognize we have sat down and sometimes up to 15 -20 minutes to even be acknowledged or be served. I cannot lie or exaggerate about the timeframe! Trust me, I wish I was exaggerating. I first brushed it off because this was such a great place to come to but something needs to be brought to attention. I understand when the place is fully booked and events pack up the place and I have been courteous to timeframe of service in those circumstances. The problem I believe lies in the people you hire. You can't have 6 people behind a bar regardless if you are a bar back or not and not be acknowledged customers for long periods of time. The training just needs to be better at the very least greet people and say "I'll be with you in a minute" instead of no eye contact or acknowledgment. I hope management or someone can see that from a loyal customer who has come here since the opening, please fix or find a way to better train your employees. The sad truth is I've mentioned this to the last few people who have come to this location with me and they finish my sentence agreeing, I'm just the one finally making it evident to bring it to your attention. I love you top golf. Work on your service for the love of everyone!

ZWk2MjeqZ4IpBNf4Ysd1Ow.text: Went to top golf last night with the guys and had a really good time! First and foremost the ambiance is modern and inviting,second, the staff is very knowledgeable and friendly. Our server Kirby did a great job attending us. And last it is very affordable.   P.S. The prices on cocktails and brews are better then other places happy hour! Can't beat that !

oCeGu7neEMA427mYcka8xg.text: Awesome!!! Wish we had one in our state!! Certainly a fun place to hang with family and friends!!

1eK5jn18a-MxtsWb5aAWGA.text: Been to the Scottsdale Topgolf twice - once with the guys, once with a big group of family in town over Thanksgiving holiday - and had a total blast each time! What a brilliant concept - turning a driving range into a full entertainment, food and drinks venue.  It's a little pricey, but not terribly. First time I went was on a Thursday night and the place was totally packed. There are 3 levels of bays and the top (3rd) always seems to be occupied by a large corporate group - which this place is ideal for. We waited awhile, had some drinks & food, then got a bay on level 2 (the higher up you are, the better).  Golfers or non-golfers will both have fun as they've created scoring games with multiple targets, and many levels of them. Bring your own clubs or use the house clubs, it's your preference. Even if you've never picked up a club, you'll have a ton of fun at this place.

A5UfjoBuXbM0ExBWjScHmw.text: We went to Top Golf on Wednesday night, between Christmas and New Year's Eve and it was a lot of fun.  We were entertaining family from out of town and it was our first time there.  It was incredibly busy but our line moved quickly due in large part to a staff member named Troy.  There was some sort of computer issue that started to back things up, but he fixed it quickly and kept everything running smoothly while still being genuinely friendly and helpful.  As we had some questions, he gave us all the best info and even made some great suggestions.  We'll be back soon!

C00baInu3YhkeQ4G18UoVA.text: Returned again after a long wait. Sat at the bar just to be ignored by the bartender. Gerry i think his name was. Sat there over 20 minutes before ordering a beer, finally got the beer 10 minutes after that. Maybe 6 people sitting at the bar. It was a tuesday night for christs sake. Not busy at all. Worst service ever. Will remember to drive an extra 20 minutes to go to gilbert. They know good service. Pathetic.

zVv5w7Nwx9_-WkJi62f3PA.text: So went to topgolf tonight had a great time and had the best waitress in the whole place. Special shout out to Savvy the best in the place and I will be requesting her again FOR SURE.

llsQLl3JCdTCWl74ke78ww.text: Great time today with the Family! Thanks to Taylor for being an awesome host.  She's a great representative for your organization.  We'll be back soon!

qx5TEkyPnS5TaSDdhuXIDA.text: What an awesome experience! Taylor from golf services is the best. She made all of our families Top Golf dreams come True. Because of Taylor, our Christmas is no longer ruined and now I feel happy enough to actually give my children Christmas gifts this year. Thank you Taylor.

lUy_EaId7k2vl98a9H9GIg.text: Bad costumer service. They completely messed up charging us on times && then never asked up for last call. Will not be back.

JKCcFJf_c_3ecoAlUXbakQ.text: I wasn't quite sure what to expect when my friends suggested we check out Top Golf.  We wanted to find a fun activity while beating the hot Arizona temps.  I'm usually shy away from golf-related activities because I'm too competitive to accept the fact that I'm not good at this sport.  We were on the first floor, which was perfect - we could easily see where our balls were falling.  I also liked that there was a computer at each station that projected images of exactly how far you hit.  There were people on both sides of us but I never felt like we were too crammed.  I was surprised to see the variety of clubs provided...not that I know the difference but I'm sure someone does and would appreciate having options.   The entire place was very clean and orderly (even the bathroom).   The outdoor misters were perfect for beating the heat.  The waitresses were attentive.  We shared pizza and the mini waffles with chicken - both were tasty.  I wasn't expecting a lot since we weren't going there for the culinary experience.  I was pleasantly surprised.  If you're not into golfing, there were some indoor activities (pool, arcades games, etc.) to keep everyone busy.  I loved the memories made at Top Golf.  My friends and I shared so many laughs (mostly at my expense because I was so bad).  It's a fun activity that all ages will enjoy.

Pk77e2Y3XHjapmixH1922A.text: Fun! But NO "Drivers, Woods or Hybrids" are allowed! Should charge 1/2 price for 1/2 service.  ($45 an hr) Talking Stick Casino getting hit with golf balls. #buildabiggerfence #badplanning

XpkKMCBmCAX-rxR7TOfNZA.text: Place is awesome - whether you're an avid and frequent golfer or novice, there's a game for you. Wait staff was very attentive and overall great atmosphere and experience.

7l8aCNcy5uYuWioFi9cK9g.text: I had a blast here! I'm not a golfer, but that didn't matter. I had a wonderful time with some great friends. I can't wait until they build the locations in New Orleans and Baton Rouge!

NvA0NBmO38izDEZCufwweA.text: Such a fun place, the golf games & cocktails make for a fun evening out. They have something for everyone. Video games, pool tables, golf games, food & drinks. Always seems to be a wait to get in, so plan ahead.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gorgeous evening!!!

UzTquJe4XW5fZf-v01-P0Q.text: Such a great place to have a good time. Anarbol Martinez totally hooked us up with a bay towards the center on the third floor on a Saturday night where the wait was set to 45 minutes to get a spot on either the third or second floor. Now that's what I call customer service! He's the best!

d1FitE436C-qQAoGw9N-Kw.text: This is a great atmosphere, I went with some friends I do business with. I think its more cost effective with at least 4 to 6 in your group. I would recommend going at night when the Casino is lit up in the background. They have their own clubs but the grips are expectantly worn. I'm going back for sure. JJ.

PRJemzqMwSJma2Zk7X0_NQ.text: First time at Top Golf and we had a great time!  Staff was friendly and helpful.   Our server was helpful in getting the system up and running.  I thought the cost it was good value.  They provide clubs but you can also bring your own.  However I think you can only use your irons.  Check their website to be certain.  Had lots of fun.

kWtIpBrKSNq2YRXJK0MGAQ.text: I had a great time playing golf with my girlfriend on Valentine's Day. Our server came over letting us know that he would be dropping by every now and then if we had any questions. I wanna point out that he never once came by again, I went to the bar to order and appetizer, they told me it would be put in 10 minutes. Went back a half an hour later to get told that the kitchen is now closed. I was pretty understanding, so I went ahead and asked for a beer instead. "Bar closes at 11:30." This is what I get in response, once again I'm understanding coming from customer service. Then I check my phone to see if my girlfriend had asked for anything and it was 11:20. So not only did the incompetent piece of Shit not get me my appetizer, the bar tender wouldnt take 10 seconds to pour me a beer. To top the entire night off, I was told I would pay 45 dollars and I could play till close. Ended up getting charged 90$, didn't get an appetizer I had ordered, couldn't get a beer cuz the bar closed in 2 minutes. Overall I will not be returning to this location, the customer service here is an absolute joke. If you want your money's worth, head to Gilbert. Unless all you wanna do is smack some golf balls.

4nQh_V5O3J3PAY771L8tZA.text: We brought our legitimately drinking age kids here to show them sone fun...paid 50.00 for a vip, 5.00 for a stupid lifetime memberahip that means nothing and then 90.00 for 2 hours at a table to have dinner and pay more money for food and drinks....then becauae one of our legit sons had a vertical ID, they wouldnt give him a beer...the manager was rude...said ahe didnt want our business anyway and it didnt matter at all...i understand its the law but later found out, the got busted once and now are willing to pass up business and more money...so be it....will never go back...the general manager came out to apologize for the regular manager...apologized...but a day late and a dollar short...if ahe had handled it well she would have comped the wings and said i get it...how can i make you stay..instead of " we dont give a crap"....note to management....train your people to retain business instead of make them find other places to spend money.

R5B801OdPfHMU24maTwIMw.text: Liars. Unfortunately I got suckered into waiting 4 hours for a bay. I was told upon my arrival that it would be an hour to an hour and half wait. Checked in at an hour and a half, was told another hour or so. Checked in again, told 15-20 minutes. Finally four hours after getting there I decided to leave. How can anyone plan anything at this place with friends if they can't get even 50% accurate forecasts of actual start time. Something is seriously wrong with how they run this place. Felt lied to and though I'm local and represent hundreds of dollars in future business for them I'm not coming back after this experience.

G8yQaHzhxq8ktLq6muczcw.text: Visited this location from out of town (Texas) where I have visited the Dallas, Las Colinas, and Austin locations. Every experience I have at the Dallas location is awful (service could NOT be worse). This location had friendly service but they don't allow you to use tees. REALLY? They claim it's because some people have hit the ball over the 300 ft netted wall. So now everyone else is forced to shoot from one of your 3 remaining clubs that don't require a tee? We played from the bottom floor which basically meant we couldn't aim for anything other than the three holes directly in front of us. For the amount you pay to play here to basically hit a wedge, 8, or 6 iron, I'm sorry this fucking blew. We had planned on coming tomorrow too but not anymore. We'll take our 300+ dollars of business to the casino instead, since the few people who are that awful at hitting a driver ruined it for everyone else.

uR-cM3nGrCXktEeGHRXMgw.text: Who doesn't love Topgolf?! It is pretty much a bowling alley in golf form. When they first opened, they had up to 3 hour wait times on the weekend evenings. I'm not sure if it has improved over time and with Topgolf Gilbert opening. However, coming in on weeknights are lovely! No wait! If your birthday falls on a Monday or Tuesday, don't hesitate to plan a little get together here with your clique. The price at night is reasonable -- $45/hour per bay for up to 6 people. I hear it is even cheaper during the day. The more the merrier and the more affordable it is per person. If you are hungry, I suggest the wings, you can't go wrong! The Asian zing sauce is tasty. I wish they had better options for dessert because that's my thing. The donut holes are pretty good. I heard they took out some desserts they used to serve that sounded better than what they currently have, whats up with that?! But back to what this place is really about -- golf. This is a driving range on steroids and it is so fun, even for the non-golfer, cant-hit-the-ball but who cares! It's all in good fun in the name of friendly competition. And the amazing attitude on the staff is infectious! I have only encountered super fun, energetic, attentive concierge and servers here. Thanks for the good times, Topgolf.

VjyTlo2UB-U_oDFmwFWRTg.text: Our bay had technical difficulties once. The hospitality manager and a tech guy came to fix it. When they did it cleared all of our scores and started a new game. Once it was fixed we made it one ball in to the next game and the machine broke again. No balls would come out. By that time dinner was done and the fun was over. Lame.

QCc28vlbo5iGIe9UTmelLg.text: Last night we went to get dropped off at topgolf and was flagged down by a man in the parking lot. The gentleman worked there and had told our driver they are fully booked for the rest of the evening and turned us away. We ended up going to the casino then walking back over. It looked busy but we saw bays open so we went to go give it a shot. Sure enough we waited less than a half hour and got in. Might not want to turn away guests in the parking lot before they even try to get in!!!

NOYCOtXwJ41fjhjKxqnL4Q.text: Everything about this place was a lie. When I got there I was told there would be a 25 minute wait. Then I was told there would be a 45 minute wait. I ended up waiting for an hour and a half. They then said the fries and wings where made in house. They tasted awful and they where so clearly bought frozen that anyone could taste it. Don't go here.

1QJ4aKdTpsiPoDNk6MDAzQ.text: Normally enjoy coming here, but today on a Friday morning we are told we have to wait 30 minutes when there are at least 20 open bays, supposedly reserved..also TERRIBLE customer service today, wow, so disappointed in top golf. Also there is only 1 employee working the main bar/restaurant with about 10-15 people waiting in here and we have yet to get served, terrible fail on management today, I hope that this is just a one time occurrence.

v4vDp7eszR9PiFELPwty6g.text: Great place to go and have a good time. Service is excellent food is great. Our server Hannah M was fantastic I highly recommend this for any gathering. Customer service is EXCELLENT!

mssRJ0EGvHwB2NSd1xh9IA.text: Once you are in, its very fun. The line to check in can be very long. We decided to eat in the main restaurant the last two times we've gone. Unfortunately, both times we waited more than an hour for our food. Don't go there with hungry kids. Experience is average at best. A little service would increase the experience.

7VLiwpOrQ_LsfC1_7s844A.text: Went after work on Friday with coworkers. ...this is my 3rd time.  Golf is really fun but the service horrible.. .again.  management said it was a new server.. ..the last time they were under staffed.  Check your final tab. ..drinks we did not order showed up on our bill.  This happened twice before too.  Food is average at best.  And we couldn't order 2 buckets of beer to start because "per AZ law" we needed 6 in our group and we only had 5.  Please don't quote AZ law before I even sit down!  Of course she was no where to be found for drink orders after that.  My advice. ...pay with cash as you go.. ..or try Gilbert location.

A2ZAD0A17oJ2KMge1jLtAw.text: This place has gone from a great place to hit golf balls to one of the worst.  You can no longer hit any type of driver, fair way club (3,5 or 7 wood) or any hybrid club. This goes for women too.  Additionally if you want to use your own clubs, irons only, you can only hit from the bottom floor, which on a busy night is impossible to get an open bay. I guess it's back to Crackerjax's!!!!

MlJNWQVGT043pFlkBMvFXA.text: Darius was a very cool person!! He was dancing with me and my friends and was awesome! However, our server was horrid along with security. There were literally 6 servers/security men standing against the wall staring at me and my friends, making us feel SO uncomfortable during our entire experience for NO reason. None of us were doing anything wrong, yet we all felt so uncomfortable. I do not appreciate this!!! Overall, it had potential to be a good experience, but because of the lack of hospitality, I am appalled and will probably never come back

gK5OXqWFrYwtLvALGu3I5A.text: This is an awesome concept. Got in right away and had great service. Wish there were more of these places around. Would definitely recommend it to everyone!

CrfIUbC6dQMj0PdeZnaDwA.text: I was told at door that you can only hit irons have to take woods and hybrids back to car.  Great job on designing a driving range that can't hold a shot over 200 yards.  Expensive place to begin with but way overpriced if you can only hit irons.  Been to one in Wooddale, IL.  Great concept just not in Scottsdale though.

UYjYQKPvixRDA6WjsyeCPw.text: Someone from upper management did reach out to me after my post here and to me that does count for something on behalf of an establishment.  The gentleman was very polite and 'heard' my point.  He seemed unwilling, but not unable to see my point and how the way they handle people trying to enjoy their facility could have been accomplished more effectively.  Though he was very friendly and seemed interested in resolving the issue, no options were offered (Like when Donald Trump speaks about Condoleezza Rice).  On quite a few occasions he mentioned that he was new to the issue and was not abreast of all the facts.  This is customer service in America today, "I understand you are unhappy but there is nothing I will do about it but invite you back for another dose of what I hope is better the next time."  The only way I would go into anything unprepared is if I was willing to concede or if I knew I had no intention of changing my position regardless of the truth.  I am still not familiar with the unorthodox management or service at TopGolf.

qc4fyj0dVNeZF7panSDZoA.text: I love it here with grown ups or with kids. You have to be prepared going in, there could be long waits and it gets more expensive at night, but it's so much cooler all lit up. You can have 6 golfers per bay and it's not easy to get two bays together, so if you have a bigger group than 6, it might put a damper on things if it's busy and you have to be separated. But, if you're six or less (golfers, you can have more people just hanging out), it's really fun. Last time we went, we got there around 4 on a Saturday and it was a two hour wait. So I logged on and bought a priority pass and we got right in. That's how I would recommend doing it, get there, see how long the wait is and if it's super long THEN get the priority pass. For example, if you get there and it's only 45 minutes, to me that's not worth the $50. They have a bar, so you can hang out there and get drinks, the wait goes by pretty quick, especially with all the activity around you in the bar area. The food is a huge step up from Dave and Busters (our other go to with the kids). We did the mushi (like southwest "sushi" rolls), some salads (decent), and the kids love the chicken strips. The tots are good but, I mean, they're tots so I don't really get the review I read raving about them. They have these avocado eggrolls that are bomb. Get those for sure. Oh, and your golf experience doesn't matter, all levels will have fun.

SIYEOtSnLCcdLHqF0Rg1Jw.text: Literally OBSESSED. Michelle is amazing... She made our night and seriously helped us with everything. And KEITH and KENNETH?!! These twins will make your life, so friendly and the best good luck charm!

Wb_-Ne73i_Hr62OKJbeRyQ.text: I went to topgolf with some friends from out of town. They have a 6 year old girl and were only in town for a few days so I decided to take them here because I had heard good things. All of the praise was well deserved. The service was great and he golf game accommodated all levels of golfing prowess. From the 6 year old who had never swung a golf club to my brother that has played for years. I would recommend it to anyone as a good place to get some drinks and have some fun. Like others have said, as far as activity type, it's much closer to bowling than golf.

iEz7mWu1aU-_6MpdJEPjdg.text: I went here for a work function and will definitely be back. Warning to the serious golfers out there, this place may not be for you :). It's a fun atmosphere whether you're going on a date or family adventure. The food is great. The only downside is parking can be difficult given how busy they are even on workdays!

74pImEAKBAogRsC5q7FvpQ.text: Reasonably priced, good food and drinks, fun place to go enjoy hitting white balls with friends.

FIJoOo5Z3UXFhDUSD0e1nQ.text: The owners of these places struck it rich. This place is a gold mine. We went here for some day drinking fun and fun is exactly what we had. Two people in our group were actually golfers who go out religiously every weekend and the other two of us have never golfed (besides mini) in our lives. We all had a blast. Goodbye to the days of bowling for dates and group outings hello the new era of topgolf. You can bring your own clubs or just use theirs. No renting gross shoes or being stuck indoors. This is a great place to hang with friends, family or even go for date night. Food is good as well and drinks were on point. Staff was busy but attentive and prompt. No negative feedback from this top golfer!

-ORbv2-u-jjrSbDT7_t0OA.text: Great place with a great concept and great food and beverage. Disappointed that our bottom TV never worked and there was very little effort to remedy the issue. As long as there isn't a problem you will have a great time here

IztKghYO_uHhiNB7hKSgKA.text: The good news is we only had to wait 90 minutes this time instead of three hours. Very nice facility very well-maintained. The negative is the organization from a management standpoint seems very disorganized. We had a gift card to use and not only do they not work at the lane terminal but we had to ask 3 separate employees and stand in two separate lines before someone could help us use our gift card to pay. The probably would not of been nearly as frustrating and not just waited 90 minutes.

x3GH4wIJnySWWvg8wLMfzQ.text: I am not sure how to rate this location.  The first part of the visit was not the best but we ended on a happier note.  I was visiting TopGolf for a friend's birthday.  We started off in the bar for brunch.  The food at TopGolf was amazing!  I had the Crab Cake Benedict with house potatoes.  Very delicious and full of flavor.  Thank you for the right amount of Hollandaise sauce.  Granted, we had 11 people in our group but the service was not great.  Most of the party had ordered at the same time with one latecomer.  The Bartender tried her best to come back and refill our drinks but the bar got busy.  We had a couple orders that had to be sent back and those orders took another 40 minutes to have corrected.  One of the orders only requested toast.  We tried to talk to the Manager about the lack of service and the missing orders, but he gave us attitude.  He didn't try to fix the situation and we had to wait for the missing food.  I recommend if you are going to have a bar with a restaurant, you need to have the staff to handle morning brunch.  The Bartenders cannot wait tables and handle the drink order rush.    Once outside, we were treated to a wonderful golf experience.  You will have purchase a $5 dollar golf license and this never expires.  On the bay you can play by the hour : $25 per hour open until Noon, $35 per hour Noon-5 and $45 per hour 5:00 until close.  Once everyone has swiped their card into the computer, you can play.  We had the best server on the bay.  Our server constantly came by to make sure that we had drinks and he even helped us with some group photos.  I can't remember his name but he was awesome!  TopGolf is definitely an experience.  I am not a golfer but I would come back for another round.  I like the setup of the bays and the various golf clubs they have for men and women.    For being an outside venue, it was the best chilled place in a 100 degree weather.  If you have your own clubs, bring them.  But leave the drivers at home.

S2tms8pi6A3nv5wDz5Mj4w.text: Not for golfers, more for novelty fun. If your not at all concerned about identify theft this is the place for you as to comply with their "registration" you must give them your drivers license so they can scan it, your e-mail address and cell phone number.  To begin with they have more rules about what you can/can't bring than the TSA does about getting on a plane. No woods/drivers because they didn't design the course correctly. You can't bring your own irons in, if you do you are limited to the bottom level (I thought this was top golf, not bottom golf?). We found this out simply trying to bring my 9 iron in and my Son's youth 7 iron. What is my iron going to do that their crappy clubs won't? If your a golfer how do you get better using anothers crappy club?  Upon entering I asked how long the wait was and the guy at the door said 45 minutes. Then after waiting a few minutes to get through line and pay for the mandatory membership per person I inquired again about the wait and she said she didn't know you would have to ask concierge which was another area/desk. When I got to concierge to "check in" the wait was now 1 1/2 hours. Wow, now that they had my money the truth about the wait comes out and it's doubled. Well by now we are going to stick this one out. So we went to the bar area to order a late lunch. Wait staff was very disorganized as we had to wait nearly 15 minutes before we could flag somebody down and get their attention for which they replied "Oh, do you want to order something?". Nah, we just figured we'd all sit at this table and stare at menu's for the next 90 minutes.  We finally got assigned a station and began having some fun, but the machine that dispenses balls broke down 3 separate times.   Great concept, poor execution and to me an invasion of privacy to comply with their registration process.

jE-94Fsiu-Y42i3OM37v0A.text: So awesome! lots of fun!!! Great fun, excellent active date spot, etc....Have fun!

vLfx_m-Rh3TRrILJt-uWew.text: Came here for a holiday party so I can't tell if this was business as usual. The staff are friendly, food was good. Gameplay is interesting but I'm not a golfer so my input is only on the experience as a whole. Very nice facility, clean too!

9nsZ-J5JZMms_YeRE8Dz0w.text: I just visited top golf for the first time, I even brought my kids along. The staff was more than helpful in making sure we understood how everything worked. They even made sure my kids had the proper size clubs. All the games modes really made it enjoyable, plan on spending an easy two hours here, you won't won't to spend any less, trust me you'll enjoy it. Plenty of things to do here besides just golf. We might just have to have a "business" meeting here one day!

ep0ZcBeRk23uARV9HAG5Zw.text: This place is so awesome! We had a great time here although it's a little embarrassing when you're not a golfer and are sitting next to a bay of golfers.but who cares right? Great place for all ages. You have to pay$5 for a registration card which I find odd, but it's supposed to be lifetime so I guess it's fine. Then you pay per hour. Make sure you tell them if you're not ready to start your time or else valuable $$$ will be wasted! You get your own private bay with a tv and either high chairs or couches to accommodate your group. Food and drinks is a la carte so your night of posh driving range can add up really quickly. The games they offer are fun but I still don't know how it tracks my specific ball when I hit it in the range. Technology is amazing! Everything we ordered was delicious although they ran out of a lot of food. No chicken and waffles, no crab cakes and no calamari. Bummer since I wanted to try all 3! The sign says Purell is located everywhere but I didn't see any and considering I'm a germaphobe, I would suggest having one at every bay. Lastly, they are pet friendly! You're forced to be on the first floor unless you're a service dog and then you can be anywhere. Will definitely be back!

Yw6yf0Nzpic21M9dKYgyZw.text: Lauren from Kansas City and Al are awesome! They took such great care of us for my husbands birthday, even treating us to complimentary donuts with extra Bavarian cream. Great place to hang with family or friends. Best choice for sharing are the flatbreads. The nachos are built as individual chips, so not ideal for sharing with more than 2 people like normal nachos.

hgfQ_-z7G2ery4vpuUkRQg.text: So much fun!!! Not much is better then a great evening with friends having a few drinks and hitting some balls. Top Golf is clean, fun, service is great, prices are good. Awesome fun for all ages!

mb2C4GXORKcdrKuWKoGgzA.text: Topgolf was a great experience with my friends. Our bay host Charlie was great and so was the hospitality shift lead Michelle. Best experience I've had here by far!!

5L9M180K3rszMsWJNn6L2g.text: Speaking as an avid golfer I know this review will not apply to everybody. I understand now that Tiger Woods is no longer relevant, and the golf industry is hurting and needs places like this to attract more people because it appeals to a broad audience. I got my grandfather a $25 gift certificate and it did not even cover one hour worth of driving balls! Be prepared to pay an extra five dollars per person for some kind of one time membership. You cannot hit woods, irons only, there was an old lady at the door making sure you did not bring them in the door. For a newly constructed multimillion dollar facility that appeals to golfers this is unacceptable! I was expecting for $25 an hour for all of our shots yardage to be tracked this is not the case. You have to hit the ball in the target for it to tell you how far  you hit it. Lame! from what I saw $25 an hour was the cheapest rate that you could play that is during the day I think it almost doubles at night. Some of the golf balls were so beat up I'm sure they did not fly as far as they should have which is unacceptable for what you are paying! I can go to PGA superstore to hit golf balls there for as long as I want and it tracks the yardage on every shot hit for free! But I guess if you're going there as a social occasion with friends then it's not a bad place to hang out, did not try the food or drinks so I cannot comment on that. I don't think that I will be returning here to practice, considering you can buy a bucket of balls at your local driving range for five dollars and have lunch and a beer on top of that and he still won't spend as much money. If they changed a few of these things and actually catered to actual golfers when they came in, it would be a pretty cool place.

5YNM1HHmasaSqDy7ixGVMw.text: Great fun for the whole family, even the non golfer!  Good food, drink and service. Service terrific by all especially Kim, Michelle, Karissa our server and Chloe. Floor manager Michelle even found us to say good-bye. We are out of twiners but already planned our next visit there.  We were there on a Friday night and did not have long waits for table and spot for golfing.

2HkoHnYw4_Dfs7D_VkNBHA.text: This is a great place to go and hang out with your friends and family. Drinks are great, food is good, and a great time ! There are 3 tiers to drive from and as long as you remember that you want to score points instead of just killing a ball it's sure to be a blast!

07ndCwSe0rPGsO0uJJ7ADA.text: Went here a few months ago for first time for work event and it was awesome. Defiantly nothing like a regular driving range at a golf course. Awesome atmosphere and great music playing. Will be going back for sure. Highly recommended even if you don't know how to golf or never really golf no matter how bad you think you may be you'll have a blast. **Note- you don't need to take golf clubs they will provide for you, lefty or righty they have both. If you take your own you can only take irons. Can't take your own drivers or hybrids, which was a little bummer but guess you have to keep playing field even I suppose. Still give five stars for sure

z2gbygDwi0S5gu_71YGV4g.text: This is a very popular "driving range" that turns the fun into a game and dinner all in one experience.  Unfortunately, it is so packed that you will likely have to wait several hours to get a spot on the range and you will pay a pretty penny to do so after adding up all their miscellaneous fees, food, tax, and tip for a family of 4.  I would suggest separating the golfing and the eating/drinking into separate events instead of trying to combine the two at Top Golf.

BFqNsjX3kt6fXvaU9pZplA.text: So much fun and a great location with an awesome view of the talking stick resort and their lights at night.  Night price is $45 for an hour. You get your own personal bay. 1 hour was just enough time for my daughter and I to play a few games and eat dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese green chili burger and pulled pork sliders

XAnAXrRte078W9uulZ2vbQ.text: Absolutely love coming here! It's a great night out for groups. There's normally a bit of a wait depending on when you go and what time. I have found it to be crowded in Friday's and Saturdays between 7-9. The wait can be anywhere from 30-90 minutes. There are 3 floors; I love being on the 3rd floor, it has the best view with the Talking Stick Resort in the background. There are multiple games you can choose from and it's a great way to have a little friendly competition.   The food here is really good and a lot to choose from. The crab cake and pulled pork sliders are my favorite. The best dessert which we always get is the injectable donuts. It comes with like 10-12 mini donuts and you can choose the chocolate, raspberry, or Bavarian cream to fill with. The drinks here also good and a variety to choose from.   The service here is good but it does get super busy so they do their best to be attentive but don't expect fast service at those times.   Prices might seem a little high but it's worth it and it's being split amongst however many are playing since it's a rate per bay. Also if you extend time and choose not to play; they put the credit on your Topgolf card so you can use it next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9ChkBneEql0-8A7Q240OmA.text: The balls dont count scores properly and their clubs are terrible. Overall a poor experience.

HtA7JLj6lIi_uEjEKS1xEQ.text: Went for the first time on a Friday night! It was so much fun! There's 3 floors to hit off- one is ground level. The first round gives you 20 balls to hit. After trying some different clubs and styles of swinging, you learn a decent way to hit. There's music playing in the background, food and drink service to your table, think of bowling alley style service. Best part is watch the people beat you to see how to hit better lol. It was $45 for an hour of golf, I think for anyone hitting, not per person, per party- but I didn't pay so not totally sure :)

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Night time hitting- each color gives different points based on where the ball lands

GlQrd3GpEPn43CHDTAOKUQ.text: If only they had a vegan option, I would give a 5 star.   I came here for a company event, the place is huge, fun vibe and staff. The drinks hit the popular list from an Old Fashioned and Moscow Mule to IPA and Bud Light. The menu is pretty chain-y with your typical burgers, wraps and salads. They do have a veggie burger but alas, it had egg. Whhhyyy, just go full vegan or don't bother.   As far as the golf itself, just to preface a little, I don't golf. I barely miniature golf and usually just recite Happy Gilmore the whole time. I may have done that a few times here. Okay, so, it's great for beginners! They have all the clubs you need for both righties and lefties (me) with the lit up stations to aim. If you're bold and aim for the back fence you get the big points! The views here are pretty amazing too. Seating is ample, comfy and accommodating with the outdoor heaters.   Overall, this place is pretty fun. Great location for group events. I just wish they would add JUST ONE vegan option.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. View from the 3rd floor
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sunset from the front door

hfM3YTYcz_hGIXYaZ0Eksg.text: I'm always recommending this place for any group activity that I can think of! It's great for the amateurs and even fun for the pros. There is usually a long wait (we waited 1.5 hours on a Saturday night) but they have pool tables and a few other games to occupy your time.   Food wise, tons of great snacks, with an impressive number of vegetarian options!

9Ium7DpiR4zRqfy04Ssf4A.text: A sporty bro - kinda place!  This includes a driving range, bar, and food.    Parking: Plenty of parking, but wow this place gets busy.   Wait time: It varies.  I came on a Friday afternoon, and we waited about 90 minutes. I have heard wait times on weekends can be 3-5 hours.    Bar:  Basic bar. Nothing special.   Food:  I did not try any of the meals, but we ate the donut holes. They were a fun choice - donut holes with syringes to insert raspberry, cream, and chocolate.     Entertainment: There are TVs everywhere, in case one cannot pull him/herself away from whatever sporting event is happening that day. Prices range, dependent on the time of day - cheaper earlier, more pricier after 5pm.   I am terrible at golf but had fun with friends. I'd likely not go back, less it's for someone's event.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Donuts

Hmtsr9IcqNxrVzhnIIZsfQ.text: I've been a Top Golf member for quite awhile and I went there on Sunday with a friend and the service was terrible, not only did we not get the food we ordered but the host tried charging us for the meals as if we've ate, I'll go to the Top Golf in Gilbert a try before I allow an employee to think I'd deceive them I'm appalled....

rm-Wuaoh0SJnrdNalNO6YA.text: I have no complaints. Good food, good service. My family loves going to top golf. Always a good time.

daOvNLnhbYBlFtx___vfeQ.text: This place is a lot of fun!!!  It is also one of the biggest entertainment bargains in the city.  Range prices vary a little based on the time of day but they are very reasonable.  Food and beverages are not only tasty but the prices are very reasonable and in line with most casual restaurants around town. the pickle fries are so addictive and we always get a flatbread to share, and draft beers are $4 -$6 bucks  The place is run by real pro's because everyone knows how to take care of you, from getting signed in or learning how to play a game or bringing your drinks promptly with a big smile.  You don't have to be a golfer to have a great time, and I recommend The top 2 levels for that unique driving range experience.

WsREgQWxxQiC70LwA0K7EA.text: I would actually give 3.5 stars to Topgolf. Here's the deal I like Topgolf. I have been to other locations in other states. Today I went with my father in law, sister in law and husband. It was a beautiful day. There was a 30-45 minute wait which wasn't bad at all and we were able to pass the time by quickly playing some pool downstairs. I don't know if we really even waited 30 minutes for our bay. We got a bay on the 2nd level. 2nd/ 3rd level is key! We ordered a bucket of corona lites and I ordered a margarita. We also ordered chips and guac. I will post a picture of the guac and salsa dishes. The appetizer is called chips and guac but underneath it also says you get salsa with it. When they brought it out, it was the tiniest guac dish I've seen and the salsa dish was much larger. My margarita was awful it was probably 98% margarita mix that was super sweet. Also it didn't have salt on the rim (on the menu it shows with salt on the rim). We were disappointed with the appetizer and I was disappointed in the margarita too. We ordered a gluten friendly buffalo chicken flatbread which was really good so the redeemed them. As always the golf portion is great and fun. Couldn't have asked for a more beautiful day.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gluten friendly buffalo chicken pizza
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. We ordered Chips &amp; Guac that&#39;s literally what the appetizer is called. The guac container is on the right and the salsa is on the left.
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

WZKwMr5f4o-1E1DO_YZvQg.text: Okay, let me preface this review by saying you will enjoy this place depending on who you are and what you like and how much money you have. I, personally, HATED the entire experience. First, you have to wait a half an hour to get a "Top Golf" card if you do not have one already (it costs $$$ too). Second, you have to wait more than an hour to get into a booth (or whatever they're called). Then, once you are finally in the booth, you have to pay basically minute by minute to stay, all the while there is a constant barrage of servers and managers pressuring you to buy more crappy drinks and bar-food. All the while you are just hitting balls into a big open space? Why not just go to a driving range...? Idk, I don't get it.  You've got to be ready to drop about $200 if you're going to go here. And believe me when I tell you they WILL kick your butt out the minute you stop paying for time. We stopped playing, and had barely gathered our things before a manager came and asked us to leave for the next group.   I understand why this place is popular. But if I'm going to spend an exorbitant amount of money on food and drinks, I'd rather go somewhere that serves excellent food and cocktails (that is not this place) without the constant pressure of wait and management staff.   Never again.

1sWc5XbjliXNLybE11OytQ.text: I've been to topgolf several times since they've opened and it's always been a really fun time. There are many reasons that make this place fun including the golfing, ping pong, pool and just the overall atmosphere is really cool. It can potentially be pricy but if you are splitting the costs of the bay with a large group then it can actually be really affordable. Anticipate a minimum wait of an hour and half to two hours on a busy Friday or Saturday night though.   The only thing that they can definitely improve on is the food. All of the food is what you would consider "bar food". Very greasy and not that fresh. I can understand why people would like this type of food to go along with golfing and beer but I feel like they have a good opportunity to really step up their game with the food.

YNrHV6NW71uleX5cKokw9Q.text: To recycle a joke from Pineapple Express (and remove the profanity), TopGolf is like if a driving range and a skeeball game had a kid, and then in a different part of the country a bowling alley and a Dave and Busters had a kid, and then THOSE kids grew up, met, and had a kid - BAM! - Topgolf! Time for another episode of Pros and Cons!  Pro: Options for everyone - there are difficult and easy golf games, all built around on the GPS tracked golf balls and large targets in the ground on the range grass and based on accuracy, distance, direction, etc.  They have clubs of all sizes ready to go, along with shuffleboard, pool, some TVs with sports or Xbox Kinects...  Con: Not that great for kids - a little dangerous if they're on the driving range deck - I can't remember if this one has minigolf (some TopGolfs do)  Pro: Servers take orders for food and drink and bring the food right to your station - pub and sports bar type options, plenty of adult beverages that can even come in pitchers, and super-American options like loaded nachos, Chicken and Waffle sandwiches, and injectable donuts.  Con: Had to go through a pretty extensive sign-up process for a guest pass - took 10-15 minutes - just seems like it's a marketing info grab and they could do without it.  Pro: One of the best times I've had, just a very creative combination of a number of awesome things  Con: Super big missed opportunity? When the cart zips around to collect the balls, all the computers should just say "HIT THE CART!" for a few minutes - everyone is thinking it already, and it seems like the GPS could track if you did it or not - just put a couple nets on the cart like sails on a pirate ship.  It would be an epic community event and would look super cool like a mix of "NYPD! Hit the chopper" from The Other Guys and the archers from the last battle in Braveheart.  Overall, stellar idea and decent execution

1XXWQsyBLbd6_-7YCp6z9A.text: Fun and inviting atmosphere. The waitress, Jamie, was very nice and attentive. BUT, the food was very flavorless and cold. I've had much better. 5 stars for waitress and atmosphere, 1-2 stars for food quality.

yHRylKENQNVgGT2MBtj57w.text: My first experience at top golf and will probably be my last. They don't care about first responders or veterans. We were playing our first round ordering drinks and food having a good time when the general manager came over and said we can no longer play because based on his visual experience we were too intoxicated. Then proceeded to give us our bills and asked us to leave because we are dancing to the music and having a good time. I thought that's what this place was all about but apparently not.

2GH66y31rtg1OAXJMguU8g.text: They said their staff was trained to not serve alcohol. We literally just got here and they said this. Denver was much better experience. Vegas was much better. I wasn't told why it was just - they are "trained".

HWgS1gOZ6B61XN5nj32Nrw.text: After a confusion in my reservation bay location this evening, they were able to quickly and nicely accommodate us in another bay. Thank you to the kind management! We always enjoy coming here and will be back.

B3paG1CMWmGu9I6e82-VCQ.text: This place is so much fun! Good times, good food! I can't wait till they open in Roseville!  Thought it was happening this fall. Supposed to be at Blue Oaks and Washington/65. Update: I looked at Top Golf website and it says Roseville location to open winter of 16' and Vegas Spring of 16'. I guess I'll have to visit here in Scottsdale area until Vegas opens!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Awesome times!

-tQQn2jQF8LHXE1t4CfIag.text: Top golf is a great way to get out of that Arizona heat! Two of my friends and I were visiting the area and reserved a slot on a Friday afternoon. The staff were all friendly and explained how it all worked.   I'm not that great at golf but still managed to have a blast! They have misters spraying to keep you cool, a couple of pina coladas help too.   They have wide range of clubs to choose from in a couple of sizes. The manager came by and offered some tips to help our game as well.   Definitly an hour well spent with some friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Rsuz1-COT5Zpxi6BRJlBgw.text: My husband loves golf. I don't. But this is a place that brought the two of us together and let us both play and have fun. :)   Before you go, you can reserve a bay at a certain time. Depending on the time and the location, you might have to pay a reservation fee. Seeing as how we went in the middle of a weekday in Scottsdale during the summer, we didn't have to pay a fee. Once you get there, check in is pretty painless. Each bay accommodates up to 8 people. You can bring your own clubs if you want, but you don't have to.   Once you're checked in, you just pick games and play for as long as you want to rent the bay for. We rented ours for two hours for 62 dollars. You also have to pay a 5 dollar membership fee if it's your first time there.   The servers were all really nice, and you can order food to be delivered to your table. The nachos and the chips and guacamole  was good. We didn't order too much food because it was a bazillion degrees outside and we weren't really that hungry.   Really fun place. Would come again, though probably not in the summer, lol. At one point it was 111 degrees, and the fans don't really do much. If you don't like being hot and sweaty, don't come during the summer.   You don't need to know how to play golf to have fun. It's kid friendly too...we saw plenty of kids there while we were there.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Kids meal

0o4dhSlUqdeBSw1WOFvc8g.text: I've been to this location a few times with friends! I love the view at night when you have the lights from Talking Stick Resort and the lights from the targets.   A favorite game mode of mine in addition to their signature game is TopScore - This high-scoring version of Topgolf rewards you for going big. The farther the target you hit and the closer you get to the center flag, the higher the multiple of points you'll receive.

Jig8LGTRzWShxBpzCPmK5g.text: Just like their other location, the setup is similar.   We tried their chips and guacamole. It was fresh and plentiful. Highly recommend it and it's perfect for sharing. It was so odd that our waitress (Alisha) magically appeared whenever we needed something. Needless to say, service was excellent. Fans and misters kept the areas cool. Perfect place to hangout for couple of hours.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and guacamole
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Red sangria

x_FguYZtyHJrxA3I6JhMww.text: We went on a hot afternoon to get in some swings. Quick summary...fun golf, poor service.  As with previous visits, the service is really slow and poor. Their servers seem relatively disinterested, when they're around, which isn't often.  Go for a great golf experience, but don't expect the food or the service to be any good.  The golf is great. Lots of different games to choose from, good clubs to choose from, and everything seems to work pretty well. While it is a little annoying the amount of advertisement they put up on the screen, the games on the screen work pretty well.  We really had fun doing the golf park. Especially when we requested the lounge chairs instead of the high top tables.  The food and service are poor. Maybe that should be expected, but for the price they charge, you would expect better service. Staff disappear for long periods of time, are slow to get food and drink orders out, and again don't seem focused at all on Customer Service.  Go, have fun, and have low expectations about anything not involved with golfing. :)

Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Range
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Screen

ejN9Z1uShUucqo16GV93LA.text: Only been here once but it was a blast. Who would've thought that hitting balls at the driving range while having drinks and great pupus could be fun? I loved all the dishes we ate and the couple bloody marys I drank. Can't wait for them to open a location in Hawaii.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PBhJVoTaG0B-slP6JdkkPA.text: What a cool place! This was my first time coming to Top Golf, everyone in my party had been before. We ended up on the top deck which was pretty cool. My husband and one of my friends are avid golfers so this was heaven for them, I hit a couple balls but obviously did horribly.   I disliked the fact that the fans were blowing hot air, and the misters did nothing. The whole thing is basically outside, so with the 115 degree weather me and my friend who were watching the guys play were so uncomfortable. We were only offered water once, and got no refills even though we drank our water within 15 minutes of getting our glasses.   We ordered a pitcher of beer, which looked way smaller than other pitchers, and came out warm even with an ice block in the middle of the pitcher. We ended up still having fun but it was so hot out and it didn't feel like our waiter or the staff really did anything to make the players cool.

TbRITjjgf0OEhrIwNZ3MvQ.text: My first time playing at TopGolf and it was great! This location has staff greeting you at the front door and directing traffic; upon your entry for the first time, the space can seem overwhelming if you're unsure where to go or begin. The entry way is filled with merchandise while the registration desk and nearby bar are in visible distance. We were set up on a lane in the middle of the three levels for playing. The staff at this location were very consistent in attending to us, a bonus! A staff member even came around to share his expertise on golf and offered his assistance if we needed it. With a nearby bar and televisions all around us, it was a very social environment as we played with people who later joined our table due to space. We played through the sunset (which was awesome to watch in the distance during our games) and really enjoyed ourselves. While TopGolf can be a bit pricey, this location makes for a fun night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. TopGolf View
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Golden Ale
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pinot Noir

PI6xojLOKnB7F5XQulBd4w.text: Attended an event here and had a great time! The food was good and they had a great selection of beverages. The atmosphere was very lively and staff was very attentive. I would highly recommend Top Golf for small or large group outings.

5sY095aEZV9s5GxrIA5mCQ.text: The experience is awesome! There's an amazing view of the mountains and Talking Stick Resort. I recommend going at night so you can watch the beautiful Arizona sunsets! The food isn't really worth the price, however. It's tasty food, but too expensive for the amount you get.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZXk9t0c5aJTwr9ld8a2UrQ.text: It was my first time at Top Golf and I loved it!!! Super fun and I was happy they provided LEFT-HANDED golf clubs! I went with my family and the environment was good! We had the chips and salsa/gauc and the gauc wasn't so hot. The staff were very welcoming and it's an experience I won't forget!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Top golf

Qq7I7jGyVEPYnm3BfsRmBg.text: For all my college students out there !! On Wednesday nights, they have college student discount night. I think it's only during summer so maybe check when this deal ends. They block off the bottom floor and it is 15$ per person for unlimited golfing after 8pm! They also have discounts on food and drinks: 3$ beer, 4$ wine, 5$ well cocktails, and 2 dollars off appetizers! I had a great time with a group of friends this past Wednesday & they have the misters and fans going so it kept us nice and cool! Super fun!

YmAJ1OQobGlfCwXQ59EWtQ.text: Make a reservation! It's very busy. You have to pay to make a reservation before 5 was $25 and after was $50. The kicker is that does not go towards your fees once you get there. It's a reservation fee, seems ridiculous that this does not go towards your bill. We set up for two hours of play which is $80, plus each player has to pay a $5 fee/you can choose a lifetime membership which is the same cost and then you only are required to pay this once. They have a good menu with lots of pick from. The drink menu also has many options. We had really great service and the heaters kept us warm as it was a cold/rainy day. We had fun but it's a expensive night out.
