mMMBLj2j_rtxe9B04GB77g.text: Def hit up the patio to eat, drink and be merry.  Come to drink, talk, golf and be merry esp during our prime winter months.  Lots of tvs to watch your favorite game.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles. And breakfast flatbread
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Bloody Mary at the patio.

95C4UyjiapuigJHur58ioQ.text: Awesome event that my company put on for our holiday party! I have always wanted to visit, and what better way then work friends! We were located in the main level where we had seven spots reserved that included a conference room. The room itself had a bar and offered tasty cuisines selections of lemon chicken, beef brisket, mash potatoes, brussel sprouts and much much more.  The customer service was outstanding and attentive and hitting off the range with a scenic backdrop of the McDowell Mountains.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

uqqM8k68XydAARVAtIxMig.text: I've been to this Topgolf location a few times now and it never disappoints! In a recent outing with my coworkers, we reserved three golf bays and had a blast!   The food and drinks are surprisingly good for a "sports bar" themed establishment and the service is always super prompt. Yes, it takes a little while to get everyone set up in the system but, other than that the experience was nothing but seamless.   Another highlight of Topgolf is the sheer number of flatscreens they have playing all kinds of sporting events. Seriously, this place is a gamblers heaven. Speaking of gambling...there's a casino in the distance called Talking Stick and you hit balls directly at it. Fitting ;)   I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Group outing!

v7jhlthStiXbpodrOu2cAw.text: Went here by since so many people recommend it and it was so much fun and we are not golfers!! The staff was incredibly helpful and we had so much fun we want to go back again tomorrow! It was the highlight of our trip to Scottsdale!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Playing pool inside to cool off
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. My son golfing for the 1st time

qg20T2_r2Xg4hy80zxnK_w.text: This place is fun. Lots of great food options and a full bar of drinks. I am not sure of prices as we were there for a work function so I didn't pay for anything. I did learn I really suck at golf while I was there but it's a fun way to pass some time and be competitive.

npoM49m9jKnovLL2tL44ng.text: Oh my gosh! How have I not discovered this fun place before now?! Well, besides that they don't have a place in Nebraska...  We are on vacation with family in Phoenix, looking for family fun and decided to try this out. What fun! They took our reservation online and we only waited 10 minutes when we arrived. Our time didn't start into we were ready (and adding time was no problem.) Their attendant walked us newbies through the process of getting logged into the system, how to be safe, and change games. Alcohol was served by wait staff (took a little bit, but they were clearly packed). The food was a little pricey, but not unexpected.  I'll try out their location in Las Vegas for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Colorful hotel as a backdrop

B6Gi7UuD23XW_VTi9OIRMA.text: Like a bowling alley for golfers! While I don't golf, like my husband, I did take a few swings and hit a few targets too!  With the mix of music, TVs, drinks, and golf, there is something for everyone to enjoy and worth a try!  While it is not cheap, know that you will have a good time! So grab some friends and head over!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AORo_CTnYzICpBzAenj86A.text: We celebrated our anniversary at Top Golf last night. It was our first visit and it was rad. When we walked in, a girl helped us get memberships and get registered. Then the concierge took us down to our bay, explained everything and made sure we knew not to "Happy Gilmore" it. We had a server, Zach, who was FANTASTIC. He kept our beers full and our stomachs happy. We had some jerky people come to the bay next to us, two guys who were super rude to him and he was just nice as ever. He suggested great food, we had the nachos and the bf had the chorizo and egg sliders and he loved them. The only reason this isnt a 5 is because I ordered the house salad with chicken and it was awful. The lettuce was wilted, the chicken was charred black, and it wasn't so great. But I LOVED the rest of the experience.

GqQGJQdr1ouMPWlL8Nni0Q.text: Sooo much fun!!! We typically pay extra for the fast pass to jump the line and it is worth it! The service could improve as every server that we have had each time is a bit of a scatter brain. The food is great and the drinks are delicious!

eXALK-dYo-OZ6UPokY5mtA.text: We had a great time at Top Golf.  The food was great plus we had an awesome time playing guys vs gals for my husband's company Christmas party.  Chandler took care of us during our golfing and was an excellent addition to a fantastic night.  He was very attentive and kept our glasses full at all times.  Not once did we have to look around and wonder where our server was.  Plus he had an awesome sense of humor than matched our own.

oPMXUcIQXCBlUF8EpdFVog.text: We have gone to multiple locations and this was the worst service we have ever gotten. I understand being stressed with a large group of people but NEVER do you snap at your customers the way our server did.

jzeWtjzzx2lOLYcmudtR0A.text: Was not overly impressed on Saturday ...really like the concept and everything...but the security staff and the excessive wait times ruined all the good it had going for it...don't look at the security cross eyed...they are a bunch of overzealous egotists who will not hesitate to 86 you whether or not you have been drinking...and if you question them at all they call the cops...even cops told us they were in the wrong...but then we got threatened to be permanently 86d..they just were not worth the hassle...oh and by the way the Mgr was even to chicken to come out and chat with the cops at their request...also when checking in was told less the 2hrs wait....that turned into 3 in a hurry...would better with a reservation system ...prepaid or not...just like if you wanted to play a round of golf

g3N-VV7ocMbck4rwbNbQJQ.text: I came here invited and didn't know what to expect, but I couldn't been more surprised. So relaxed with waiting service, a driving range with the casualty of a bowling alley. The fact that you can play games against the rest of your party makes golf a whole other beast - very nice.   I had way more fun than I bargained for and I will definitely return. I like the concept and how well they put it together. And the fact that it was 100+ degrees in the middle of the day, and they still managed to make it comfortable for everybody. I can see this taking off. For sure.  I will be back. Soon. Maybe bringing my own clubs.  (Note to self: Acquire clubs)

z9NjYSQR2olXXj4m23T05g.text: So much fun with a great group of friends and you've got to go on Sundays and try their Bloody Marys

Fa-R8CkiGeLOjfs7Ecrpyg.text: I had a great time at Top Golf - I had no idea it was a game and not just a fancy driving range.   Great for an afternoon outside

5yKj8Pfdn854USUYfDzapQ.text: Excellent time playing the various games and challenges. The burgers were delicious as well!!

unWP2alhuJTzSrZ8iaCEQA.text: This place is amazing, even for non golfers! I'm not a golfer myself, but I have had the best time here with my friends. Food is great and drinks are inexpensive! Been here day and night - at night everything lights up and makes it even more awesome.  The only thing that annoyed me was the fans. I felt like I was in a never ending tornado, but eventually got the fan turned off, thank God. only $45/hour.

VbSB72qNDgmTgXXAOqSbeg.text: This place is state of the art and fantastic! This coming from a girl who definitely doesn't golf and has only attempted the driving range once in her life. (That resulted in me being really sore for like 3 days.) My boyfriend works in the golf biz and we'd been watching the construction on this place like hawks for months. So glad it's finally open and so close to where we live!  We went during their soft opening last night. I know the first few days of a business being open can come with dealing with kinks, but all staff/service/amenities were completely up to par (GOLF PUNS!) and beyond. We were never left wanting for anything. Our gal came around plenty of times for food orders, drinks, refills and was awesome. She was also really knowledgeable about what they didn't quite have available on the menu, since they aren't 100% fully open to the public yet. A great touch. (Also? The bathrooms were PRISTINE.)  The food was pleasantly and surprisingly great. I had the nachos, which consisted of individual tortilla chips covered in "drunken beans" and topped with multiple cheeses (yes, queso dip is involved) and green and red jalapenos with servings of guac and pico for dipping. It was completely delicious. Boyfriend ordered the "mushi" (think mexican pin-wheel/sushi remix) that he said was outstanding and way more filling than it looked. I had two glasses of delicious and surprisingly strong strawberry/mint sangria that set us back $5 apiece. WHAT?  So, onto the actual reason of Topgolf: Golf games! Like I said, I don't participate but boyfriend and guys we were with loved it. It seemed glorious. You can either bring your clubs or used the standard ones they provide (for both men and ladies!) and choose between different games, i.e., hitting 5 balls in a row into each massive lit-up target on the range, hitting 1 ball into each target, distance competitions, etc. Each bay is fitted with a TV that follows your score and tracks your balls.  An aside: The view is freaking ridiculous. Camelback behind you, Talking Stick in front of you (which is all lit up in dancing neon lights now--I'm guessing they realized they have to make it look sweet with all the people staring right at the place while they hit balls.) All in all, this is such a fun place, and different than anything else available in the area for an afternoon/night out. Will it become super crowded/overrun with drunks during spring training? Absolutely! Will we totally enjoy ourselves during all other times of the year? Yes!

dTmbd1qhvG4ZV4kGHm0Fag.text: Girls at guest services were extremely rude. Sarah (with brown hair) and her friend (didn't catch her name) with blonde hair in a messy ponytail decided it was more important to gossip and finish their conversation than it was to help people waiting in line. Once they finally finished their irrelevant conversation they decided they better pay us the decency of taking our money. RUDE girls. Shouldn't be in guest services or employed by Topgolf for that matter. Not impressed. Hire some people with class, not some disrespectful teenage girls.

GRg0ruUmQB54Oh6m9vdSPg.text: The good: Very nice setup, amazing view, the chip ball technology, the game setup, TV's in each bay, music/lighting.  The OK:  Food was just OK, I can't help but relate it to being at the Brunswick Zone XL, it was good but not amazing.  The bad:  Price.  We were there for 2 hours with 3 people, we golfed and ate, it was $225.  I understand if we're on a nice N. Scottsdale course and we spend $100+ a pop for a round of golf and some drinks but to spend this much at a driving range just doesn't seem right.  I most closely relate this to high-class bowling and I can't see spending this much on a regular basis.  TIP:  Don't hit it too far, if you hit over the net they will know it was your ball that broke that car window.  This didn't happen to us but that is what they mentioned.  It seems impossible but a 250 yard high drive will do it.

uBvWjnkEXb3g1Stu3kfIFg.text: Simply amazing! The balls that you hit have a chip in them that gives you a number of statics for example speed and distance. The food is great and the suites are comfortable. Highly recommend this place and will definitely be back.

VizJfbqDQL0QgIHAvv2dGQ.text: Waited over an hour for some cold, soggy eggs benedict with bland potatoes. I'm normally pleased with the service at Topgolf but today was horrible. The manager came to let us know our food would be out "shortly."  after a hour and a half passed. Still paid full price for everything.

f-wuPOfoEK9lbGkSfJwIaA.text: I like it.  I like it a lot.  Came her with some friends, and had a great time.  Very fun environment and great concept.  What could use some improvement.  Service is slow. It was a slow process getting a players card.  There was only a few people in front of us when we got there and it took about 20 minutes to buy our $5 players card.  Then when we got to our station it took a while for us to get our drinks.  It did not seem overly busy and they seem to have plenty of staff so they could use some improvement here.    Food was not great, but wasn't really expecting that much.  Just your typical bar food.  Overall, I enjoyed myself and will come back.

1v5wYKWplIeSTXryACtnVw.text: Yesterday was my first time visiting this place (or even hitting a golf ball) and I already feel like a pro! $5 for a lifetime membership card that tracks your score, and depending on what time of the day you arrive, $25-45 per hour for a bay that can have up to 6 players. We got a bay with a couch which was REALLY nice. Everyone working there was friendly and helpful when showing us how to play. The balls have GPS inside that tracks where you hit them, and you get points based off of which target it goes into and where on the target. There are different "games" you can play but we only played the one the attendant set us up on. We ordered some cheese fries and they were delicious. The price of the food is a little higher than what you get, but its pretty understandable considering where you are. I'm stuck between being glad I don't live closer because I would sink my money into this place every weekend, and sad because I really wish I could enjoy it more often than I can. I wish Tucson had something like this, but we suck and only have bowling!

FTzNVAJBGf_QJO_p-tiR0w.text: I went here completely skeptical. I know what put put is.. and I do not accept golf. The onyl reason I went was because out friend hosted his birthday here. Needless to say.. IM HOOKED.   This placce was a lot of fun, it made golf entertaining for everyone and it has a nice lively feel. Modern music, lights, good food and drinks. Great atmosphere. Love it!

XoHzg4SBumXshgLGZGNjmQ.text: I love top golf. You can literally have never swung a Golf Club in your life and still enjoy your time here. The environment is always full of energy, and I've noticed that they periodically do themed events with staff. In my opinion, the cost of the individual bay is beyond reasonable, especially split up amongst a group. The drinks and food can add up though, which is probably to be expected. The music is always great. I haven't tried them yet, but I know they have other activities available, like Wii, pool tables, and a few others I cant recall. Definitely a good time, whether for a work outing, birthday event or even a nice first date!

XEynPWi8_os_MHKfhzRtag.text: BEST FIRST TIME EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE THANKS TO DAKOTA STORM! That's the man! Highly suggest if your going to try this place out ask for him! He goes above and beyond!

yjIim802IS5lH6cCrgotuQ.text: Really cool place to hang out with friends. Especially if you're looking for something new and refreshing.  The only con is there is always a really long wait on the weekends, but they have a cool game room with pool tables and other things that makes it better. They have a large bar- quick service. The wine list could use a few more options.   Once you get to your lane, there are tables where you can order drinks and food. I really likes the Nachos that's loaded with jalapenos chicken and black olives, MAC burger is a must. Their signature mushi roll I think it was called was mediocre, very dry.. Wouldn't recommend it. Our server was very nice and attentive. Over all it was a good experience and nice environment!

Xf9-aKxNOI5vOdwkG7b_lA.text: Great spot for some daytime or evening fun. Let loose, hit some balls, improve your golf game, or just relax and unwind.  Arcade style makes Golf more enjoyable and keep it fresh with different games. I love the food and drink aspect of it and then they have an awesome area for kids too.   Holy chicken and waffles this place is amazing, seriously genius idea and vision brought to life.

VjdSmXFKmoFnzN_MArxzrg.text: Every time I go there I get hassled about my clubs. I don't know who can reach the back targets with their senior flex clubs. I personally have to hit my 5 wood to get to the black target. The time after my wife brought her clubs and has only golfed three times and might hit a ball 100 yards. I had to put back 5 hybrids and 3 woods. More recently while waiting I noticed many people were not allowed to bring their own clubs in or bottles of water. I personally don't bring my clubs anymore. All these new rules are being put in because someone did something stupid while ruining the experience for the rest of us.  The front entryway is incredibly small and most people have no idea where to go when they get in there. The card desk and the bay reservation desk need to be together or automated like a movie theater to speed things up. If you go there any time after 5pm, you will be hard pressed to find a parking spot and have about a 2 hour wait unless you have a VIP card. Good luck! This place has plenty of potential but they surely aren't using it.

AuBuXUcktM2fw_ch9agUfQ.text: This was my second time to Topgolf.  I'm a guy that really couldn't care less about golf, but Topgolf actually makes golf fun.  The food is very good and service has been great each time.  Get there early because they get busy fast.

SEeOgRsVeiT7F9bqUVX2lw.text: About 45 bucks a game staff is nice but the wait times are about a hour or more on the weekends!  Thank you Trish S. tUFJrLJzZ8E95FKvF97ssQ.text: This is by far my favorite Top Golf location. Timber was my server this time and she was amazing! Food came out on time and she was so pleasant to be around and catering to mine and my family's needs

aaLw_rGce37CPSGkESrDXQ.text: What a fun place, a driving Range with a full service restaurant/bar.  Kid friendly too.  We had a great time here with 3 couples and one toddler.  The food and drinks were good, and the music was fun.

NUBkBDydZFLFIvJEOZCfZg.text: I wish there was a Topgolf closer to Jersey. My aunt took me here on vacation for a day of fun. I really did not know what to expect because I am not a golfer at all, and I pretty much hate mini golf (horrible experience as a child). But I was her guest and happy to do whatever... I was just happy being in Arizona, in warm weather, and with my family.   Prior to getting there, my aunt tried explaining what Topgolf was and I did not get it at all. She said it was bowling for golf at a range... still did not help. However, as soon as I got there it clicked and her explanation was really spot on (sorry aunt T, I thought you were crazy for a sec)! Topgolf is a 3 level outdoor golfing range with outside targets that scores your swings/balls (I apologize, I do not know the proper golf terminology yet). There is a screen (like bowling) you use to track your scores and compete. They have several different games, but we just played the rookie one since we were both new to the idea.  It was a blast and I am really glad I was open-minded and tried. It was a gorgeous day to golf with my aunt and enjoy some beers. Did I mention that have a full kitchen and bar?! Yea... it was pretty awesome. I could only imagine how fun this place would be at night with my friends....!

D0k35eM00noARoK2KQFpgg.text: I'll have to say as a first time visit here this place was great the food was good and the service from the staff was great the options of games to play on a driving range were awesome definitely not a boring night will definitely go again

BdJ3HKHGw_nxmqEAvIghwQ.text: Loved this place! Great idea. Fun time. I love the different game option. Great location. It's cool to see the casino lit up at night.

7hA1yf9o28wjoNDireTCjw.text: For people wanting to come here for a relaxing, fun night with friends, I suggest not to go here. 1. The prices are very high for an hour. 2. The people are NOT helpful when it comes to trying to learn how it all works. And 3. A waitress named Kylee, is very rude. I was casually playing a game with my group of 10 friends when we accidentally had more than 1 golf ball out at a time. She got in our personal area and took the balls and threw them over so we couldn't use them anymore. We had paid for our time and the use of the golf balls. It's absurd how a WAITRESS, not even a Top Golf employee, has the ability to do that. She was out of line and approached us with aggressive behavior.

rdhmBNb2dTkXZng-BXtenw.text: I really enjoyed the experience at Topgolf and would definitely go back again! Everything is still so modern and new since it was just opened last year. I arrived with my father and we decided to play two hours in the morning as it's much easier to get a bay in the morning vs. evening. Getting started was fairly easy although having to pay $5 to get a players card was a bit steep. There was a gentlemen that directed us to a bay on the 2nd floor.  We played a variety of different mini games and each one posted interesting challenges for us to overcome. I also saw the games room downstairs and that looked like tons of fun as well. It seems like a great place to go with a group of friends whether or not they are golfers it doesn't matter at Topgolf.

IbgfuhXo2qdL2ST0kKe3Mg.text: Coolest place ever! I'd never seen such a thing and am by no means good at golf, but I even managed to beat my boyfriend in a round. We need these in CA.

IHpYchcq4KZoWPuI_qJXrg.text: We had an amazing night there last night. Food is great, service top notch. My family and friends (none of whom golf) had an amazing time playing the games. I will be planning a compamy event there in the near futute.

6zwf1j2QB1U92y1szwlKwA.text: This is a must if you're j. The Phoenix/Scottsdale area.   This place is a blast for any and all ages. Even if you're not into golf I guarantee you will have a blast.   Think of a driving range/bar/dance club.   Can't remember how many times I've been here but every time has been fantastic. Each group gets their own booth with very comfortable seating. Atmosphere is very relaxed.   The service is very friendly and on top of it.   It can get very busy in the evening. If that's the case you can grab a golf cart over to the casino and when your lane is ready they will call you.

4aNIdwkVJBNDHFyIDmz2Bg.text: I'm a big fan of topgolf! I've been coming to this location multiple times over the past year and Everytime I always have a blast with friends. The food is surprisingly good! Don't expect a 5 star restaurant but definitely better than your typical bar food. This is a great place to come for big or small groups to have a great time enjoying food, drinks and golf!

p00SImfbaIrJMVtwBinZ4Q.text: Was worth the wait! Had so much fun. Recommend just renting a whole bay for a couple hours, up to 6 people can play!

oidHdXR4tXDEEfm8i_jJgQ.text: I am always recommending this place for  everyone,,,, we always come here we have a lot of fun, playing golf   , billiards...  that is my favorite place

6BrL__1UDpAp_3DAGW3dGw.text: Always a great place to relax and enjoy hitting some balls.   It's a must stop when in town with my son.   Food is good, drinks are great.   Great entertainment for the whole family or just adults.

o4s4hSRBp3V75TSvJfIMEA.text: Well I've heard all the buzz about Topgolf for a while..finally had to see it for myself. Well I was impressed! Topgolf is like a high end bowling alley but for golf. Best way to describe it.   You can rent a lane for up to 6 players for 30-60 mins. Everything is based on a card that cost $5 to register. I'm not thrilled about paying $5 for a card and that's why I left out a star. That fee as well as the overall cost is quite high in my opinion but if you split it with your friends then it's really not too bad.   The overall layout of the facility is really cool. There are 3 levels of golf lanes. I really liked this location as the backdrop of the mountains and TSR is really amazing. Plus come during sunset and hopefully you can get a lane towards the end and watch an amazing AZ sunset from behind.   Topgolf provides basic clubs here, but for a better challenge and better practice if you are really into golf is to bring your own. Just make sure you don't bring any drivers, woods, or even hybrids. They explained that in the past people were hitting over the net. I didn't think it was possible but if you were in the top level and were a good golfer you probably could hit it over.   What makes Topgolf so fun are the mini games you and your friends can play. There is top score, or try for top shot which makes you try to hit the specific greens. The balls are tracked to your players card so you can get an accurate reading of your shots.   They also provide service to the lanes, and your own TV which you can change the channel. Full bar, a few craft beers, and full menu. I didn't try any of the food but it looked like typical bar food.   All in all I really enjoyed Toogolf. If you are a military vet or police/fire be sure to ask for the lifetime hero discount. 10% off. Also works if anyone in your party has it which is cool. I've already been to this location a few times as well as the Gilbert location.   I think Topgolf is super fun. It's also fun for the non golfer in your group as well as women. My wife doesn't golf, but loved coming here to swing some clubs. You don't need to be into golf to enjoy Topgolf. Go try it for yourself and see.

MYwBH55vcW86v60Qnjx5Ig.text: Topgolf really isn't for me but truly an impressive entertainment hub. Golf, Food, Drinks and fun all under one roof. If you want to have a good time and hit some balls this place is for you. If you're decent at golf this place will more than likely bore you to death. If you're an experienced golfer bring a 5-6-7 PW you will be all set.

-zIA_NHFt65cdhY7Y4agEg.text: Great service. We were lucky enough to be helped by Trisha, the Regional Manager. She was accommodating and we had a great time. My only suggestion for improvement would be the queue system as you have to wait in one line to get a card that you bring to the second line to put your name on the wait list. Not sure why the first line couldn't just also control the wait. All in all, a great time. Would definitely come back.

DJSAFQ838yjKVf-sdYKuRw.text: Open to noon $25/hr Noon to 5pm $35/hr 5pm to close $45/hr Membership card $5  Food was great and the experience was worth the price! I had the chicken and waffle sliders and I can proudly say that I have nothing to complain about! To keep this short and sweet... I'll be coming here again!

EzyllNBUO75MkHqtNqLx7g.text: I've been to this top golf lacrion a few times and this trip we had timber. She was amazing so friendly. Not only was her service amazing but she made our experience memorable with her outgoing personality. Well definitely be back

2359COunw-n3KKCvWjzdTg.text: Showed up with a bachelor group around 7 pm Saturday night, and after being told there was a 2 1/2 hour wait, ended up leaving. $50 a person, per hour? Could've played a real round with a cart for less than that.

gYA80xnZBFOxV5rQwAms5g.text: Top golf was fine but the service was beyond outstanding! Chandler was a stud! Totally helped us out and accommodated with getting my military discount. If you decide to hang out here I highly suggest requesting service from my man Chandler!

U_gmwf1cbjn6cSqegVUkig.text: Our server was wonderful throughout the night and so was the food & atmosphere. However, we were half way through our food and our bay only had 5 minutes left and our server mentioned lengthening our time (we already did once) and we passed because we just wanted to finish our food and leave. We spent $100 at the bar and our bill was $270 at our table. This man, Richard, came out asking us to move to the "free" section mid bite. That was probably the most insulting thing he said as if we didn't just spend $370 before a tip. He kept going on and on about the "policy" etc. we would have understood if it was 8pm on a Friday or Saturday and it was packed with a wait but it was 10pm on a Tuesday and there were all free bays in sight. My family is in town visiting me and we were trying to enjoy each other's company. We are reasonable and if we planned on staying to "party" we surely would have moved. Our family owns restaurants in PA so we know customer service and understand occupying servers tables. Richard should have came over, said hello, thanked us for coming and made the bay idle long enough for us to finish our meal. He should have given her a table out of her section to make up for us staying there (which idk what there would have been to make up for.. a $55 tip..?) and just confirmed we weren't there to party. I have never experienced anything like this in my life and is a sure way to keep people away from Top Golf. Such a disappointment.

2Q4C12lBksOE-rTsgJt7lg.text: This place is lame. Long lines. Ridiculous requirements like not allowing an empty water bottle to be brought in. Food is average at best and overpriced. Unreasonable and unhelpful staff. I won't be going here again.

BJ4TrJtSnRS8_jdDWYhFdw.text: Super fun place! It's a driving range, bar, restaurant, and night club all in one. I came here initially with a group of my coworkers to celebrate the end of the fiscal year and even though most of them are not golfers we had a good time. I then brought my family back and we had fun hitting balls off of the upper deck. Yes, its a little nerve wracking when your 12-year-old decides to look over the edge but everyone had a great time and my wife and kids really enjoyed it as well. You don't even need to bring your own clubs, although if you're competitive you'll probably want to do so. Also, the food and drinks are good and no more expensive than any other night spot in Scottsdale.

sFHmgftxmTkiUu06xsRoJA.text: Came to Phoenix to visit a buddy and we decided to visit top golf and give it a try since Yelp review said it was pretty good. I've always wanted to try a range like this and Top gold did not disappoint. I would say the only down side was the 2hr wait but it was a Saturday night on a holiday weekend. We went down the street to eat and as we pulled back in the parking lot I got the txt saying our bay was ready. As soon as we got to the concierge desk we got checked in and taken to the bay. They explained how everything worked and the waiter was there right away to get our order. We started off with just an hr of golf but added an extra 30 min since we where having such a good time. Next time I'm back in the area I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Top golf Scottsdale

eA212dffWhvFcqfzv9MrSg.text: Perfect place to go and have a few drinks with friends! I go here almost every weekend  I was usually never disappointed until One weekend there was an off duty employee who was cursing loud. Loud enough for everyone around to hear.

TgFUeuXgJisdgEg2jPjq5A.text: We have been to this location before and had a wonderful experience but this time it was sub par.  The lady who walked us to our bay was not friendly. The manner in which she explained our options to pay for the $52 hour and a half were not very clear (apparently you can't just pay the $52 at the bay, you can only pay in assigned increments... so we would have had to pay $60 and then had an $8 credit on our club cards?). It was very confusing and the employee did not understand why we were struggling with the concept. There turned out to be an easy solution, but we had to pretty much drag it out of the person explaining the process to us.  Our server was super slow with waters and drinks. He seemed annoyed we only wanted the one pitcher of beer. When the ball dispenser broke he was in no hurry to find someone from maintenance to help fix it. When we walked out by him he didn't smile, wave, or even acknowledge us.  Our ball dispenser broke twice and we had to wait for maintenance to fix it both times. One time they did credit us with an additional 15 minutes.  Multiple times there were balls that hit targets but no points were registered. These were not identified as practice balls so they should have been working properly.  I have never had ANY of these sorts of issues with my other Top Golf visits (this and the Gilbert location) so I am not sure what was going on but we were not impressed.

x06KF_FOj0mJFyzG7vgfLw.text: Was a great time surprised myself with how much fun i had food was ok but the experience was awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Let the fun begin

aTM_8j1Zme7ySf3Fmouhxg.text: Keith is the man!! Totally helped us out!! We had a couple people who lost their cards... And he took his time to make it so we can have a lot more fun! Great employee! Made it so we had a really great time!

Pa4SXJT8tTer2MYyM2kodw.text: I should mention that I didn't actually do any golfing activities because it was 110 degrees and golf is lame, but I was there to supervise a graduation party for little kids while drinking several beers and eating delicious chips, salsa and guac.  This place is HUGE. There is a main bar where you can watch all the sports your heart desires, or watch people walk in with khakis and square shaped polos with checkmarks on them. Either way you'll enjoy yourself.  The best part about this place is the fact that there are rooms everywhere for entertainment, including Xbox on massive TV's. If you get tired of one area, you are going to find another comfortable place.  Great for kids, great for adults looking to pretend to be pro golfers, and great for happy hours. I kind of like this place!

HIe6FG8icVZG2DRMBHmPgQ.text: It was a blast. A great way to spend some of your day. The staff could not have been nicer. This place is great for all ages & skill sets. The area is very relaxing with comfy couches for those not golfing or those waiting. I felt the food was reasonably priced as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9o0-ul66eCYXLZtTGxvOZw.text: Brisk, calm and cool, just like how I enjoy my winter nights. Thought the night couldn't have gotten any better until the moonlight of a server Luke came along. His delightful words and actions made our Tuesday night a night to remember. Thanks Luke!

Wp6RhL4Y3zTN3PNHGR8VTA.text: I came with a group of five on a Friday night and the wait was about 30 minutes which is expected on a weekend. The staff was accommodating and friendly. My group and I had fun golfing and ended the evening having a great conversation with the team lead Michelle. We will be back again soon!

EX6jbdQpkdM2vdvOx96L5g.text: In Phoenix with my brothers. One of them had back surgery the day prior. We wanted to get out of the hotel and find something to do and being guys who love golfing it was a no brainer. First time at top golf. Signed in, asked for a bay with a couch so my brother who had surgery could be comfortable while we played. Alex came over set everything up for us, was very patient, friendly and was always around when we need him. He even kept the ice packs my brother needed for his back in a freezer and switched them out as needed. We started with one hour and we were hooked immediately. Before we knew it we had been there for 3.5 hours. The environment, the food and beer were all great. They have found a way to make a driving range fun not just for golfers but for anyone! From now on I am going to be planning more vacations in cities with top golf!!

18yiqsMQXhroiaMuQnqSrQ.text: I cant understand why people even write negative reviews about this place. Yes, the wait is long but that is why you plan accordingly. Yes, the food is nothing special but it's still worth buying.   Even if you don't don't golf, this is a fun activity. Not for serious golfers, however. This is a great change of pace from standing around a bar or club. After your done with your play time, they have an awesome game room to continue the drunken shenanigans.   I never pass up a chance to go here. It is too much fun!

Z_TXqx5MepZGoXSqy8zYcQ.text: What a place, not really golf, but fun golf related activities. The place is packed, must be a  hundred employees, a long line waiting to get in, people having loads of fun. A really, totally crazy idea for a place, but it works (not sure how long it will do so) and everyone seems to love it. You do not have to be a golfer or know anything about the game to have fun, all ages welcome. Also a good place just to watch people being themselves.

_VAFU9_VoqZAsz07YuyQmQ.text: Update...This has very quickly gone downhill :(  It's such a great concept and was SO much fun at first but my last few visits have been extremely disappointing. I'll use my last visit to illustrate:  I finally got a chance to bring my dad to Top Golf. I already knew we weren't permitted to use drivers, woods, or hybrids (ridiculous) but we showed up at about 11:15am this day only to be told that as of THAT day, we can only hit our clubs from the first floor. This was a huge let down for me, especially since I had brought my new clubs with me. My dad goes with the flow so he said don't worry about it, the first floor is fine - because of course I wanted to play with my new clubs. So we were sent all the way to the end of the first floor (bay 103 to be exact) where the computers were broken, everything was dusty and dirty, and we got no service. Literally 25 minutes later we still hadn't even sat down, nor could we even get water because there wasn't a server in sight. Thirty minutes later, luckily we finally had a server and the computers were fixed because we had two other people that met us there about 11:45 to play. Our server was overly apologetic and awkward but at least the food was good.  It would have been nice if they had just offered to move us to a different bay? Not sure why they couldn't manage to do that.   I really wish they would come up with some kind of system where everyone has the opportunity to play with their FULL set of clubs and if you hit it over the fence once, that's it - you're out. I understand life isn't fair and they are "fixing the fence" or whatever but it would be so much more fun if we could use all of our clubs, on all of the levels, especially the girls! My boyfriend and I were planning on doing the Monday night tournament together but after this last visit we definitely changed our minds.  If I come back, it will probably only be for the nachos.

POYmmygPkHAOwGAaB2qpDg.text: I watched this place being built and as an absolutely golf NUT, I was definitely excited to go check it out. It was pretty cool...a great way to get people who probably wouldn't otherwise golf to pick up the club's in a competitive, fun, drunken environment.   TONS of great food and drinks, music, shade and a misting system.  It wasn't at ALL cheap and it was kinda Mickey Mouse for True golfers...But for what it's meant to be it is definitely a fun time.

1LAnJhoWTJKlB1CBtJRJ5Q.text: Had family in town so we took them to Top Golf.  We weren't golfing during this outing so we were seated in the third floor bar area.  Our server, Dakota, was very informative about food and drink items on the menu.  He stopped by often to check on us.  The food was very good.  It was a great experience for all.  We will definitely be back!

iT298Dz5PSt2H_vVXr1P3A.text: It saddens me to leave such a harsh review but here we go!  Ill start off with the good. The concept of top golf is awesome! Glowing golf driving range over drinks ... Who wouldn't want to go?   Nevertheless, the staff was trained poorly. We were told it would be an hour wait (which was fine since it was a busy night). In the meantime we thought to grab a bite to eat and some drinks. We go to the bar upstairs, as directed, and were not acknowledged once by the bartender. I gave the benefit of the doubt being that it was a busy night. We go downstairs and before sitting, I ask the bartender if it's okay to order food at the bar as well. She gladly agreed. After 15 or so she comes to take our order but claims she is only taking our drinks order at this time. I politely decline as I stated originally that I'm here to order some food. She didn't seem too happy but it could've been due to the fact that the bar got busy in a matter of minutes.   Now it's time for us to go to our bay. I ask the guy at concierge for clubs because I am left handed and they don't normally have left handed clubs out. He provides a smart a** comment saying "have you really been here before?" Ummm yes I have but again I'm left handed so I need some clubs suitable for me .. He didn't realize that's why I asked and seemed embarrassed after   Finally it's time to golf! Our waitress upstairs was soo friendly. However they forgot to add the shots in our drink order. They brought over shots to stir in our drinks but She wasn't sure which shot had which so she  proceeded to smell the glass. A nose in a drink is not what i would prefer for a cocktail. I can't stress enough .. Top golf can be a great place for a fun night but I highly recommend more training for staff

5Ss6fbQo0BCovBpeLS6S5w.text: Tonight was one of the best times my friends and I have ever been to Topgolf. Usually the servers are nice but tonight, our server Chandler was outstanding. He was so welcoming and funny and made our time very special at TopGolf! Thank you so much Chandler, and thank you TopGolf for hiring him, he is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chandler is the best server TopGolf has! Thank you for everything!!
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Our server Chandler was the best server at TopGolf! Thank you so much for making our night :)

epdoqAdGwovyVb7E-ly5-w.text: The game is awesome fun but quite expensive. The food is more 2 star if that. I will come back to play but never to eat. I'll spend $50 bucks on the game but I won't spend $50 on dinner ever again. I had the crab cake sliders and it wasn't a crab cake. It was crab salad warmed in a microwave. Or at least that is what it tasted like. The nachos were ok but honestly Taco Bell has better and it won't set you back 50 bucks.

E2s6S-cfszL0SN7hdwkU5w.text: Bought a gift card here for my husbands birthday and were so excited to go here on a date night on a Saturday night. We show up and there is literally no parking, we had to park on the street and walk up the hill to get there. My husband brought his own clubs, 2 irons and a driver to use. As we walk up, a rude employee stops to tell us that we cannot use any drivers tonight because "to many cars were getting hit in the casino parking lot". Then she proceeded to tell is we will have to walk back to our car to drop off the driver my husband had, apparently Not trusting him to have it in his possession. On top of that we would have to wait an hour! Sorry. We're not okay with spending $45.00 for poor service, long wait and going to a range to hit irons. It's called a DRIVING range for a reason. So disappointing and now I'm stuck with a gift card were not even looking forward to using.

B8ZgNS6G1RXgR-8HGu-uVg.text: I would definitely recommend this if you have not tried it. It is pretty cheap if you split it between friends too. ( I think pricing is anywhere from $30 to $50 per hour it depends on when you come in )  If your girlfriend must come along like mine always does and doesn't want to participate she will take a while to complain about wanting to leave since they do provide comfy lounge seating and alcohol. The only thing missing from that "At home feeling" for her would be whatever god awful tv series she binge watches at the moment.

TKAmTMMgJLU8A6q6qv4u2w.text: What a luxury. It's like the concept of bowling mixed with the driving range. You're offered drinks and food through table service while you hit balls or sit with your buddies covered in the cool shade outside. Even the golf balls roll back up to you like bowling balls do at the alley. There's a scoreboard that tracks how far you've hit each ball if you manage to sink your ball into one of the colored targets in the green. Very fun and very cool. It was only $25/ hour and a bucket of bud light bottles was about $25 as well. Clubs are provided. Staff were attentive and friendly. I was worried about showing up in flip flops but it didn't matter at all. Didn't happen to try any of the food. One negative: The netting is an absolute eyesore to the desert landscape, but I guess you can't really escape that if you want to experience this unique driving range. Overall, a very fun and novel outdoor experience.

uGS48jYNu0liWZCM6T5dCg.text: Cons:  Scoring system can be glitchy. Not enough parking Expensive!! The pricing system (pay by the hour) is kind of a scam - the system is pretty slow and there's lots of wasted time. More importantly, when you try to extend the time, you have to add "credits" to your account and can only do so in certain increments. An hour and a half is $52 but you can't add that amount (have to add $75)! Bathrooms have only one towel dispenser and waste baskets are consistently overflowing. Food takes a long time to arrive and is luke warm. No 5 irons The "nachos" are basically a pizza  Pros: Fun time for groups! $3 tots are good and good value Reasonable drink and food prices $5 mandatory membership is reasonable

e4_x4Bcs5wMADTA71ZSHaw.text: Top Golf is one of the coolest outdoor activities in Phoenix! The atmosphere is chill and the service is great. There are staff members floating around making sure you have a superb golfing experience. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZOa96CW2nXoUBXlWUDlXyw.text: Pretty good experience for a first time visit.  Lots of un for everyone (17 people from 30-65). The food was above average, fast and professional service from all employees.  Avalon was our personal server and one of the best I have ever been served by.  Will go back.

ocLzPfjfJvxQZKE8_tz0JA.text: Our Top Golf experience started out as 1-star but quickly changed to 5-star thanks to Sarah at the front desk. We walked in as a group of 4 at 7:30 on a Wed night. We were immediately told there was a 2 hour wait due to many corporate and group bookings. The dudes in the blue shirts were nice enough but not what I'd call 'solutions oriented'. It was just a shrug and 'better luck next time'. went to the front desk and asked if this was normal and what should we do to better prepare for next time. Sarah ca.me to the rescue, told me about the priority passes and we were in a bay within 20 minutes. Go Sarah! The games are fun, the drinks cold and food tasty. Service was really good the whole time we were there. We didn't want to leave we had so much fun. We need a Top Golf in OC!

jbOB538BBqO4obNNQ7x33A.text: If you're looking for a fun experience with your coworkers, this is a pretty good choice.   Our team building was worthwhile here, thanks to drinks and some hilarious drives.   Service was good. No issues flagging down our waitress when we needed some more drinks. She was very helpful and cool.   The food? I took away a star just for the dry, lackluster food. We had the Thai chicken satay skewers and chicken pot stickers as appetizers. For the main course, there was the pickle fried chicken, beef brisket, green chili mac and cheese, beans, house salad with rolls.   All of it was pretty blase. The clear winner of the night was the beef brisket. And if we're going to talk about winners, we might as well touch on the loser, which was the green chili mac and cheese. Holy crap. It was unnecessarily dry and had very little flavor. It certainly didn't taste like any sort of chili, green or otherwise.  Aside from that, the location is easy to get to off the freeway and it's a little pricey, but it's an awful lot of fun when your target lights up at night!

CxRdC05j_cO2UCqoEiJdvQ.text: Great time for a bachelorette party. Callie was super attentive and made sure we had a great time. Definitely would go back!

Ajih4Tja_4HhlffKMMvCFg.text: What a genius concept! I remember being dragged to the range by my dad when I was 7 and hating it. If this was around in my youth could I have been a pro by now? Seriously, fun for everyone, experienced or not. The twinkle of the talking stick casino in the background adds to the ambiance. The boys competed for the far white and blue circles in the back, it was my moms and sisters first time holding a golf club so they aimed for close red and yellow circles (and were able to) and for a middle of the road (like me) I aimed for the green. We had such a great time we ended up staying 3 hours. I think we had a pretty awesome spot; bay 309 if anyone is interested. The drinks are strong and their food is consistent with dressed up bar food. I will definitely be keeping this in mind for group outing or random date night in the future.

na07efxwRzUs5WGMmDRklw.text: Topgolf is honestly great for any occasion and you don't need to be a great golfer to love it. Think bowling but golf! Whether you need a fun place for a corporate outing, birthday celebration, bachelor party, retirement party, you name it, this is your place! Not only is the golf fun, but their food and drinks are spectacular as well! (Usually at these types of places, the food is 'eh' but not at Topgolf!!)   We came here for a company offsite and EVERYONE had a blast. I personally, am definitely not a great golfer (like, i'm lucky to even make contact with the ball), however, I was still able to score some points and most importantly, laugh and mingle with my teammates. The balls have a micro chip in them so that they can keep accurate scoring. We nibbled on delish appetizers like shrimp cocktail, antipasto skewers, pot stickers, and queso. Their Moscow Mules are also on point (and yes kids, they come in a copper mug here!).   I will most definitely be back for another fun occasion, or even just a date night, again soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Delicious apps!

HXETgFjjwoo7oyLdJd_BUg.text: It was my roommate's birthday last night and she invited us to Topgolf! I have heard about topgolf before, but never was that interested. Atmosphere was pretty chill and the hip hop music 90s music made me love the place before we even started to play! We got seated right away for our reservations and I must say Brittney our server was awesome! She was very accommodating and provided great service! Other servers stopped by to help us and made sure we were doing great! I wasn't the best at playing golf, but all honesty I was there for the wingz and beer. Their menu has a great wide of selection to choose from! The sous chef Randy in the end stopped by to ask how was our experience and we wanted to say it was amazing. Thanks for the great staff for making our roommate Jujen's 26th birthday an amazing time! We would def go again!

gvkt-VY0MKLI_QMkXWJCrw.text: Fun spot to hangout with friends and family! Consistantly good food and drinks gets busy on weekends and at night but worth the wait!

RCAfawQNSyuP6orL0AKGYA.text: So much fun... like a Dave n Busters for golf. You buy a card for $5 and go to your station to golf! It's fun at night because you can go to the bar and drink. The Orange Creamsicle drink is bomb and so are the buffalo chicken sliders! It's $45 a group per hour but cheaper during the day!
