9QJeabUscirwapA_N9cJXQ.text: Pretty fun and chill environment. Order some food on the side and play some golf. If it is your first time here, the staff will show you how the play and you have the option to buy a membership for $5. We were a part of 12 but not all of us played. It was so much fun to just watch as well! Some of us never played golf so this was a first time experience. You can order food and drinks and enjoy your time. We played two games and it came out to be $180. After splitting with everyone, we ended up paying around $15 which is not bad for 2 hours of fun! Come with a good group and just enjoy yourself!

rUrQn9d9O2DUeMWMCw_u6g.text: I had heard about top golf and was ecstatic when I was in Phoenix to find one literally within a mile of the casino where I was staying.  This place is a such a cool concept and I wish there was one closer to me back home.  It's almost like a sheek bowling alley type feel, but outdoors with a fancy driving range with large targets.  They have heat lamps and comfy seating and casual bar type food and lots of drink options.  You can set up different competitions and the clubs are provided and score is kept digitally and shows up on a screen above.  The only major drawback is the place is a bit pricy.  At the end of the day it's a driving range and you are rotating turns and will probably spend $50-75 if you get a couple drinks and food and play 2 hours like we did.  Still the night was very enjoyable, and I would definitely go again.

4t_PPp525wKCQeDL9wwKMw.text: My first experience at a Top Golf was great! Darnell was amazing, he was very polite and accommodating with our needs. He was super funny and kind and made the experience great!

-8WP-iXIr7rKpQ0OfmJK7A.text: Got to try Top Golf for our company event.guys n gals together , the positives are it's great for team building and non golfers to have a fun time playing an interactive game of whack the ball n see if you can get close to the targets, and if you can't then have a cold one some food n try again.   For those that don't play they did have some golf "instructors" there.   My personal experience having grown up golfing but not being an avid golfer today, it was fun, I could see it being fun for a family a group of friends or a company party. That being said it wasn't hard to notice the golfers in the group they were whacking the ball 200 plus yards then trying to remain calm as one of the women or I never golfed players dribbled the ball 25 yds but outpointed then by getting closer to pin....  Love that!!!     To the golf guy it's basically a driving range with open bar and some munchies with the scoring  I would say it's a step above miniature golf it's a better date for adults with the added benefit of drinks n food as you play.  If your hoping to show your stuff be careful Top Golf May humble you, but if your looking to have fun, give it a shot. !

Literally a five minute wait until we could get a bay we're a family of four so it's pretty awesome. seriously you can't beat $35 for one hour of top Golf. Went downstairs to wait not sure if we wanted to stay, but ended up enjoying the games downstairs. Less than an hour later we were told our bay was ready. It is so much fun! Worth the wait even if we had had to wait the full time. The staff was really friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

vU9kNw02hmHSW0qmtZpaNA.text: Really fun place and can be affordable if you split it up between people. Food was great but the service was awesome. Eli, curly hair, super upbeat, -  was our server at our bay and he was a m a z i n g. Always checked in to make sure we were good, had great people skills and even showed our group a few pointers. I hope management knows what an awesome employee they have. Truly a fun night out!

p2qJHYF7Mn6lxOhQHHUY3Q.text: "It's in the hole!" Interestingly, no one in our group uttered these words during our visit to Top Golf in Scottsdale. Our office gathered at this Talking Stick destination for an early holiday celebration last week. Regardless of ability, this facility offers a unique take on the typical driving range.  I've played many traditional driving ranges. I've also visited multi-deck ranges. In spite of this, I'm not much of a golfer. It doesn't matter because what Top Golf offers, clearly appeals to everyone from the novice to much more avid golfers. Sure, you can step up and just crush the ball all day. Unlike more traditional driving ranges where distance is all that matters, this range offers a variety of targets and automated scoring. Points are scored when your ball lands in one of the oversized holes below. The closer to the flag, the more points you score. Low score is out the window. How wonderfully un-golf like!  Besides the beautiful setting and the amazing facility, the kitchen can produce some very tasty items. Our group played off of three tees and a nice assortment of snacks and desserts were provided nearby. The only flaw with our outing came at dusk as our time was winding down. Those of us still swinging and hacking away quickly realized how difficult it is to track a golf ball as the daylight fades.  Top Golf is a unique venue for group activities as well as individuals. I'm happy to have been introduced to this range, because after years of working on my short game at miniature golf courses, I feel compelled to bring my sons out here for an afternoon. Who knows, we may even see the Dalai Lama.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Beautiful day. Nice form. Clearly, not me!

qHautkRmp6eKhmOqVWHKtQ.text: Paige is the reason why I come here. The food is great. The people are great. The golf is great. The atmosphere is amazing. The management is so good. I have never had a bad day there. Topgolf is a very special place to me since that is where I had my honeymoon. Thanks TopGolf Scottsdale team!

WhzDegM043ypoHW00AXhLg.text: Topgolf is a a cool activity destination to hit up with a small group that enjoys golf.  I have been to Topgolf a couple of times now and enjoyed myself, but I just can't see the value in paying $45/hour for this activity especially when you add in overpriced food and drinks.  And you also need to pay $5 per person to "sign up" on your initial visit to Topgolf.  The machines are slow to switch between players and even slower at providing you with your next golf ball to hit... so even if you are hitting balls non-stop (which no one would or could do), you still would not be able to hit more than maybe 120 balls in an hour.  And most groups are going to waste additional time eating, talking, drinking, and just not focusing on hitting balls as fast as possible.    When your time is up, then you are asked to move out of that area within minutes, regardless of whether you still are finishing up your food and drink.  Mind you, this last visit happened to be on a Tuesday and we experienced this again.  With the prices of the food and drink, it's a fairly expensive "meal" where you get to hit a few golf balls.   I will most likely visit this or other locations again periodically, but the True enjoyment of going to Topgolf is in socializing with the people in your group.  ***3 STARS***

N6sLMjahzYQy4uSUM60wLg.text: We had a great experience here! Our server Josh was incredibly helpful and flexible with our service.  All of the staff made sure we were enjoying our time. We wish we had a location near us!

TlQRiEAh434m4X-OtEYXXQ.text: Super fun, pretty good drinking food, service wasn't great but I'll let that slide since it's like "bowling style golf" and beer pitchers were always full. Just recommend being direct if you want something. As far as the price, It's not cheap so plan on spending 40-50 a person for a couple hours of fun. If I was a local I would find a way to be here more! Awesome time and will definitely come back.

4LlpkWyFhoxBvNYEc6ZDuw.text: First time here, but I've heard a lot about this place over the years, especially the one in Gilbert. The young man who helped us activate new cards was very professional and friendly. He went over the rules and explained everything really well. I'm very impressed with the service here. We've ordered some food and drinks. If anything special comes - good or bad - I'll update this review. My only peeve is that everything seems a tad overpriced looking at the menu and the cost of gameplay for the allotted time.

xE9fh3KHpk_nbc3OjSOcQw.text: Such a fun spot for a day or night out with friends. You can reserve spots ahead of time (sometime it's an additional fee of $50!) or just wait for an opening.   Our group of 7 decided to wait around, especially because there was an area downstairs with cornhole, a pool table, shuffle board, and other games. It was really nice to offer this area for guests who have to wait. We also ordered some beer and appetizers too for a hefty price.   Our bay was ready for our group and we all had a great time! We're not the best golfers, so it was fun to try to aim for the various targets. Our server was friendly and attentive as well.   Prices are not cheap, but if you come with a group of people, it'll be more affordable to split the cost. Overall, I'd definitely recommend a visit here! I wish there were locations in California!

axqD-xCzujWjubq1PxbHGQ.text: The customer service here is 5 stars. There were a couple of issues but they went above and beyond to make us satisfied. Some things were out of their control, others were not but I can't complain. Fun place to bring your friends for a night out even if you're not a golfer. Everyone will have a good time guaranteed.

KjKySMLfxd38DUmLRRnGvw.text: Absolutely love this place, it's fun for all ages. Anything from family fun, to dates, to girls night out or bachelor parties to corporate events!  A really fun way to spend a couple hours.   If you haven't tried them yet, must order the donut balls that come with filling injection shots.  And if you have stronger willpower than  me and pass on the donuts, don't worry the menu is filled with so many other delicious options.   The drinks here are also good, and you can't beat the beautiful desert sunset views. Great place.

LaGO8NOohfAYXvy9NKRkSA.text: Great place to have fun and at the same time play some indoor golf. The food menu is extensive and has a lot of items for all ages. I've seen people come here and just eat instead of playing golf. :-P The pricing is competitive and every penny of yours is worth it.

eo-wPVH7ocXN8qCD5HyvBQ.text: I feel violated. I ordered a 'farmhouse' healthy pizza and it had ranch ... I mean who in the right mind put this catastrophe together. I ordered a pizza ... dissapoint!!!

pXzKoB0aRUXusJGjAiLMbw.text: Everytime I come here i have the best time I have been golfing for years so this is always a great place to come and not to mention they do have catering here so my company has parts here every year for new years or 4th of July, I cant wait for new years to come

C1hNtNwL_0Hx6bBeNvQqlg.text: This was my first time at a Top Golf and I can't wait to come back!! I'm already thinking: birthdays, date nights, you name it. All of the employees were so welcoming and helpful. Our group was just there to have a good time - we are NOT golfers. We looked around at others wearing gloves and hitting the balls so far and got really intimidated. All we were doing were swinging and missing! An employee named Darel literally saved the day and made our night. I cannot thank him enough and he's the reason we all left thinking it was the most fun night we had in a while.  He came over and gave us all a mini golfing lesson, one by one, taking turns. Then he came back every once in a while to see if we needed help and were having a good time. Those swings and misses turned into shooting star balls by the end of the night. I couldn't believe I could ever hit a ball so far!! We ordered food and drinks and had an amazing few rounds of hitting those golf balls into the fun different colored ranges.  I can't wait to come back! Thanks for an amazing experience! PS it's inexpensive too and did I mention super FUN?!

pmFm1PFscnFwEIKyZCcOdA.text: First time picking up a club in 5 years. The staff and ambiance made it super easy to get back into the swing of things-lol!  Too bad my score didn't concur.  No matter, we had a great time.  I'll be happy when the one in Maryland finally opens.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DrOdjccLERjpC-T5EK364Q.text: Great fun, food, drinks and service. I like going before noon for best prices and smaller crowds. Suggest using their golf clubs so you don't mark up your iron faces with their balls.

Ic28llMQoHu2AU2DNpsLTQ.text: Very fun way to kill some time while having fun with friends.  If you don't go with a large group, it can get expensive.  You pay by the hour, so the more people that can split the cost, the cheaper it will be.  You do not need to be good at golf to enjoy.  In fact, I'm a decent golfer and I feel I am at a disadvantage because I try to go for the further targets while my friends who have never golfed just aim for the closest targets.  We always have a great time when we go.  Food and drinks are very good, but are a little too expensive.

O84YbQXPgZnIGkNSBqmn5g.text: I lost my bracelet here and I tried to call there after I had left and was on hold for over 10:00 (still currently ) holding for a human to pick up the phone.  Awful. How do you operate.

ywfYJhN202DDGatFaxcLtA.text: The price will be $50/hr after 5pm, Friday-Saturday. They also charge you a $5 "membership fee". If each person wants to have a profile to keep track of their score, that will be $5/person to start our.   The "Rockstar in Training" in the green shirt, short hair, skinny boy said the wait would be "30 minutes to 45 minutes....you should get a text on your phone". We waited for a little over an hour, and noticed plenty of parties have come and gone. We went back to the Guest Services, found the same boy and brought the issue to his attention. He asked if we received a text. Obviously not, or else we would already be playing now. So he said next open area will be ours. We waited for another half an hour before we were assigned a bay area number.  TL;DR What a waste of money when you can go get a real experience at a golf course without this bullshit. This is our first time here and we are appalled by the customer service provided. Not worth the money and we will never return to any Topgolf locations.  Girls, feel free to dress skanky and show tons of skin here. The environment can be quite trashy. Looks like spoiled college students are willing to spend for this kind of service.

5-C8pp9R9JGVN04tciWwxw.text: Awesome spot in Scottsdale, AZ that me and my family decided to visit! We all had a blast and kids of all ages can have fun here! Food and drinks are icing on the cake for adults. Would definitely recommend and look forward to coming back!

ZCXA-Yj4S8aGJrMmkOGaKw.text: I highly doubt that I will be returning here. I booked online and the experience started off great, yet quickly went downhill. Upon arrival we go to our bay and get ourselves all set up. Once we get started playing a gentleman comes up and tells us that we can only stay for an hour due to an event. That is fine but why put us in a bay that you then have booked for an event? They did say that they could move us if we wanted to stay for more than an hour, but the customer experience from that is not par (no pun intended).   We keep playing in the same bay as we only intended to stay for an hour. I brought my own clubs as online it says we are allowed to bring our own clubs (online does not state if there are any restrictions to clubs). I am playing with my 7 iron, and then I bring out my driver and start hitting a few balls. Quickly a different gentleman than before comes up and informs us that we cannot use our own clubs. I did not want to start any sort of argument or make anyone feel uncomfortable so I kindly put away my driver and only played with my 7 iron for the rest of time.  You might be saying "Why not just use the clubs that are provided?"  I have a few wrist and hand injuries that require me to play with special grips to prevent me from having pain shoot up my arms when I make contact with the ball.  Upon leaving I start calling top golf locations and asked a few questions.  Me: Are we allowed to bring our own clubs? Rep: Yes, you are...we encourage it if you prefer your own. Me: Are there any restrictions on the clubs that we are allowed to use? Rep: Nope, you can use whatever you like. (Kind goodbyes between me and the rep)  Having a club friendly atmosphere is great, but it is not great if a staff member is going to just flat out say you cant use your club(s) or certain club(s) when the website and the phone reps say that you can bring your own clubs in with no restrictions?

crWVpmhQk14hftAguRyZEQ.text: My first time at this place and I will definitely be back. This was sooooo much fun. Not only was the game great fun but the food was surprisingly delish. They have a nice drink menu with a huge variety. And the staff was soooo friendly. Great customer service! Great fun! I will definitely be back. It's a about $50 an hour to play so it can get pricy with food and drinks. I would recommend going with a good size group so you don't walk out spending hundreds of dollars, unless that's how you roll.

9WAE7XWxnERYxyB5uTscaw.text: Fun for the entire family. We were in Arizona on vacation and wanted to get the kids out of the pool for a short time and we decided to head over to Topgolf for some friendly competition. Everyone enjoyed the experience due to the friendly staff. The added bonus was the great food and drink options. We need a Topgolf in Orange County, CA!

H5uIhU930xnLTrIW1OU8DA.text: Definitely recommend coming on a TUESDAY! 1/2 off bay rentals. Drink prices are good, too. The bartender, Stephanie, was very kind and made sure I was happy with my drink. Server at our bay was nice as well.

Mxfvbjb4Cg1Up3HB-nQfeg.text: Decided to have a ladies night..and had a ball! Despite theridiculously long wait for a golf bay (1 hour 20mins) we finally got a spot and commenced to hitting balls! Even though the temperature was over 100 degrees, they had misters on, so it was very comfortable! Good food, good drinks. Good times. Pricey, but everyone had a ball!

lL0a1bOxpd3LOiOJUwp-PA.text: I went here for the first time with my family on a Monday night, and while I had a fun time (because I don't let a bad facility ruin a good family time) the place was garbage. The service was incredibly slow, like an hour to get the food we ordered and probably 20 minutes for drinks. Our waitress was super sweet but the other workers were crabby and rude. We ordered chips and guacamole which you would think would be a pretty quick appetizer...it was part of that one hour wait I told you about. I mean I think they're planting and harvesting the damn avocados. Like I said, this was a Monday night it wasn't busy and I didn't see any avocado trees... Oh yeah and the chips came out stale. And the manager somehow tricked my uncle into purchasing Top Golf memberships when he was told they were free lol! But that was some kind of ridiculous miscommunication. Anyways, slow service, crabby workers and stale chips. I'd rather not come here again. Which is too bad because it COULD be a pretty fun place!

zAlVmY3fcuCM1WKVmajtGw.text: Madi and Ricardo were wonderful! I'm not Sure how old these 2 are ??? But they are two of the best servers I have ever had ! They took care of our group and when we had a spill it was cleaned up without most of the group knowing.  They were efficient, kind, and fun.   The food was good and the golf was super fun!

8GYfVTHVI01LpmzimRsarA.text: Pretty cool place to hang out with friends!    But I can imagine when the high heat comes..... watchout! Lol

bHJoXw4kX4AbrYbBeGLGuA.text: This place is great. Lots of food and great place to eat. Typical golfing in a driving range. But overall it's fun. Dirties everywhere. It's Scottsdale so I wouldn't expect anything other then. Waitresses are great. Warm, friendly and accommodating. Drinks aren't too bad pricewise and food was reasonable too. $35 for a hat kept me from buying one. But they got to make the money somewhere.

gnPtYBMeZZ_dd9SKgKpy9w.text: I come here at least once on every trip to Phoenix and now my lifetime membership card never leaves my wallet.  wait is usually an hour, which means baseball on the xbox kinect downstairs, a few racks of pool, or a beer at the main level bar.  I've taken people who have never golfed more than miniature and they loved it. the scoring, the microchip balls, the gorgeous views, drinks and food (both top notch, usually places like this skimp on the food and drinks since you are effectively trapped for a few hours).  I don't know how anyone can not love this place.  Few tips: if you are with new golfers, aim for an hour and a half to two max. once arms get tired it can get a little messy. also, people love to rent this place out (or a large portion of it), so check ahead of time and go during a time/day during the weekend that is not a charity event or company party.

oej_Dhe8GPB4-UsfRXbXEw.text: Can't wait to have more fun at Top Golf!  This is an incredible golf destination!  When I had difficulty on line, I called in and was transferred to the manager, Craig, due to a problem with the system.    Craig was amazing - making everything work out.  Our 2 sons are arriving from California and wanted this to be special for them.  That's exactly what Craig did.  Can't wait for many more trips to Top Golf at Talking Stick in Phoenix  Thank you!

Y-twvBPWBjLqAEV19wpGEQ.text: This is one of those places that makes a mundane Monday seem like a weekend.The concept is amazing and i love the bay areas.It's a great place to hang with your friends or even co-workers.Don't forget to get your membership its pretty simple. This place gets really crowded so getting a bay can be a challenge,Food options are vast special mention to the appetizers.The one thing that gets to me is the service one literally has to Stalk the server to get refills and food to the table.  TopGolf is not just all about golf(but it kinda is).If you are not the i-like-to-swing-a-club type they also have other gaming options, or you could just sit,relax and watch the others having a gala time. If you are in Scottsdale or plan to come here ever do check this place out.You will not be disappointed.

FP36yVoolUCsrlvM-aYQxQ.text: Been coming here for four years....from the valley so this (was) good place to come for food, drinks, and some fun. Unfortunately the past three times I've visited Topgolf the system they've switched to has not texted me when my bay is ready. Which as has been the ultimate issue coming here. And plus the "lifetime" membership they use to give you only cost a dollar has now switched to $5.  But has far as getting in and trying to golf has been such a terrible experience that I've decide I won't be coming back.

4uatoFKuD2BMzJ6N8rWvpw.text: If you've ever wanted to go to a driving range but feel like you're in a video game than this place is for you!   Three levels of driving range with bars on every level so you can have a party no matter where you are. Pool tables foosball tables and tons of TVs everywhere you look!  This place really has it all... A True adult playground.

q5z5M5qZoYbR6l3vxLxfCg.text: Topgolf is definitely a good place to go if you want to have a fun and relaxing night with your family or friends. This place offers a multitude of different things. If you wanted to, you could play golf, go shopping in "gift shop" area, eat good food, and watch tv all at the same time. Topgolf was a great concept to make but it does have its flaws. The biggest issue I had with this place was the long wait times you have before you can rent out a Bay Area. We went on a calm Wednesday night and the wait time for us in a group of 4 was 1 1/2 hours. Seems a little long for me considering they were not that busy and it was the middle of the week. My other issue was how expensive this place was. Depending on what time of day you go, you can expect to pay anywhere from $25, $35, or $45 per hour on Sun-Thurs or $50 per hour on Fri and Sat. This was all just to rent out an area and nothing else. To me, it's really not a place you can go all the time but I do find that it s good place to visit for a good time every now and again. On a side note, the staff was one of the things that made the experience that much better. They were all very helpful, attentive, and kind no matter what we asked them. They were truly amazing people.

kjG33UB7hC114VoCMaDJbA.text: Happy. Hour. Time! Many personnel. And. Slow. Service! Chips. Are too. Old! Good. Location! I. Will. Recommend. New. Management!!

zhzW74DK0HbV1UnxBZ4iqw.text: Great service especially for Platinum members.   Fun place for all golfing levels.   Food is fantastic, beer is cold.   I like going with the family, friends or solo to work on my swing.

b07OvmDNdZ8vUk8_T2Fz-w.text: Great place to hang out with friends. It's located right next to Talking Stick. Make sure you sign up for a member card online to save some money before you play. Currently the price for an hour of golf is $45 per bay (doesn't matter the # of players). The system is pretty easy to use for newbies.

SUaLtstVDi1yJnGvu0JrPQ.text: Don't come here with a out of state ID, I came here with my California ID they called me fake l, refused to serve me alcohol!!!! I have the new version of California ID ( under the real ID act). They should have update they ID book!

hhu4VMiewWwR8kFH0y_14w.text: It was alright. It definitely was not worth the $45/hour to golf there when we went. Also our waiter Lucky wasn't very attentive and forgot our orders multiple times.

cHojB_n7GEmJ7f80sfkw1g.text: Glorified driving range....  I gave this two stars only because I understand when people are in town you gotta take them out but YIKES this place is a RIP OFF. Food is good but then you see the bill and at night they charge you 50 to reserve or plan on waiting 2 hours NOT at the bar because it's packed and NOT downstairs playing pool or shuffleboard because that's also packed

mCke71gEAgBEQ7Vizpw2uQ.text: One of my favorite places to come whenever I'm back in Arizona! Been coming to Top Golf for a couple years now, it's always a blast whether you know how to play or not! Be sure to come with a group and you'll barely put a dent in your wallet. The food is not incredible but good nonetheless. The Mexican sushi is one of my favorites here, give that a try! The wait can be long so be ready to wait up to an hour before a bay is open!

DFKPDASfXoyW9qZL22oPZA.text: Came on a Friday night after playing at the Casino down the road hoping the wait wouldn't be too long. Rookie move... Unfortunately, the wait time was approximately 3 hours, and was 170 minutes more than we were willing to wait. The price per Bay is cheap with multiple players, the food and drinks were reasonably priced, the facility was nice, the environment was lively, and the staff was friendly. Just need to plan accordingly and expect to wait for a while next time I come during the weekend.

swOqN_UvZIYcM53TQRIKCw.text: We had party of 6 try to get into Top Golf Scottsdale the day after Christmas...wasn't happening...we then called Top Golf in Gilbert and they told us the wait was only about half hour and the guy on the phone told us how much better his Top Golf was compared to the Scottsdale one...we chose to drive the 40 minutes further away from our resort to check it out...we got there and there wasn't a single spot in the lot to park...we waited for a car to leave snd went inside...we get in and were told the wait would be about an hour in a half...that left a pretty bad taste in our mouth for The Gilbert Top Golf... We ended up going back tonight to Scottsdale...they never lied to us about wait times...and we pretty much got right in.  It was a fantastic experience. The server Lucky was very good, did a great job...the food was excellent, which i expected to be mediocre at a place like that.     Only issue was they messed up a grilled cheese sandwich, we sent it back, and they charged us for another??? I assumed that was an over-site, and some procedural error in getting new food out when an order is messed up...it was only $6.00 so not worth the hassle to go back.  All that said we had a great time, excellent and attentive service from the time we walked in the door to the time we left.

5aFwpNmFpeUyuefzKANG9A.text: On a Thursday evening I joined some work mates here for a night of golf and dinner and couldn't have been more impressed.   I'll preface my review with the fact that I don't golf, I'm not good at golf, and don't like playing. If this is you you'll definitely have fun here and if you like golf then you'll be in heaven!   We had an event reservation and a buffet style dinner. Of the offerings I enjoyed the pesto macaroni salad, the country style beans, the brisket was just ok but the BBQ sauce helped in that department, and the full yourself doughnut holes were super yummy.   As for golf I loved that they had some good tunes playing and at intervals the holes would dance with light in sync with the music.  The final kicker for me was seeing the staff really enjoy themselves. They were dancing, laughing, overall it seemed like they were having fun which I really enjoy to see.

ifhjHGkXb5BNQJtENhv3PQ.text: Fun and a great way to spend an afternoon!  We had an excellent time and highly recommend this place.

CCEKk0mvLGPto3VyjZC5bg.text: Food was very good. A decent and varied menu. The managers, Michelle and Sean, were phenomenal. Both of them were very friendly, conversational and really cared that we were satisfied.

nP6noVd1EOJfnb38QQw62A.text: Went there on a Saturday night just to hang out as there was a 2 hour wait to hit golf balls. My fiance and I ordered burgers with no cheese and they messed up our order. We continued to talk with our friends waiting for our food and it didn't get to us for another 90 minutes. They did comp the food but that wait was ridiculous. Hire more staff!

4xRKik5vcGpfLkOfZkkcLw.text: Took the kids for an afternoon of fun what a great time we had. Had done snack foods cheese fries and chip and guacamole plus some adult beverages. Flood not to expensive. Golf itself can get expensive so go early for the better rate. Kids overall liked the competition to see who could better. If you have kids better to be on the higher levels in my opinion. Can not wait to go back.

6j7ue33mOhZal6X9PgUbiA.text: I went to TopGolf the other evening and had a great time. It was like bowling, but with golf. My boyfriend who isn't a golfer even enjoyed himself. I was impressed with the other amenities, such as the pool table, other gaming activities and the service at your bay. The bar area is also nice to hang out before or after your gaming experience.

zEMpVdZc5hjFP8yOqaJ1Sg.text: It's a cool place, but not worth visiting more than once. It's a pretty place and unique in its build. There's lively music and really cool lights, but it's too crowded - and that's something I don't like. There isn't any parking and you have to wait at least 1-3 hours for a bay that reaks like cigarette smoke. I got bored after a while too because I already knew I wouldn't make it into the farthest hole and win $1,000. LOL.

7LuDJV-CrrskuUOkYQm0iQ.text: Michelle was very helpful.  She makes top golf.  I would recommend everyone come visit and say hi to Michelle.

hJRC7o-yZpQxsf7DYAP14w.text: I walked in Tuesday night after a long flight from LA. I sat at the bar hoping to watch the dodger game and have a cold beer and a burger. I was the only customer with in 5 seats. 5 bar tenders walked  by me time and time again. not even a hello , a few made eye contact but nothing more. A few guys walked in three seats down and got served a drink in less than 60 sec. I know it was nothing personal against me but that is not the point. I feel everybody in the place should greeted  me when I walked in,  yet not one single person at the bar did. I left after speaking to the manager and unfortunately I'm writing this review from another restaurant down the street. customer service and attitude are key to delivering a good experience. I will not hold it against them but they may need to revisit their customer service training .....thanks

ipKVZd0HUQ-hqR6fBFr07Q.text: Topgolf is a great concept, but this location is very poorly executed. The waiter didn't know one thing about the drinks we ordered, but at least he was pleasant. Every food order was wrong from the kitchen. The line to get a new card was moving so slowly, it was out the door and out into the parking lot, and took us over an hour to get through. The computers kept crashing, the registers went down at the bar, the game consoles shut down, etc. A waitress dropped an entire tray of drinks and a pitcher at the back of our bay, then disappeared. My sister had to grab all of our napkins to stop it all from running into our green! It seems like they made a recruiting run at the local retirement home. The (obviously too old) lady inside the front door asked us four separate times if we were new players within a 10 minute time period, and the parking nazi out front was the final straw. He wouldn't let us stop in front to pick up the rest of our party, just kept repeating "you can't park here" as we tried to explain we were just picking up. He was so mean and rude!! I guess if they're trying to scare off customers, they're doing a great job.

irKLLXj2uKHM8a5qOt6x-A.text: It saddens me to write this review. I am truly a big fan of Top Golf. I've played in Houston and it was love at first site.  I would rate the Houston location 5 stars. This location is the exception. The biggest strike against it is that it plays short... meaning you must leave all your woods (metal) in the car. The only thing you can hit are your irons. For a driving range, this is sacrilege!!!  Their "long drive" game is no more than a 4 or 5 iron.  Someone seriously messed up when designing this location.  To add to the disappointment, the staff (including the manager) acted as if I should be grateful to pay the high rates for the pleasure of working only on my short game.  Therefore;  I say "never again".  If you can't take the big dog out of the bag, grip it, and rip it, then how can you call yourself a "driving range"?  This location would be better off calling itself "Short Golf".  I felt like the director in charge at the time was the "Soup Nazi". Her attitude was "you will like it or you get no golf". What a shame for this brand.   So, if you don't really want to work on your golf game and all you want to do is eat, drink and hit some balls, you'll like this place once you get through the long lines and slow service. The "Top Golf" concept is amazing; however, the execution at this location is poor at best.

3aQF7KT1Cp-UspYMBQ46EA.text: One of my favorite places to go for fun, with or without kids. Great food, fast friendly service.

MCmUgnXwUmGIHp6ihZySjQ.text: You said 45 minutes, 3 hours ago. This place is nice for a beer and some basic appetizers but don't expect to actually hit a golf ball.  We just left after 3 hours. When we left they still said it was a 45 minute wait.

BeOVwwmQ9w-P9pGDouFbwQ.text: Completely rude staff. I've been there a couple of times before and didn't mind it for friends that liked to have a little fun. The next time I went they told me I'm banned from every location forever for trying to hit a ball over the fence. That's a joke! I get excited when I hit the ball further then 20 feet. My family was here from North Dakota and excited to go check it out. Instead they made me feel like some criminal since I supposedly made my golf ball over the fence. Wouldn't even allow me to sit there while my family to had a good time. I will never recommend any friends or family to go there.

_djVWUDJA4d7smj6hzD6Uw.text: The wait was long. They told us 1.5 hrs. But was more like 2.75 hrs. Bar staff was nice, hence the 3 stars

JvuaWiUI6pMN6ExmLAbCmQ.text: For someone who is not really a fan of golf i REALLY like this place. Its a great place to hangout, eat, drink and have a lot of fun. I only been there once and i can not wait to go back and do it all over again. it is also a great place for big groups. Thanks everyone at top golf for the amazing experience.

BJGOa3bD2agEvjCiVvMiUw.text: had so much fun!  Dakota Storm Parrish took amazing care of us.....Thank you!! we will be back!!!

bLiwono0ymnYBsxS8UubAg.text: Two of us go there to practice. One is a novice who needs practice with woods and driver.  They tell us it will be $70.00 for the first hour ($35.00 each). First shock, as we usually practice for about 90 minutes. So that means we need to buy two more hours. so now we re up to about $130.00. Than we are told we are not allowed to use our driver, woods or hybrids. We can use theirs. What good is that? We went to a local driving range bought buckets of balls and had a great two hour practice session. We heard they were "pricey" but this was out of line.

A0lBRgFELkqnxcFGTBja0Q.text: This was my first time here and man did it blow my mind.  You can drink, eat, and play golf in your own little area. Super great spot for a date and the crowd is cool too. Across the street is the Talking Stick Resort if you get too wasted or just want to gamble after.

hItQAwV34cCNr-Xa_gSqAA.text: Good food, good beer, and A LOT of fun. I do not golf at all, but I had an amazing time. Anyone can come and play and have a great experience. I definitely recommend coming here

_IAOC16b0C8VXI73ksPqjA.text: I've been wanting to try this facility out and for Fathers Day my wife and son set an hour session up online. We arrived to a big line waiting on the stairs to get in, to be told we had to buy a"lifetime membership".I thought that was odd.   We waited for an hour and the other feature is they want your driving license, which they claim makes it easy to populate your membership into the computer. Not convinced about that.   Once we were signed in we went to a third level bay. The hostess ran through the basics too quickly, but we figured it out. It was a lot of fun and a clever use of technology to track your shots.   We ordered some basic brunch items which were fresh, hot and tasty. Cocktails are expensive. Beer not bad.  My wife thought it was $25 per person before noon, but that was 1 hr in the bay. Good value actually.  We had fun and even being outside in June, the mister fans worked really well to keep you cool.   All in all a great experience.  We will go back in the evening and maybe they will get 5 stars. Good job so far TG.

NAzajaNoFJU7Q_ev6zU49Q.text: First time at Top Golf. Won't be the last. We had a company function there and TG took care of everything.   We rented a suite which included seven golf bays. We had drinks, then went to the bays to hit some golf balls and have a buffet.   The buffet was a fairly deluxe salad, chicken skewers, salmon and roasted potatoes. The food was okay. I found the entrees the weaker portion and the salad/potatoes the better fare.   The golf was fun. You get up to six people per bay, hitting 20 balls each. They have eleven targets and each ball has a microchip so it senses when and where you hit one of the targets. It then assigns points, if you want to keep score.   I'll return with friends next time but without the food.

0bjv-BG2wjb-M4UCYMdH3g.text: I have been going to various topgolf locations since the early days in Dallas and have seen the company evolve and continuously improve. Generally, my experience at top golf has been nothing but great.   Shuffling customers in and out of bays as efficiently as humanly possible is now topgolf's primary goal.   In the first 3 minutes that we were at our bay, I had 3 different employees come up and try to get me to login and get the game clock running. Ok, so we get logged in and got the game clock running. We started hitting a few balls, then decided to order some food and drinks. I only put the bay at 30 minutes to start because we planned on taking a quick break to eat some food (maybe 15 minutes tops), but how top golf operates now, once you cross the 15 minutes left threshold, a waitress will come to you and tell you that you are about to run out of time and would you like to add more. I mentioned we were going to eat for a few minutes then kick the games back on. To my surprise, this was not allowed any more, and once the clock starts at your bay, it must stay running or you are a worthless customer and must be shuffled out for the next, even if you're buying buckets of beers and multiple entrees. Okay, so I got over it, we kept it running and the waitress gave us a complimentary 15 minutes (reason for 2 stars instead of 1). We proceeded to order beers and play games for the next hour and a half. Towards the end of our last game we ordered a final round of beers and minutes later crossed the 15 minute threshold and there you have it, a waitress pops up within seconds to see if you want to maintain your claim to the throne. I kindly said no, we will finish out our time and head out once we finish our drinks. You'd think after you just spend $175 on food, drinks, and games that they would allow you to finish your drink at the table. Nope, we were awkwardly kicked out of our bay as the employees brought over some new customers to get the clock rolling.   From my perspective, I work in finance and completely understand where topgolf is coming from. If you are maximizing your bottom line at all costs, then top golf has found a way to do it. It's efficient and well operated. But at what cost? You may have just lost a customer for life because you value every second of the bay racking dollars instead of making sure the customer experience is top notch. My only complaint here is to find a balance with all of this. It just seems topgolf is losing sight of some important values it should maintain.

r5g3GL5YRtUqUxiVhqtHxA.text: Brought my husband here for his birthday. My advice: GO EARLY. We got there at 5 on a Saturday and only had a 20 minute wait for the top floor. That gave us just enough time to have a drink at the bar and munch on some chips & guac.   Since it was our first time we were escorted up and given a run down of how it all worked. Our bay had cushy couches and our server Kenny was prompt and attentive. Try the Mushi! Spicy and delish.   I've never golfed before so I was nervous I'd really suck and wouldn't have fun. Not so! I had a great time and my hubs loved the gift. One hour was all we needed.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Top floor. Flat bread &amp; Mushi (Mexican Sushi)

J3ojuEA7PwQBCtVz4wYWiQ.text: We showed up last night to Top golf Scottsdale and it was an hour and a half wait.   No problem,  we get it BUT, We were told to buy a membership card and to come back tonight and with that card they would "get us right in!!" That's what she said!! We show up tonight and the guy says 2hrs!  We told him, but it's not on him,  i get it.  Don't have her name but, liar! Must make commission off all the phony cards you sell.  First time we had been and only because we had our kids in from out of town.

vA9Ol1IwKYdxRubwzaQ2Uw.text: This place is a BLAST! Not what I expected. I'm not a golfer and my brother is and I smoked him at a few games. This place makes it an even playing field and super fun for all.

Pa95P1ROinbfEqRMrHrKiw.text: Despite the temperatures being 114 out, we had a great time killing an hour trying outdo each other hitting the targets. Our waitress was very attentive and keep the drinks coming and was so sweet to be our cheerleader when we we're hitting the best shots.  I would have gave all five stars but for some weird reason, some of our shots weren't registering.  We couldn't figure out if it was the balls or the just the brown target but shots that clearly went in that target didn't register.  Not a big deal but we were competing for favors so marriage happiness was on the line! LOL!  Can't wait until the Vegas location opens....such a fun experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

krEiPN8FMKOfNB3fCvqKfQ.text: If at first you don't get in, try, try again! This is what I told myself after visiting the first time on a Saturday night only to learn that it was a three-hour wait for a bay (the private golf areas). The next time we tried to visit, we came at a down time and luckily scored a bay right away! I'm so excited to see a place like Top Golf come to the Valley. My only question is, what took them so long and why don't other fun entertainment spots like this open up more often!?   Golfer or not, this is a really fun time and it's family-friendly so Mom & Dad can have a cocktail while the children play! It's like a driving range meets a bar meets a golf arcade. Now, if you are a golfer, you might never want to leave and if you aren't a golfer, this might kick start you into wanting to play. We had a lot of fun and can't wait to continue to visit, especially when the weather cools down!  Here's how it works.   1. First time you visit, you will go to the check-in counter and buy a card for $5. This card will serve as your license to golf and that means you can bypass the first counter on your next visit. You will also pay for the first hour which varies in price depending on the time of day: $25 an hour (total, not per person) from open until Noon, $35 an hour from Noon-5 and $45 an hour from 5:00 until close.   2. After you've signed up and purchase your card and first hour, they send you over to the concierge where they will set you up with your bay or put you on a wait-list depending on the time of day.   3. Now that you're set up, you can head over to your bay and start to play. The bay comes with golf clubs and a private area with couches and misters so even if you don't want to play, you can still hang out and watch!   4. The bays run by the hour, so when your hour is up, you can pay for another half hour or hour right at your bay, making it easy (and pricey!)  5. You will get your own server at your bay and they offer a full bar and full menu of tasty food.  *** If you just want to come and drink, they also have a full bar set-up so you don't have to rent a bay. ****  Tips:  1. If you're a golfer, you can bring your own clubs.   2. If you like to play with a glove, bring it with you.   3. Wear comfortable clothes.   4. You don't need golf shoes but I suggest you wear closed toed shoes. I played in flip flops and it wasn't very fun.   5. If you don't want to play golf, you can still hang out with your friends in the bay while they play.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. First come first serve bays, $35 an hour from Noon to 5.

XVLHIKG8deVc_LFBzK4e-g.text: OK so we were just there an hour ago. First of all after waiting an hour to get in we find that we have been overcharged. Another 15 minutes goes by and finally a girl takes all my credit card info and writes it on a receipt. Then I am informed I will get my money back in a week!! Next stop, the bay we have reserved. It has lost the reservation since it took so long downstairs. Attendant fixes problem and apologies for problems. The assure us they will correct problem and I will get my money back right away. They offer of free appetizers. Then the bill comes. Again, overcharged  This place could be great. It is staffed by complete idiots. I will not recommend this place to anyone.

1gF-fGZM8ykFcpoz1MlmoA.text: 1.) Nothing comes with your $45 "membership" 2.) Aweful costumer service - literally grabbed food from under guest and threw it away. 3.) Bad experience  Great concept for entertainment. However, our group member accidently grabbed food from the buffet in the back, he didn't realize it was for a private party. One of the employees came over and understandably reprimanded him. He apologized for the mistake, offer to pay for it and apologize to party. Although I tried to stop the employee, they took the fresh food from under him and threw it right in the garbage!   They ignored our solution and chose an ignorant one. When I reminded the manager that people die from starvation  + an animal was slaughtered for the food,  he claimed there was no other way to handle the incident.  ..so the answer was to GRAB THE FOOD FROM UNDER YOUR GUEST AND THROW IT IN THE TRASH??! Riiiiggghhtt...never going there again.

kXYwegjJAqq96xGto1ixGg.text: This place absolutely rocks! I have never even played golf, but this may be my gateway.  The service, staff, ambiance, and overall experience is fantastic! It's also a GREAT place to gather with friends.   I suggest going in the evening because it gets even better when the sun goes down. The lights are reminiscent of Las Vegas!

yOMG_3UJbXWwx6ygSIVTEA.text: The second annual birthday trip to Top Golf for my dad will be the last. After ordering food and drinks, it took nearly the full paid hour to receive our food, after reminding the wait staff we had ordered. They managed to squeeze out another half hour, which I am sure is by design.   Once the food finally arrived we played some more golf and decided to make the most of our time getting additional balls to hit after the time expired. While the wait staff was nearly non existent during our playing time they happened to be cleaning the bay next to us and decided to push all the remaining balls over the edge, because of an arbitrary rule of not having more than one ball out at a time.   Felt sorry for the people below and thought that could be more dangers than having a few extra balls on our faux grass. We looked at the posted rules and could find nothing about such a violation.   We decided next time we would just go to a regular driving range with a few flasks and will find another way to spend the $200 we will save by not going back to Top Golf.

ZOIeV2_xKRf-isB7SUJWqA.text: If you ever wanted to golf with Fido by your side, Topgolf in Scottsdale is your place.  The recently opened driving range lets you bring your canines along for the ride, who can relax on cushioned couches as you bounce off balls into targets throughout the range.  Its dog-friendliness isn't its only draw. Anyone will have fun at Topgolf, whether you're a pro with the sticks or not. Each hole has its own misted and fanned lounge area, with servers delivering drinks and food as you compete against your friends.  There are full bars on both golfing levels, as well as a rooftop bar, and fire pits and extra lounging areas give a great view of Valley sunsets, making it a bonafide Scottsdale rooftop bar contender.  For those who do golf, up to six people can compete against each other to score points by hitting balls into one of the netted areas. Rates are hourly, after you pay a $5 membership fee. It's $25/hour between open-noon, $35/hour between noon-5 p.m. and $45/hour between 5 p.m.-close. Divided by a group of six, that's not too bad, and I loved it as a new fun alternative to group bowling.  Something I wasn't a fan of was that woods and drivers are not allowed, only irons. A driving range where you can't use your driver?! Yep.  Apparently too many people were hitting the ball over the fence into Talking Stick Resort area. Bummer.  Still, it's pretty darn awesome to hit balls in cool air to Top 40 music.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The driving range
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Open air bar
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Topgolf lounges

d-IJzkt3XPXpiL36r9gnJw.text: I went to Top Golf convinced I was NOT going to enjoy myself.  I do not care for golf. Not even mini-golf, but my work was going for "team building" and I showed up.   The cost isn't bad - 35 for a bay, and 5 dollars a person for a card. I personally didn't golf, but the rest of my team did. They all raved about the different games you could play with the "micro chipped" balls.   The food was wonderful, the drinks were plentiful. Originally, we were in a bay where the fan was broken, so they moved us, and it was MUCH cooler.   The only gripe, is a coworker of mine ordered a burger, and asked for guac - the food runner was convinced the order was "not right" (though it looked right!) because of the guac - and the poor girl had to wait an extra 20 minutes while they "found" her food. They insist this made a new once since they "lost" it - but she was convinced, they brought her the original one. Food runners can be a necessity, but make sure they know people CAN custom order extra toppings.

h8SiSC4ciZK0rSAWgCfpJg.text: Excellent. Here for some drinks and team building. Mainly drinks.  Then Hank showed up.   We was already drunk.  Instantly started hitting on every woman he saw.  The he yelled, "check this out!  I'm going to see how many golfballs I can shove in my mouth!"  It was 7.  He shoved 7golfballs in his big mouth.

QDgI2QzO04GDr_gnDTZWJA.text: I wouldn't normally review Topgolf but I was impressed by Richard tonight. I was let down when the hostess took our player cards and never gave them back but when I returned Richard went out of his way (keep in mind this place is SUPER busy at the 7pm hour on a Friday) to make is new cards super fast. We always ha e fun here and for good reason. It's fun!  No review needed to let you know you should put effort in to get to this place. Thanks Richard!

zjGM6GF_8esXqwDHBqamiQ.text: Not a golfer but I think it's pretty cool to have a pro teach you for free while having a good time. He was so nice and patient with me... I was hitting like a pro.

cIHQ8csjXFTGxFZcvTdOyQ.text: Was overall disappointed with my first visit to the Scottsdale Top Golf location after having very positive experiences at the Gilbert location. We went with a group of 6 people and had a 10% off coupon. We presented the coupon to the front desk but decided not to request our bay until our entire group arrived to not start the time clock. We decided to share one bay rather than two bays because we were told the only two bays were on the first floor. The place was slammed on the Friday afternoon around lunch time. By the time our group arrived we went back to the front desk and were told that we would have to go to guest services to apply the coupon and pay, this would have been helpful to know the first time we went up because the line for guest services was over 30 people deep. We finally paid and waited another 10 minutes to be shown to the bay and were super frustrated to be shown to the first floor after already indicating we didn't want to be there. The staff member had misquoted the hourly rate for the bay and ran the wrong persons credit card for the difference so our first ten minutes in the bay was working to correct his error with no attempt to waive the misquoted rate. We got set up and our waitress arrived, service was decent, nothing special. I ordered a burger with bacon and fried egg, the bacon was super fatty and not crisp, I ended up pulling it off. I ordered a ranch with my meal but she forgot it so by the time she brought it out my tater tots were cold. From start to finish this was just a pretty bad experience, such a disappointment since I have really enjoyed going to Top Golf in the past. I had thought about going to Top Golf for my birthday next month with a group of friends but now I think I will have to find somewhere else to go.

KjB3d3UEvR5NdLIfYMgqyg.text: Been to topgolf a few times, came tonight for a birthday party. Great service from our server Dakota! He was very attentive which is awesome for such a large and busy place. Thanks for great service! The food was pretty good too, nachos were pretty different but tasty.

U8BBAQo13iNHfZ9k3qSCxQ.text: I have had my corporate company party here for the last two holidays. First year was about 22 accommodations and this year we had 40 accommodations with Buffett. It was very reasonable in pricing for each person. We had our own 9  bays and tons of food for everyone. We always have raffles and prizes to give away and top golf employees always met my needs. I recommend taking your friends for a night out or throw a party and have the top golf team do all the work.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. More great food and smiles
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Some of the staff enjoying the Buffett

bmvdLZHpmzwB0lVaImo4sA.text: This ain't yer old-school driving range. Remember back then?  You pay a few bucks, get a bucket of balls and head out to the line with all the other duffers.  You bang your bucket of balls out on the range, trying your best to hit the kid in the cart collecting the balls.  You never really know where your ball went, watching the 50 balls flying out there at the same time could get confusing.  Driving range, meet the 21st century.  It's all computerized.  There are actual targets that score your shots for you.  There's a bar.  There is food.  You are in the shade and on either side of you is a flat-panel playing whatever game is on at the moment.  Can practicing get any better?  You purchase a membership card that allows you to register when you play and track your shots.  There are clubs for all sorts of shots, men, women, left or right available.  Food/drink servers coming by with a menu.  You pay by the hour and as long as you keep swinging, the computer-machine keeps spitting out balls and tracking your performance for you.  Don't worry about it.  Get thirsty? Full drink menu.  Hungry?  Great appetizers.  I tried the Chicken wings three ways, BBQ, Buffalo and Asian Sesame.  Comes with dipping sauce and veggies.  Wings were crispy and tasty.  Next, we had the Chips with Guac and Nacho Cheese Sauce.  Chips were out of a bag, but they kept us supplied.  The Nacho sauce was okay, the Guac was fresh and delicious, the salsa plain and boring.  We golfed for a couple of hours and had a blast.  The building is three levels, all brick and glass, there are free video games if you are waiting for a spot,  and the restrooms are clean.  I'm not a golfer, but I would say Topgolf rocks.

iEw7XaiM8Qj0cBLvyXlbfQ.text: Yup. Gotta try it out. Too much fun even if you don't play golf. Bring your friends hang out have a drink. Prices very fair. Apps are excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great fun hangout. Even if you don&#39;t play golf. You have to try it.

Jr4D55CA7slowwh2KoPgww.text: Super friendly and helpful staff.  The whole place is such a great idea and our whole group (of 12) had an amazing time and everyone else around us seemed to be loving it too!  Never felt like I was waiting on the staff for anything, drinks came out quickly and time seemed to fly by while we were there.  I would say it would be nice to have a cut off time for kids so adults can be adults but all in all a super fun time...just wish they had one here in Seattle because I would go with friends and clients all the time!

cGg3nHz9V6DiqLoTTu5Y1w.text: My experience at top golf was absolutely amazing! Jamee J. was a great time and so energetic, fun, and attentive. A manager (Robert) came by and made sure our experience was great. Will be returning!

uQ-f0TqPpg6FVLze5Nng4Q.text: What a place!!!  Fun - exciting - clean - great food and drinks!! Service is always awesome!!

_UA_apGdXp6PqZzEguaLkQ.text: A Must for all those looking to have a great time eating, drinking and taking out some frustrations hitting golf balls.  Great experience for everyone no matter what your age or golf skills may be.  Overall Great Food, Full Bar (Build your own Bloody Mary Bar) and 3 tiers of fun.  Even if you have no desire to swing a club, I recommend giving it a try!  Only complaint would have to be staying away during the summer heat because the misters are useless and at night you are going to pay $45/hr for each bay. See You Soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Macaroni and Green Chili Burger - Lil bland but burgers are big enough to share
Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mushi, just ok :(

jMKakd3USQOQaOAO8qTysg.text: Topgolf is really what bowling wants to be - fun without having to rent tacky shoes.    Even though it was incredibly fun, the reason I give it 5 stars though is the obvious effort to offer great service.    We went on a Friday and had no problem getting a bay. We were met outside by some nice Topgolf employees.  Once inside, employees quickly checked us in and escorted our group to our bay.  For an hour it averages about $11 person.  Food and drink prices I thought were reasonable.      I also want to give huge kudos to our server - she checked back frequently and was super friendly.  Recommendations:  Get your $5 membership online.  This will save you a little time inside.  Leave your sticks unless you're so tall or short that average size clubs won't do it for you. Our group of 4 did fine with the selection of clubs they had at the bay.        'Sunday Funday' offers significant discounts.     We'll be back - What a great place!

gArulu--TWHppDRlWm4mew.text: What a fantastic concept. I really enjoy bars/nightspots that have things to do. This is putt putt for grown ups but better!(and a lot more difficult)  Every player has to purchase a player card, then you can choose to buy bay time in one or split it evenly among the player cards. Each bay has a set of men's clubs and women's clubs, with pretty decent variety (driver, 3 wood, hybrid 3 wood, a couple irons, wedge). The computer system is very easy to navigate, just tap on your name and step up to take how ever many shots you want for each turn! We were on the second level, which definitely helped a few of our causes on achieving distance in one round of play.  The only reason this review isn't a 5 is because the waiter service was a tad slow at times and we were there later in the night until closing, they weren't that busy. But great selection of mixed drinks/beer(bucket deals)/wines. I can't wait for the location to open in Ohio!

jnIWWw387bC45zgIFchpig.text: Place is amazing. People call it bowling for golf I'd say that is an accurate representation. They have everything food, drinks, a full bar while you wait for your tee box. The range itself is all digital it tracks your shots down to the exact yardage. It's sort of like Dave N Busters in terms of playing as you insert your card and it tracks your play as you pay by the hour. Definetely a great date or group spot. It is expensive but I think it's worth it.

BXsPyWi8MPLF56QMLqo4TA.text: This was my first time visiting Topgolf but I had a good idea of what to expect.  Lots of people drinking, golfing and just having a good ol time.  It's a beautiful complex and very modern.  We went on a Saturday night so it was pretty crowded.  We only had to wait 30 minutes for our own golfing bay which wasn't bad.  We grabbed a drink in the super cool modern bar and before we knew it, it was our turn to golf.    The golfing is fun - it's basically just a driving range turned into a competition much like darts or bowling.  Great place for groups or parties!   The food was actually above average for a bar!  I was impressed with the sliders and quesadilla.  The drinks were great!  Go for the frozen margs with a sangria float :)   Next time I go back it's going to be for sunday funday because they have awesome deals on Sundays and why not?

RRI6YD6vDdGyA5qm7jzjTQ.text: If you can handle a 1-2hr wait for a 'bay', then it's all worth it as long as you know what to expect.  We ended up waiting about 90 minutes on a Friday afternoon in the middle of spring training - had plenty of drinks and food at the bar.  Basically Top Golf is golf's version of bowling.  You get a couch, a waitress and a TV.  Then you can play a variety of games with your friends ... there are computer chips in each ball so the system knows where your shot goes.  You can make it as serious or non-serious as you'd like.  The scoring itself is a bit gimmicky - if you make one shot, the next is worth double etc.  Sometimes the chips in the balls don't register your score even though the shots go in a net (happened at least 6 times in 2 hours for us)  - We had a bay on the 3rd floor, and from that high up, even if you shank a shot, it usually manages to roll in to some kind of net for points.  So, if you're a terrible golfer, go higher up!  All in all, we had a good time.  If you are in a casual group and have inexperienced golfers, then this place is great.  If you are a hard-core golfer, then it's probably better to just go out an play one of the dozens of courses in the area.

iL24tU10AsSvu3Vn9lsoJA.text: Great place to hang out with friends and play golf. Amazing music, food and drinks. Will recommend to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fun place!

yEt5M3vvlUmKa7WrwhpxIg.text: Last night I was invited to join friends at Top Golf for a surprise birthday party. I had never been before and for the most part, wasn't disappointed. We were on the "main" floor and the view was gorgeous! The concept of a bar with golf and food is so unique. I loved the food btw! We got a mix of everything but the steak flat bread I had was perfect!   The game itself was okay but I mainly liked the atmosphere. I'm not a big golf fan. I really dont know if I would return to play, but to join friends again, definitely. The only problem I had was that we felt very rushed. We were rushed to start the games. We were rushed to pay for the games right away. We were rushed out of the tables after closing out. I don't remember the manager's name, she was being polite, but every time I moved I felt she was right there ready to scurry us out. Our server was amazing though! She went by just "Tay." Ive never had a server that I felt was like a part of the party. She was so easy going, which I enjoyed as well.  All in all I'd say you should experience Top Golf at least once, but it won't be my go to. I was told they have games for free there also, but didn't really look into it.

ApknKpmd6828lJNzwPZSCQ.text: Topgolf is a great facility with great staff. Great concept - makes golf fun for any skill level.  Definitely worth going at night even though the price is higher. Also try and get the top deck if possible, the view is awesome!!  We will definitely go again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. From the top deck

o-Ep5ze6rKIPgUgLJruqEw.text: So the golf games are fun, I do wish that it was more high tech. I had a really hard time following my ball so I with the monitors tracked the golf ball while in flight and not just if it hits the target. Now, we only played the topgolf game for a few fours so other games might do that. The food was fantastic, I had the chicken quesadilla and it was probably the best quesadilla I've had so hats of to the chef, we also had a chicken cob salad which looked good as well as chips and salsa. Maybe just a little pricey, between the quesadilla, chicken cob salad, chips and salsa, 2 beers and a sangria it was almost $70. Now let's talk about service, meh, it took about 10 min just to get water, then about 20 more minutes before we saw our waiter again to order lunch and drinks. The food didn't take to long to come out. I just think that our waiter could have checked on us more often than he did. We would have spent more money with drinks but we never had the chance to reorder. It's definitely a entertaining place, just a little disappointed in the table service. The service counter people that greet you were friendly and helpful.

s7U0pZQm1Z7UZay1X2fkGA.text: Had an awesome Saturday here. Food, drinks, ambience,  fun with friends. Spent a little money but paid morning rates which are lower. You gotta try this place out.

ByynnK3wiYGf1vlhyeGtNg.text: Brought a group of 8 people to top golf tonight for the "zombie ball." Showed up at 10:30 dressed to the tee. We were cut off before we got to the bar because someone said "I'm stone sober right now." The only thing worse than the price of golf balls is the management of this establishment. I've never felt more disrespected. I will never be back and will discourage all of my friends from going.

photos.caption: Photo of Topgolf - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Leaving top golf. Won&#39;t be back to this one.

mIV3-pUVwxIPIyOkNSYfFA.text: AMAZING! We took our kids over the weekend.  One of our children has a life threating nut allergy. When we were ready to order we asked the waitress if they used peanut oil and she said she would check to see. Not only did she check , the chef came over to our table personally and told us what was safe for him to eat. AMAZING service what a great 1st impression!  If you have kids and they are not really into golf as much as the parents request the 1st floor area so you can be near the game room. The kids could play inside and the adults can hang outside.

32L0TKU3YT8TAa5S6RCmCg.text: The food here is great and the service is pretty good too, but I wouldn't recommend this place because of the safety issue.  I've seen people swinging their golf clubs outside of the red zone.  And of course, sometimes there are more than 1 person in the red zone when one of them is hitting the ball while the other person was chatting.  Any golfer would know that having two people in the red zone is very dangerous and would be very cautious about it.  But this is not a place for just regular golfers.  It's for families or friends to get together whether they golf or not.  However, I did not see any of them got warned for doing what they were doing.  Again, great idea, bad management here.  Also, there was a golfer chasing his golf ball from his red zone to our red zone when one of my friends was about to take a swing.  Again, no staff tried to stop that or approach the ball-chaser and explain the safety rules.  Did any of the staff saw that?  Of course.  But it's probably not waitress's responsibility to report this issue as long as no blood spilled?  There is a good chance that I will get a feedback stating "we will immediately address your concern" but I doubt it will really be seriously addressed until a major accident takes place and gets on the news. So for the time being, I would avoid this place so I am not the one ending up on the news.

sgeKeR0H6rXyLPjYUqG9Hw.text: Food was good typical bar fare (3.5 stars is about right) . I don't like the fact that you can't bring your own clubs here. Heard you can at some of the other locations. I'll try another location next time.

K4MLqfEopZ0nWaLqCkhpBQ.text: 2 hour wait for a bay we didn't mind so much, since we thought we could eat in the interim. From when we placed the order it took one hour for our food to arrive!!!! Our server was very nice, but the wait for the food was unacceptable!!! Brought my husband here for his birthday. Never again.
